title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: *NOTE* Be warned it's not to a game ruining extent but there is an unfortunetaly large amount of people cheating in this game. Watch your death cam and you will see people shoot you through rocks and other solid objects land headshots while firing five yards to your left move and spin to headshot you inhumanly fast while in a firefight with someone else and much more. It happens seldom enough that I still enjoy the game but it can be very frustrating to fight your way to third place over fifteen minutes or more only to be instantly taken out by someone using cheats. I don't mind loosing to a skilled oponent but loosing to someone using a program or the like to cheat leaves a sour taste in my mouth.*EDIT 3* Alright so I feel comfortable recomending this game again now. Is it perfect? Absolutly not and keep in mind that while it is running well for me now I am still intermitently experiencing issues as are many of those I play with. This game REALLY needs better optimisation There are many better looking multiplayer games that I can play on the highest settings where as this game starts to break for me when I try to boost things abose medium and only runs consistantly smoothly is I drop things like shadows down to very low. However it is leaps and bounds better than the orrigional 1.0 release which was broken and buggy as well and they are consistantly patching the game I just wish they focused more on optimization and less on adding vehicles such as the van that or weapons like the repeater rifle and tommy gun that mechanicly don't add much to the game as they are not superior in any way really to the already existing arsenle. There is a lot of work to go but it is honestly fun and especially a blast with a crew of friends to play with. Just keep in mind before you buy it that I would only recomend it if you have a relitively powerful gpu and pc as a whole and a solid internet speed with a consistant conection.*EDIT 2* So we have the official full release. Yay. Servers are broken games load in while all you can see is the loading screan (but don't wory you can hear yourself die) all career progress and stats have been deleated and if you DO manage to get it working long enough to get into a match and actually play enjoy dropping through the ground/clipping into areas you can't get out of/having cars clip into walls and explode/having cars clip through the ground (though that one can be fun when you pop back out and are catapulted across the map)/people swiming through the air/furnature popping in in the same space where you are and insta killing you/and much much more buggy "fun". How about fixing a game before spending your resources trying to port it eh? Or at least try and get stable servers set up... I loved this game when it was working and I really want to give it a good review and recomend it but in this state I can not. Wait until they have fixed his mess of a release at the very least. At this point this game feels like were back in the early 90's when pc gaming was one part buying a game to five parts crossing your fingers and praying to the pc gods that it worked.*EDIT 1* So here is the thing.. I stand by what I said before about how fun this game is but in all honesty the broken state it is still in is really not okay. This is getting a full xbone release?? If it's not broken there cool glad for them but either it is broken as hell for them too or else it is complete bs that they haven't taken the time to fix the pc version (you know the whole reason they could afford to port the damn game) and did for the xbone. Sometimes the game just crashes and breaks my whole computer. In about 1/5th of my matches buildings take at least 3 minutes to load in which either ends with me unable to get in and being shot or clipping into a wall and getting shot. This game should be a blast and one of my favorite games but I have to change my review to negative simply because the state it is still in is really unaxceptable and I can't recomend a game to people when I can't honestly tell them if it'll work half the time for them or not even on a great modern pc. I'll change this back to a posative review once I see something actually happening about these problems. Until then I would say if you have waited this long to pick up the game wait a bit longer and see if it gets fixed with the full release. I doubt it will but we can hope...*ORIGIONAL REVIEW* Lol so here's the thing. This genre of game? Not really my thing. This game? A bit janky feeling sometimes tbh. This progression system? Slow AF (at least it is untill you get good haha I've still never made it past being the 3rd person alive so never having won a game I don't get that many points). And yet.... This game is honestly just a blast to play and I'm not sure why. Every round leaves me saying just one more and playing it with two or three friends is an amazing time. I'm sure that over time this game will get more polished and better optimized and all that good stuff but even as it is now and even if it seems interesting but you aren't sure it'll be your thing it's still worth trying out. You can get a lot of hours of fun out of this especially with some friends and some beers.

review: For what little time I've had playing it its blown me away with its supreme quality. It doesn't seem to take any shortcuts. It knows what it wants to be A Battle Royal game. It pulls this off fantastically. Though the price is high I think it is worth it for the quality of product delivered if you have any concerns about that. Please realize you're buying this for 30 you're getting something very niche it is fully worth the price. It feels AAA to spite the slight graphic bugs.If you liked h1z1's battle royal mode but hated the devs / bugs this game is perfect for you.If you like competitive games this game is for youIf you want head to head pvp combat in short bursts in a competitve enviroment this game is for you.I have only great things to say. I'm sure the only issues (the slight graphical errors in textures) will be sorted out.Worth a buy even for 30$. A MUST buy on sale.

review: After feeling an urge for a PvP shooter that had a different feel than the Overwatches the Counter Strikes and whatnot I discovered this game through seeing a friend playing it. I always felt the battle Royal game mode was somewhat born from DayZ and H1Z1 at least the way most people play those games Gear up quick and kill anything that moves. Sadly DayZ's shooting mechanics (and the rest of the game for that matter) remain half baked at best. Thus the Battle Royal mode was born.I eyed KotK originally wondering what the difference between it and PUBG was. After seeing the more methodical pace of PUBG without the absolute strict adherance to realism I felt I found the game I wanted to play.This is not a game to go into expecting to win or expecting to rack up as many kills as possible. My personal best is 12 with my first (and as of writing this only) win. The real joy is learning to think on your feet learning to be more tactical in your movements and engagements and the feeling of elation when you come out of an encounter on top.If you like the idea of what essentially is a deathmatch on a massive map where it's just as important to sit and observe as it is to frantically move around to avoid getting shot and that unique feeling you get when it's down to you and a handful of other heavilly armed players in a field looking to be the last man standing then this is the game for you.Thigs to note As of writing the game is in early access. Crashes are somewhat common. However the dev team has thus far proven to be very proactice on patches that improve stability performance and playability. Bonus that they prioritize such over just blindly adding content. Thankfully there are no microtransactions or paid lootboxs while the game is in early access. The devs have stated they will include them but not until they have left Early Access. Individual matches can run upwards of 30 35 minutes depending on how you play. I would HIGHLY recommend playing with a good headset. It will save you more times than you can imagine.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG The Review.At first glance the game does not appear to pack $30 of content. One map the norm face editor upon first launch and a UI that may confuse some.But Content is not where the value is (at this time). Given some credit as an early access title the value is purely the experience.As my first multiplayer "Battle Royal" that I've had interest in PUBG takes whatever style you play by and turn into a primal survival instinct forcing to adapt in the process. How your skill develops is dynamic you must truly adapt to survive. Whether to move around or sit still to engage another player or not to engage or whether to stalk another opponent or lure them to you... All while trying to stay in bounds of the shrinking safe zone.Contemplating on buying? Look at 2 or three youtube videos. Thats what I did and now I own it. I truly hope it maintains momentum and that dev's with their newfound fortunes can make this a true masterpiece at final release!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. so far i have many matches and wins under my belt and i can easily say that this game has become a contender for one of my favorite games. coming from having around 900 hours on arma 3 to this i am very happy that the control scheme is very similar. im running on a FX 6300 and GTX 1070sc and i average about 90 fps in game so thats another plus. my only real complaints about the game are as follows UNSTABLEin my experience this game is extremely unstable. it tends to crash to the point where i must hard reset the PC. (early access blah blah blah) HITBOXESi have found that ADS with particular guns such as handgun is entirely bugged and your rounds will not go where you are aming SOUNDmy last issue is that Plane/Wind tend to be overpowering to the point where i cant hear either my teammates or anything else around me. Not good in a FFA.Overall i recommend this title as its very addicting and a blast with friends. Once you get that first win the hunger for more gets ya.7/10

review: (EDIT SECTION)(THE BAD Somewhere along the way this game got raided by the general ry that enjoys breaking games with hacks. I have a large dislike for people who enjoy destroying great games with buffoonery that should be the domain of those who find single player games too challenging. I have hopes that Bluehole will find a way to stop these people but hold little hope do to number of people dedicated to perverse methods of fun. THE GOOD Since buying the game months ago I have put hundreds of hours into this game and I will continue to play it. The amount of enjoyment I get out of this game is not ruined by the people who choose to abuse the loopholes. Since the beginning I have seen consistent improvements in how the game runs on my PC. And while there are still incidents that are frustrating the generally happen early and if you die you can restart with the loss of minutes. New guns and continued developer involvement give me hope that we might one day see a full game that continues to have support. THE FUTURE Like all opinionated people on the internet I have desires of where I would like to see things go to. The possibility to of a rough ranking system for matches seems like a good place to start. this could help keep us middling skilled players from being matched with cheaters who regularly score well do to there ill gotten advantages and put them in the realm of the more skilled and streamers who have more abilities to identify and end these players involvement in the game. Any method to permanently ban proven hackers accounts can only add to the bank for BlueHole as these people will most likely continue to buy new copies of the game in order to have their "Fun" or perhaps they might just move on to a new title. Every other thing I would currently like to see in the game appears to be coming in the new update that is currently on test servers.)(END EDIT)I loved the idea of Battle Royale games since the first day I saw h1z1. So I bought it. But for gods sake I am a fairly old school first person and third person shooter but I couldn't get a kill on that game to save my life and just could not get into it. Yet I loved the idea of the game style. Fast forward a few months and I watched a couple of streamers playing this game and I rather liked what I saw. So I took the risk that I would not like it and bought into the early access.This is one of the few games that engaged me to such a degree that I would continue to jump out of my seat when I was shot fifty hours in. It sucked me in and left me wanting more. I can't put my finger on the reasons why I liked it so much. But in my reckoning it beat h1z1 kotk largely do to the engine attachments and hitboxes. The driving in the game is very manageable and the transition from third to first person is seamless. I am not great at this game but I usually manage some kills and top thirty or better. Its just fun as hell. Now this is not Call of Duty. You do something stupid you game instance is over. Kaput. You do everything pretty well but some guy third person scouts you through one of a hundred windows and your dead. Kaput over for that instance. That though is part of the beauty of the game. Each time you queue for a game in solo you have a 1 in 96 100 chance of winning. Everyone else is a loser. The game for me broke after about 44 hours. By broke I mean the servers where dropping so many packets so frequently that things would go nutty as all get out. On my screen I would be moving the right direction on my roommates computer sitting right next to me I would be moving into the shock field. I would approach an enemy and pop a few round into them and then die because the server read he killed me yet he never fired a round on my screen. Despite this break which is currently supposed to be fixed I am waiting on confirmation it was one of the best games I have played as far as engagement for me personally since james bond golden eye. I would totally recommend you pick this game up if they fix the server packet dropping problem and you don't mind spending fifteen minutes walking around and then dying without ever seeing who kills you.Pulled from PUBG website "We are very aware of the issues you have seen on our servers over the last week and we have been working hard to resolve them. Simply put this is not any issue with the number of servers we have for players but rather it is down to the optimization of the server code. Over the last week we rolled out daily updated to the servers to improve profiling of optimization bottlenecks and yesterday these actions finally paid off! We found a bug within the Unreal Engine core code which led the server to believe that it was being DDoS ed due to the number of packets being sent between the clients and the server. When this detection was triggered on the server it would drop 90% of packets received resulting in the lag/rubberbanding seen over the past week. We pushed a hotfix to the servers earlier today which should resolve these issues. We will continue to push daily updates to the servers to further improve both stability and performance."

review: This game is overrated addictive and unfair..Yet has its moments of being fun. Full of hackers even though they said they are on the look out for them last ones alive can sometimes shoot through walls somehow know exactly where you are even though you are hiding somehow do extreme amounts of damage even though you have high level defensive equipment. without a kill cam its pretty depressing getting shot from incredibly far away and not able to escape or know what direction your getting shot at. Bluehole buffed zone damage which is fine but the speed that it moves can be way too fast for running or swimming removes any fun in the game when people are camping a bridge and theres no boat. Loot system is unfair can be very unrewarding when getting multiples. these are most of my complaints.otherwise it can be fun when playing with a full squad or a friend. Raiding houses finding gear and going out as a group can feel satisfying even if you don't always win. At this moment in time maybe an 7.5/10 but it feels generous. Awaiting new content but honestly they should focus more on hackers too.

review: I have read a lot of mixed reviews on this game which had me worried for a bit but the gameplays of this just looked so much fun that I risked it. I have at best a mid range pc (more lower end of mid) and literally the worst adsl package available in South Africa. The fact that this game is multiplayer only had me even more worried as I waited for it to download.The game is awesome. Performance wise it works great but I did set some settings to low (on the advice of the youtubes) supposedly doing that makes you die less because you can see better (negative on the less death). Playing online is a pleasure even on my line. I'm sure people have their reasons to dislike the game and I'm sure much of it is valid. For me this is this is just too fun. I die often and most of the time i don't even know how but I'm getting the hang of it.The lobbies are always ready to go and I have never waited for a game.The ONLY issue I can report is the time it takes from game ending to being in a new game. I don't think that's down to the game too much rather my slow line and the fact that I die QUICK.All in all in the opinion of this nobody... 10 / 10 mopani worms.

review: This game is extremly intense but its great overall experience! Coming over from H1Z1 King of the Kill I feel this game is a little more finessed! Not knocking KOK at all because I love it too but this game feels a little more tactical and I love the game mechanics like adding attachments to your weapons and gear which lacks in KOK. Because of that alone I feel that one had a slight advantage if they can get good gear and optimal possition on other players. I hate to be that guy that compares the two games. KOK is a lot more faster pace but PUBG has a good balance too. There are some minor glitches but they can be fixed. Like game crashes here and there and main menu bugs. Also the player zone is harsh toward the end. They need to bring that downa noch but I guess that just me. These are just some minor grips that don't shouldn't take away from the overall greatness of this game. I have to play this game daily just to get my fix!! Its downright addicting! I highly recommend it!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is a great game!!! I highly recommend if you played H1Z1 King of the Kill or Arma Battle Royal. Those 2 just had a baby and named it PUBGrawl. However you must take the time to adjust alot a settings and tweak things or you may find yourself very unhappy. Their is a learning curve for your first couple of adjustment matches and you will start having fun. The game may feel laggy at first but its not... Its your sensitivity settings. Find them Fix them fast. I recommend 70 for General 60 Vechicle and 40 for guns. Rebind keys to what you are use to asap. Get a friend and go DOU's! I find that DOU matches are optimal for me. You have to have team work for Squad and solo can be fun but honestly unless you download your skill you wont see number 1. Please spare yourself the I was killed by another hack line and go watch some tips and tricks videos before you know it the next noob will be saying that about you. Anyone hacking in this game will get caught its only a matter of time and they will be spending over a $100 a month to be the best... Either way they will lose. Thanks Battleye!!! You can take down a hack easily just watch videos on positioning and camp them out. Figure out fast where the center of the shrink is and get there before the other guys. Pitch a tent and colllect the rent before you know it youll be in the top 10. If you get a buddy and learn to commuicate and you will be top 10 in dous almost everytime. Shoot Move and Communicate!One last thing... Dont jump from a moving vehicle.

review: I wanted to get this game a month after it came out but the reviews on this game were very negative and some were very possitive. I stuck to the negative because at the time I also couldn't spend a dime because I was on a strick budget. So I did not get it. Foward to November I started watching some streamers play PUBG and it looked amazing to me and every bad review I saw before went out of my head. I bought the game and started playing right away. It is an amazing game for being an "EARLY ACCESS GAME". I have played it for about 50 hours and the expirience is always different and always challenging. In every round I have played I would have to play it differently. I have only gottent 1st place once and it felt amazing. I have gotten top 10 a couple of times and it is still an amaizing feeling as well as an adrenaline rush to get to the top 10 circle. I wish I would of gotten this game sooner. I have not seen any glitches and I have not lagged at all in any of my games. It has been a very smooth experience for me.The only thing that gets a little devistating is the crates. It takes a little while to get the free once and I am not planning to get the PAID boxes. Don't spend your money on that. Just play the game and you will start to get your inventory full in no time.

review: I do not write game reviews. However in this case I will make an exception! I have played online games for years! The first being Ultima Online. I have played all the shooters COD Battlefield etc. But I have to say the Player Unknown is the BEST and most tense game I have ever played! Not just a run a shoot it requires skill stratagy common sense and instant planning! In a nutshell without them saying it it is The Hunger Games with an upgrade to weapons! You may play an entire round and not fire a shot until the end! You must gather weapons and supplies as you struggle to stay inside and ever shrinking area. This game is very addictive! 5 Stars from me!!UHS FireCapt
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's simple. Playerunknown's Battlegrounds offers an exceptionally tense yet fun experience.Right from the get go you jump from a plane fighting for the best landing areas and hoping that nobody lands close to you.As soon as you land it's a mad scramble to get a gun and armour before anyone else can. Fail at this and you're deader than dead.Once you've got yourself a gun and some armour you've got 2 choices. Run further into the combat zone and try to find a good position to take everyone else out or hide and hope nobody finds you.Running into the combat zone is a good idea if you're looking to get higher tier loot but others will have the same idea. This strategy is a high risk high reward strategy if pulled off correctly. Fail to do so and you will be punished heavily by people with better guns.Hiding works well but can be quite boring for the most part. You will occasionally get people skulking around and trying to scavenge left overs which can lead to a tense stand off. If you have a better gun and faster reflexes you win. If not you're getting shot to bits in a corner while crying.You can't hide for the whole game however as the dreaded blue (death zone) circle closes in and the white (combat zone) circle shrinks and relocates forcing you to move or die.Red (explosion) zones can force you out of hiding spots unless you're in a building. As the game progresses the blue zone moves faster and gives you less time to get into the white zone and the white zone shrinks in size forcing players into a smaller kill zone. The most tense part of the game is when it gets to 2 players in a tiny white zone and it all comes down to who is the fastest on the draw.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So I Jump into a solo game on the SEA server. Once I go over a probable car spawn point i dive straight down. Thankfully I get to a car before this other dude and then make an effort to run him over. I failed. So I stopped and decided to offer him a ride. Take note that I had muted voice chat so I couldn't hear a word he was saying. As we were driving liesurely towards the first circle we happened on a crate. Coast was clear so I stopped by it. Instead of making a break for the crate I stay in the car and let this dude go for it. It was the ultimate form of trust. This man this nameless man in his undies now had the power to take the life of someone who only a minute before tried to kill him. He began reloading. "Don't you do it! Don't you do it!" I shouted to my screen. He finished reloading his tommygun...And ran back to the passenger's seat. At that moment I knew this was gonna be a fun match.We spent the next two circles looting and shooting the item that we wanted each other to take watching each other's backs as we looted two more buildings. As we were driving up to the ruins we were ambushed by a lone gunman expecting only one passenger and easy pickings. Big mistake. Undies man returned fire nearly killing ambush dude who runs for cover. "He sure wasn't expecting that!" I cuckled. Sadly we never made it to our destination. We were ambushed by another. Dropping me first and my friend right after. There were 45 people left. We never got each other's names. The dude probably din't speak english anyway. But for the rest of my days I will always remember that nameless undies man who I tried to kill at first. He returned my trust despite past misgivings. We put our differences aside for the greater good that chicken dinner. He was my friend.10/10 Would try to run over someone only to make an unexpected ally on solo again.

review: After 152 hours I have made a conclusion about Playerunknown's Battlegrounds.The game is great. The thrill variety playerbase (sometimes) is great. Yes the optimization for the game is not good I find that I get a late start because I have to wait for my game to load but it is pretty minor. The game crashes sometimes but that comes with a game in Early Access which I have to say for a game in early access this game is a monster. Already creating records in several different aspects of the game. The gunplay is great too. At many times you feel like you are at a disadvantage but I find PUBG very fair besides third person sometimes but that's a whole different story. I also feel like some people you meet in this game are very nice. They seem toxic when youre playing solos but if you Solo Queue in duos many of them are nice. I know this review was all over the place but thanks for reading and I would reccommend this game to you.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Intel Core i5 6600K 16GB DDR4 RAM GeForce GTX 1060 6GB Please do not buy this game at all. Full of chinese hackers. Very poor optimization developers took time to port this over to the Xbox One before finishing or at least optimizing their game. I should NOT be getting FPS drops and anything below 60 on Medium settings. Added paid crates when the developer promised there wouldn't be any until the game has reached it's completion and full release. Mentioned "taking further action" against Fortnites developers for their "Battle Royal" mode. And it is STILL full of numerous bugs. Ads in game if you are connecting from China (I myself do not but still scummy they do so). The servers are terrible as well there is NO reason for the servers to be laggy and as bad as they are. The game was fun with friends for a good while before becoming plain frustrating and could be a great game overall if Bluehole wasn't a terrible company. If Bluehole actually decided to fix all the issues holding the game back and addressed the hacker issue this could be so much better. As long as they continue to be a trash company I will gladly not recommend purchasing this game.

review: Overall I like the direction that this game is going and I want to see the devs prosper. But I just do not enjoy playing this game for more than 15 minutes at a time. Most of my time playing feels forced with friends and even then I find myself tab out in a corner waiting for action or my team to move.PROS The game is easy to pickup. The devs care about the game and want to see it succeed. Reasonably priced. More content to be expected down the road.I feel like I have to explain the cons because they are some of my big gripes in why I don't enjoy this game.#1 The game is extremely slowI understand that it is a big world and players are expected to run from point A to point B but honestly I feel as if I am wasting my time. I spend most of my time walking around trying to get to the safe zone and in the end get shot by someone I never see. In solos I feel as if this is worse becuase it seems like I am the only one getting shot at and no one else is having to deal with the same issue. The only fun is at the very beginning and the very end of the game where there is the most action.#2 The gasGas camping is rampent especially towards the end. Getting shot by people who are in the gas on 5th gas is the worst. I guess this is just me wanting the devs to make the gas more damaging or RESTRICT VISION TO THOSE IN IT. The amount of times I was killed in the end by people in the gas has me off to uninstall the game for some time before reinstalling it to play with friends again. I just feel like players in the gas need to be punished and right now there is no punishment for sitting in the gas.#3 Weapons/attachmentsWhile the line up of weapons are perfectly fine and I am ok with them adding new ones. I cannot help but bring up the issue that it seems like the devs just want to put more weapons in the crates instead of spawning them in the world. If the main arguing point is that the weapons would be too overpowered then that is BS since they can easily balance these weapons and give them specific roles instead of having them be OP and restricted to crates. Another issue is the spawns. The amount of times I have found no guns after searching 6 to 10 house has seemed to increase. The inconsistancy in weapon spawns is enough to give me a headache and just leave the game and never play it for the rest of the day.#4 3rd personI know it is the big selling point of this game but let's be honest third person shooters promote the worst type of gameplay. There is nothing fun or enjoyable about someone being able to see you on the other side of a wall. It makes breaching houses a nightmare (or just walking by a building) knowning that someone got the advantage over you by abusing the 3rd person camera mechanic. This alone makes me not want to play but I have been playing more since the first person mode has been released. Just to clarify some of the hate on the 3rd person aspect of the game I generally play FPS games and understand the problems with 3rd person games.#5 ServersI know the devs are working on fixing these types of issues because they are important to address and take care of. But The amount of inconsitancy in firefights is abhorent that I have to add this in.#6 The game is boringLike I stated earlier I find my self playing this game tabbed out more than anything else. If my team is running somewhere I will just autorun and tab out. If we are driving I am never the one driving I just tab out and do something more interesting as a result. I think most of this comes from feeling forced to play the game but the overall mid game is just boring. There is nothing exciting that really goes on and many of my games are spent trying to move to the circle with little to no action. Smaller maps increasing player counts or making the games shorter will fix the waiting issue. The ARMA style gun play is another issue that makes gun fights later on very slow and tedious. Couple that with 3rd person and you have some of the worst gun play ever. Slow unsatisfying and BS. #7 Early access?!?This one is more of a personal rant but I absolutely hate when devs advertise their games as "early access". I feel like when people see this they should be wary that they will be paying for a full priced fully developed game that will be recieving fixes along the way. I just have to bring this up because I am tired of people defending these types of games that are obviously not early access. DayZ is a big one that advertised as early access and hid behind that to explain every problem. All I have to say is any game you can buy and not be a streamer or actual game critic then it is not early access it is a full release and I will treat it like a full release because that is what it is. I hope that if you do not own the game that you do take caution into buying it and make sure that you will actually enjoy it first. As for the community of this game I guess I can say that it is the same H1Z1 community that left that dying platform for this one.

review: After a very rough pre release phase I'm proud to say PUBG is finally playable. It's still annoyingly buggy at times and if you desire polish it may not be the game for you but overall very fun game to play with friends. In all seriousness the game does have a huge problem with players from China using US servers and they are renowned in the community for cheating being obnoxious etc. In my experience First Person Perspective gamemodes have far less problems in these regards. In addition FPP mode allows you to bypass silly corner peaking which I personally prefer.

review: First let me say that I've only got 1.5hrs in on this game. I realize that immediately disqualifies my opinion for some.Secondly let me say that I'm not entirely sold on Last Man Standing or Battle Royale as is the popular tag now. But it's definitely addictive and begs for that "just one more turn". That being said I think there's a very good game here. It's simply buried in a lot of technical issues apparent hackers (I reported someone) and frankly less than stellar graphics. This game may bring your PC to it's knees but it's not because it's pretty. It's very drap and reminds me of Stalker Shadow of Chernobyl (which frankly looked better). The draw distance which is critically important with maps this large is kind of a joke. The vehicle mechanics are wonky at best. There is enough "flashing" going on with the graphics especially the interiors to make a Non epileptic have a seizure. This would all be acceptable if this were a mod to an existing game. Or if this game were still in beta. It doesn't seem acceptable that you have to pay for this mess even $30 is steep. I'd pay half that in it's current state. I may keep tabs on this one to see if it improves if the developer abandons it or worst of all if it becomes a DLC nightmare. For now I have gotten a refund. I will stick with Fortnite which is free early access and more polished than this game by a long shot.

review: Guess I should review this game... I have a love hate relationship with this game. I love it when I win get close to winning or even when I get more than 3 kills in a match. Other times I hate it because of "Network lag detected" hackers or simply the desync between players.The desync between players is marginal doesn't happen all the time but you'll know it when it happens. Hackers... (As I've found) are mainly on the NA servers so I just play EU and I haven't ran into a single one yet (Jinx). Network lag detected is usually server wide so all the players in the server typically experience it unless you're having serious packet loss then it'll just be you in which case you should probably find a single player game to play until you have more bandwidth to begin with.As for the love (Saving the best for last)... this game has it's ups and downs. It has emotion it has buildup it has climax and sometimes it's so anti climactic that it makes you want to pick up a bad habit. How many times I've had level 3 everything 200 rounds in my M4 and a 4x with a silencer and I get shot in the back by some jerk sitting in the blue zone. But that's part of the game it's a strategy. It's a bs one but it's a strategy. A lot of people in videos complain about campers or people hiding... what they don't realize is everyone has a playstyle. This game forces you to work outside your comfort zone it forces you to adapt to different players different situations and because of that I find my hands shaking sometimes after a tense confrontation or even in a nervous situation when I know people are around me and I have a Machete. The game has it's moments that make it great and those (to me) far outweigh the few unlucky games I've had with hackers lag and the unlucky loot spawns.The updates for the game are immaculate. A lot of people say you need a super high end computer to play this game. That's not true. Let me give you an example. I have an AMD FX8350 and an R9 290 4GB. Bad CPU pretty decent graphics card. When this game was first released I'm talking first week. I was getting maybe 20 to 40 fps in all areas of the map and lets not even talk about poly. (It was atrocious). After months of updates and optimization. I can now get upwards of 60 to 90 fps and that's with Re Shade! Which depending on your settings can drastically reduce your fps. While I don't agree with their minimum specs as the game becomes prettier and more optimized maybe you can play on ultra low settings with those specs. I wouldn't advise it if you want something playable though. Having played on the test server multiple times I can say that the updates are pretty thoroughly tested between the small community that's on the test servers before they are pushed to live although there's always those people who can find weaknesses or possible abuses in the system and that's why the game is in early access. To attribute for the "inequality" that may arise during updates. While I have a soft spot for these kinds of games since my days of an Amateur Counter Strike Source Semi Pro the thing that makes this game great aren't the graphics the unlucky loot drops the desync issues (obviously). It's the tension you feel EVERY SINGLE GAME. I get so into it I jump when I hear a shot from somewhere I didn't expect. 7.1 surround baby )This review is really long. The game though is worth it. Is it worth 30 dollars at it's current level? I've been playing since the game was first put out and I have 380 hours (Will be going up) At 10 dollars per 100 hours I'd say that's a pretty fair trade. So in conclusion if you don't mind the occasional bug if you have a halfway decent system compared to mine or better. If you have really cool friends who like to have fun and shoot the occasional baddie if you don't mind running hundreds of kilometers over the course of 10 games (Running sim 2017) then I think you'd enjoy this game. It's improved a drastic amount don't listen to the people hating on everything about the game pointing out all of its flaws acting like nothing has ever been fixed. If anyone has been around since the beginning you know how much the game servers and optimization has improved since first release. Have a wonderful day. )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: With an inability to play KoTK I have revisited my play and review.I have come to enjoy many of the nuances of the game.The level of involvement from the dev team shows.Updates continue to push the polish of the game forward.A more detailed review of the game may come in the future.You should pick the game up!*** Maybe the game is not bad but it certainly isn't my cup of tea. Here are my main complaints and why I took a refund over waiting to see how the game pans out 1. The pace of the game is maddening. It is slow and drawn out. You walk slow. You "run" slow. You play slow. You loot slow. You drive slow. 2. This is not a skill or reflex based shooter. The advantage goes to the guy that pulls the trigger first. This sounds fine but with a deeper look it just isn't fun. Why because for a vast majority of players that means find a dark corner in the middle of the safe zone and sit until someone walks by. If the camper is anything other than a complete potato you have no chance to win that fight. Many refer to this as "tactical " but it is nothing more than a dressed up word for a camp fest. More often than not you will have one of two types of deaths. The guy in the corner that shoots first or the guy in the third story that picks you off as you speed walk across the field trying to stay if the safe zone.3. A complete lack of balance. The basis of the game dictates that the lucky looter has the best chance of winning. If a potato finds the best gun with the sick sight and level three armor in his house and you find a skillet and some super cool khaki pants what is the outcome? There is not a KoTK option where you say I will find a gun and a helmet then get to killing. The game forces you to keep looting and hoping to find the rare drops before the guy sitting in the roof of that building that you can't even see yet rips you head off with an easy shot through his 4x scope.4. The feel of the game mechanics is off. Movement feels like it has the slightest of delay. Controls and jumping are not precise. My guy especially when jogging or strafing feels like he is running on marbles. Vehicle mechanics are horrible and unresponsive.Many other reviews mention the horrible optimization and the long time between playing games so I won't go into detail. However you are paying them to be a beta tester after all and I would imagine those issues will eventually be fixed. I very much wanted this title to be my next big game. Sadly it's about as much fun as a trip to the dentist... ***
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

A game that doesn't function (Lag) and has issues clamping down on hacking? No thanks not at that price.

review: First few games I was landing in some of the 'quieter' areas to try and get some weapons without being shotgunned straight back to the lobby. It worked most of the time but for me the real fun lies in landing in the towns school or (my personal favourite) the prison. I do still find myself cowering in a building at times though...THIS GAME WILL CONSUME YOU! Because of the 'one life and game over' style you genuinely feel it when you're under fire and that only gets more intense as the number of players decrease. I can't describe how awesome it is to get your first chicken dinner!A few bugs as expected from an early access game but the dev team communicate with the players well and I can only see this game improving with the new maps on the horizon. If you're not already one of the millions playing this game I'd recommend you get involved!

review: Original review July 17 2017 I really enjoy this game. Unfortunately there is a lot that still needs fixed. The pre game player lobby is ridiculously obnoxious with the gun fire. The textures make the hair look terrible and the screaming from everyone is even more ridiculous. I know you can mute people but that doesn't make it any less obnoxious. One thing I don't enjoy about this that I do like on KotK is that the parachute automatically opens and then it seems to take forever to get to the ground. The airplane noises are deafeningly loud... and I'm getting really tired of blasting people in the face with a shotgun to have nothing happen to them but then I die with a pistol or something just as stupid. Also when you jump out of cars you should just get damaged even going slowly if I jump out I somehow manage to die which is totally unrealistic. There needs to be more loot in the bathrooms/bedrooms of the houses. I can't really think of anything else right now though but I enjoy this game. Can't wait until more fixes have been made. Update August 20 2017Still a lot broken in this game. But they added horns so who cares! /sarcasm... So aside from the glitchy menu and constantly having to refresh to UI I'm glad they added in the ability to rejoin a game. That is very needed. The matchmaking is pretty instant which is great. It's a great game to play with friends. Though since the last update my game has been crashing and it has never done that previously. The BP takes forever to get and then you get the most loot I've ever had in a game... like ever. Two red hats and dirty tank tops later I'm annoyed... this game is fun don't get me wrong. Just fix it. I punched a dude no exaggeration about 15 20 times and he didn't even get knocked out. He had enough time to load up a pistol and shoot me once and I'm down. That parts a little more realistic but the fact that I punched him so much and nothing happened sucks. The repetitive gas cans everywhere and lack of decent weapons is slightly annoying. SK12 shoots WAY too far as compared to the other shotguns which seem to do absolutely no damage sometimes unless the barrel of the shotgun is in their esophagus... pistols don't do enough damage. Not enough decent gun attatchments (i.e. I hardly ever find silencers for the gun I am using unless I go into the middle of a city where I ultimately end up dying because everyone else is there too.) The plane sound at the beginning is ridiculously loud as well as the dropping wind after jumping out and we should be able to turn that down if we want to since it's not something that will change the gameplay. There should also be a way to turn down public voice chat as I would love to listen to the random crap everyone is saying I just don't want to hear it screamed in my ears. It would still be nice to drop lower before the parachute opens up because it just takes soooo long to reach the ground. The damage from jumping out of cars is also ridiculously insane as even if you slow down you still end up getting knocked our and/or dying. Still no loot in certain rooms of houses and buildings. Updates are coming to fix things and they are listening but voting down because there is so much to be fixed early access or not.

review: PUBG is a very relaxing game where you have to create your unique character dress him in fancy clothes and meet others in a giant chat room on an island where you can choose between a small chat room of four or two or a big chatroom of 100. I usually go for the smaller more private chat rooms since I one time heard someone fart in the big chatroom also I got hired by ISIS there twice. ! One of the coolest features in the game is that you can purchase new clothes for your character out of surprise boxes which you can open for in game currency. You get this currency if you jump out of an airplane and walk your character around another bigger island where you constantly get yelled at by a russian guy and sometimes you can hear some twelve year old discuss the latest news in school with his mum while she is vacuuming right next to the microphone of the other player which is nice.I rate this game a solid 5/7 in future updates please add some more haircuts you can choose from for your character

review: After the early access the game has improved a lot! There is better optimization.And those features that should have been from the start like vaulting / better jumping (jumping over fences was pain before). First person mode is also very nice because it changes the combat tactics drastically. 3rd person mode is still an option for those who prefer that and they have different statistic tracking.But then again... When I first tried vaulting. I "died from falling" after getting stuck in the vault mechanism when trying to climb over staircase railing.... I got video of it but no idea where to post it. I had a good run (Early Access review Kind of a high price compared to other alternatives.Crashes every now and then but crashes have been reduced since launch.Beginning of games with 100 players can be very laggy and everyone struggles to hit.Draw distance is problematic as you can not see tall grass from far away but players hiding there will think they are hidden in the grass.But I still like the game. Get's boring fast without group or duo friend.

review: Simple yet intriguing. Each game is consistant but different from the next. As of this review there is only one map. You start in a plane flying on a random course over the island. At a certain point the door opens and you are free to jump out at any point. The fight has begun. The conventional beginning period is for gathering supplies and weapons. I say conventionally because in this game you are on a pretty open canvas. You might grab a shotgun and go on a rampage or lay low until you have armor and a weapon. But get used to absolutely nothing as seemingly everything apart from the map is random so a great deal of luck is involved. This can be very frustating. I could be playing it safe and minding my own buisness in with great gear and the "red zone" (a random event were a specific area of the map gets glassed) starts. I've been in games were the red zone has consistantly been over me four times in a row. Needless to say I didn't survive. That's the thing with the game you build your tower so high and the higher it is the harder it falls. In a solo game it's you verses literally everything with your only ally the weapons on your person. It's hard but you know it and every time you die you are reminded of it.But you are tired of being thrown down by the world. So you decided to be thrown down in a group. Pubg also features a duo and squad (four man) system. But there appears to be one issue with this. Your "allies". If you just came from a community like Counter Strike's then you will likely be disapointed by the pubg community. Not to say everyone is toxic because not everyone is. Just how do I say it? No ones makes callouts despite having a mic. Your team games will likely be pretty silent. Not that it is nessicarily bad thing but to me coming straight from CS I have to admit we could all improve. Another note even if you select your region you aren't garunteed to be paired with those from said region. All I have to say is I always pick the NA (North American) option but every 1/3 games it seems like someone who belongs on the asian servers are there. It doesn't make much of a difference to me where they're from but 9/10 times I'm paired with someone from a different region they can't speak English (or Spanish) very well or at all. Don't be discouraged though as long as you pull your weight and try to lend a helping hand when you can you will be ok.My verdict despite all the bashing I've done the game is wonderfully fun I would recomend it to anyone considering purchasing it. Sorry for such great length...

review: To be fair i do enjoy the game from time to time even with its current issues. The only reason i'm not recommending it is because i think at the current price ($29.99) its not worth it. I bought on sale ($19.99) and didn't regret the purchase.IMO I enjoy the mobile version of PUBG way more because the details and features it has make the game way more enjoyable then the PC version. (I'm not great at either game but i can tell when more effort is put somewhere)Mobile PUBG pros/cons vs PC PUBG pros/con the loot system is is much generous with crates clothes skins points etc. (more F2P friendly) missions/rewards system actually give you something to look forward to while PC pubg doesnt have this incorporated the options of auto pickup/reload weapon modes peek modes auto chosing best health to use and being able to disable/enable all these features is a HUGE plus. (if you've ever played mobile to for awhile and then go play PC you'll see what i mean) having an actual chat where you can type (even its on a small phone is a nice feature) being able to choose which map to play on &amp auto matching not required (even though its between 2 maps currently) arcade mode (gives you 3modes to play other then just playing the regular game) I know PUBG released custom matchs open beta but they are actually looking at CHARGING people $$$ for that in the future Training grounds... totally forgot about this great feature. Allows you to try out all the weapons get your settings right and actually practice before just throwing you to the wolves. Cons Bots (of course) limited screen play due to phone size &amp controls emulators still need work.

review: The game is a meat grinder now. My past 2 nights of attempting to have fun in this game go as the following I felt like playing an fps saw pubg had a new map etc. loaded up the game perfectly got into games quickly first 2 hours I would aim for bigger towns to get more and better loot. Wouldn't have an encounter unless I did something very reckless like follow a guy into a house. Every time they went into the house and I attempted to lay a trap the guy would be able to hear my footsteps from a block away leading him to stay absolutely still for 2 5 minutes depending on how far away they were from the circle. Sometimes they never come out and i'm not about to open a door to an uzi. So an encounter doesn't happen until there's only about 14 26 people left and it's a campers game.Spend the next hour and half with the same situation reaching top 10 maybe twice with maybe 1 encounter either in the beginning of the match or towards final 10. that's like 10 minutes of walking around or fooling around trying to run someone over. 10 minutes a match with maybe a match lasting 20 minutes that's practically an hour of my game time that I spent trying to actually have fun.After realizing how boring it was to be fully looted for 20 seconds of action led me to go to player dense drop points. At this point i drop mil base and HDP etc and tonight after trying for another 2 hours to have decent action in large groups my best battle was my last one. I picked up an sks at HDP after TWO ing minutes of running through that ers mansion. JUST as I was loading the gun I got hit by an autoshotty. EVERY game before that was my pistol against an AR or at least a smg...I can't enjoy a game where a session based game allows you to be so screwed over in such a short amount of time that your best options are either put the game down or spend 15 minutes running.I've been trying for the past 6 months and the enjoyment of losing has almost run dry.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Just as everyone else I hate the fact they refuse to region lock China. Adding on to that you entice people to cheat by having loot boxes that you get by winning games and kills. Some of the items sell for over 1k and sure you can ban them but as soon as you do all that happens is they create a new account. All the while the corporation are just getting their pockets lined with cash. The icing on the cake though has been the recent bans of players for harrasing streamers. An innocent player just having fun and honking the horn or sometimes they kill the streamer without cheating. Next thing you know you are banned for something you didn't even realize. Trying to get the ban reversed is impossible as the developers no longer care about the players. At first the game wasn't that bad you could deal with the cheaters and still enjoy the game. Now the whole thing is so overrun by cheaters I can barely land in any area without getting shot and I can't even findout where from. With the new death cam I can see a player just shoots randomly in the air and I'm dead. Like come on this has got to a point where this game has just become a cheating gambler's playground. And the developers just sit there and do nothing to fix it.

review: I see a lot of people saying that the game is "Great" or it would be "Perfect" if there were region locks in place. The game is a pile of honestly. It was an almost bearable disappointment when it was in early access but at this point whether the game is okay or not really all depends on whether you run in to people cheating whether or not you get Desperado crates that require you to pay for keys in order to open them or whether or not the game runs buttery smooth like warframe for you instead of it being a buggy mess. It would be nice to be able to choose whether or not to play with players who have pings in the hundreds but that's not important because if it was we would have that option. There isn't really anything rewarding about playing this game and anyone claiming that it's the best thing since sliced bread is in denial. The people who enjoy this game are most likely enjoying the company of their friends while cheaters one shot all of them from accross the map with a UMP. The hype train took this game to some really ridiculous heights eventually players will see the game for the cash grabby piece of trash that it is.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Review update The old review at the bottom is still true however there are some things that must be said.I will continue to play this game as there isn't a game in the genre with the sheer volume of player base except Fortnite. After being 1.0 for some time now the early game is a fight against the server to see who picks up weapons first after 4 to 8 pick up attempts. Hits not registering is still very much a prevelent issue even mid to late game when the servers are supposedly able to perform at a higher rate.The melee weapon mechanics are so bad that most just avoid them unless it's the pan for that lucky bullet deflect. There are still videos you can find on the internet of them implementing melee executions but have not heard anything more on those in nearly a year. I can understand why if they choose to keep them the way they are there is no point because no one will use them. Hackers/cheaters are still a major issue instead of resolving the problem they just ban a particular account and the same computer/same person can just spend 30$ to get the game again. At this point it feels like the develepors are more concerned with counting their money then fixing the issues that have been a problem since day 1 beta. I truly hope i'm wrong but at this point it is starting to lean the same as H1Z1 and past game in the genre with a wonderful idea but horrible implementation. Here's to hoping that those high hopes prove to still be honored eventually. Definitely love this game.. Have very high hopes for it. At least it has already made waves for instilling the battle royale as a standard genre for years to come. The future looks bright ...

review: At times PUBG is frustrating. It makes you angry it scares me and the amount of times I try to play hoping feeling that i would win this time only to be knocked out in the first 10 seconds makes me want to give up entirely. But I don't. PUBG may be one of the few games I play that makes me want to quit out of frustration but I keep coming back. The idea of winning and the vast strategies and difference in play each time makes PUBG a quality game that I just can't quit. Playing with friends is even better and is a great bonding experience as you all fail together. Yes PUBG has it's flaws but that wont stop me from playing an interesting graphically beautiful game......no matter how many times I die.

review: Every match follows the same basic premise a collection of up to 100 players are airdropped onto an island where they must scavenge weapons and supplies all while vying to be the last player alive. While both veterans and newbies will start off on even footing experienced players will quickly outmaneuver those with less experience. An inexperienced player is capable of catching someone out of place but familiarity will allow vets to orchestrate these instances more adeptly rather than relying on luck.One of the mechanics that has helped spur PUBG s growth especially as a popular game to stream is its drop in/out mechanic. As soon as you are taken out you can immediately quit back to the main menu and get a new game started in as little as one minute. This is helped by the constant flood of people who are currently playing meaning you will likely find yourself in a full game.What ensures no one player will ever have the advantage is a giant wall that closes in with decreasing intervals of time. Any player caught outside the zone takes periodic damage which will result in a death if one does return to the confines of this barrier. However some players will opt to trade health to try and catch unaware opponents from a more advantageous position that may lie just outside the barrier. This also serves as every match s primary driving force allowing games to last no longer than 30 minutes as opponents are forced to move closer and closer together increasing the chances of engagement.PUBG is responsible for creating a genre all its own adding a fresh coat of paint over the more established tactical war genre. It is also conducive to some excellent dynamic narrative as even players who get lucky and find themselves well within the confines of the zone will see other players begin to encroach on them. While some degree of skill will determine who will emerge the victor a player s initial placement what gear they find and random chance will often have as much if not more to do with being the last person standing.Because no two games will ever play out the same the streaming community has fallen in love with PUBG turning it into the most played and watched game on PC. It has become so wildly successful that PUBG frequently has more concurrent viewers and streamers than popular mainstays like DotA 2 and LoL games that have taken years to cultivate their audience. Short match and queue time has likely contributed to PUBG s spectator appeal as viewers are able to see more matches over a shorter period of time.Being an early access title the game has had a number of fixes and additions but so far the most notable has been the zombie mode that was added turning the majority of the participants into the undead removing their ability to loot and wield weapons. Another exciting addition that is now live is the inclusion of 1st person only servers adding a layer of stress and intensity that cannot be found in a 3rd person game. Future additions include a parkour mechanic that would allow players to vault over cover and dive out of windows providing fluid movement options not present in most other tactical shooters.For only $30 PUBG offers adopters a hefty package for the price tag. Although it is arguably more expensive than your conventional early access title Bluehole and Greene have promised to release the game by the end of the year meaning that you are getting what amounts to the full experience now.However PUBG is not without its flaws. It has received almost unanimous praise which can be more detrimental to the game s continued growth than had it received criticism for its failings. The false consensus effect tells us that we can experience a cognitive bias towards something and assume that everyone else shares our opinion on it. Because of this almost universal agreement that PUBG is such a good game and all the news that covers it talks about how successful it is and continues to be the game has received little in the way of criticism. While this isn t a measure of a good or bad game PUBG is a definitive example for a game that has great depth but little breadth. It succeeds greatly at the premise it presents and at this time we have only seen the game continue grow. But will the game continue to evolve and maintain its player base or is the bubble of success destined to pop as competitors arrive on the scene and offer up their own take on the battle royale formula.

review: First experience in Pubg Went into the game my mouse doesn't do anything. I can only run forward and strafe. Alt+Tab a couple times and it corrects itself.Jump out of plane accidentally hit F twice and pull my parachute. Can't cancel the parachute. I enjoy a scenic 17 minute decent.By the time I hit the ground 35+ people have been murdered. I find a couple of houses and loot them.I have NFI how anything in this game works including the inventory. But apparently I have a first aid kit assault rifle and shotgun.I see a house with open doors I can hear someone outside.Palms get sweaty.Let's do this.Pull out my shotty go in and check corners not on the main floor. I approach the stairs and we see each other. He fires first.I retreat down into the kitchen and he follows me to finish the job. I empty 5 rounds out of my automatic shotgun into his vicinity at about 1.5 meters.Apparently that doesn't kill someone.He retreats up the stairs and tosses a couple smoke grenades. I decide to pursue.He shoots me in the head.25/10 would be unknown again.75/2 sweaty armpits.In reality though this game is addicting and fun. It's really screwy as my system gets lower FPS on medium than it does on Ultra. The optimization is ludicrously poor. From what I've gathered the developers seem like turds that are more about the money than their game after it's insane success. I do not have high hopes for this to ever reach a state stable enough not to have poor experiences now and then. Basically my purchase of this game has supported nearly everything I hate about how this industry is ran but the game is just so GOSH DARN FUN BRO!This game will obviously be compared directly to Fortnite and after 100+ matches of Fortnite BR and half a dozen in Pubg I much prefer Pubg. This game is far more realistic and has better engagements where being smart and having a tactical advantage almost guarantees you a win. Fortnite is a lot more hectic and random. I found myself having a lot of what I would consider bull**** deaths in engagements I should have won in Fortnite. I'll still play Fortnite as it's free and has more of my friends playing it but my preference will be Pubg. If you are looking for a Battle Royale style game Pubg is definitely worth picking up.

review: Rating 3/10Of course this is an actual review so please understand the rating is a personal opinion and I will explain the reasoning behind the low rating as well as rating from 0 10.Initially as of right now I'm currently on 901 hours in game I had left a great review when I had first bought the game and reached my 100th hour. However after a short amount of time and a minor upgrade (From I5 to AMD with increase of RAM and CPU) I started running into a few issues which seem to never get patched.First lets start with the common bug AMD Processors If you're running an AMD you probably know what issue i'm talking about Yes the requiring to ALWAYS change your affinity during game or upon launch up this has been a known issue for me personally about 4 months now however i've heard others have had this issue for longer only person I know personally who has this issue was my older brother whom I game with Of course my older brother has the better computer as he upgrades as often as possible. However even he consistently crashed day after day after day of attempting to play PUBG because of the affinity bug until finding out about the supposed fix to the problem.Second The Fix PUBG button wow did they really put a fake FIX button? I'd personally love to send Bluefoal all the issues with the game however they seem to run away everytime we have a complaint about the game and why of all things name it FIX PUBG but then have it link us to a website with them 'stating' what they'll do to fix pubg when clearly on the website it has nothing we're looking for to be fixed on the list.Faster &amp Smarter match making Bluefoal are you ing stupid? We wanted region lock cause you allow players with excessively high ping to play in a country they don't live in then we either have to deal with the fact we got shot from an invisible player teleporting around or a language not native to NA.Third Event mode TPP optimization 3 times I went into event mode forced as TPP with my friend I encountered this bug If you swap to FPP while on the ground and end up dying FPP you'll respawn in FPP and be unable to move your character until swapping back to TPP or dropping on the ground.Fourth Anti cheat now this is where the jokes really begin idk how many times i've seen cheaters but man let me tell you this will never stop as of today there was a new cheat going around where players are allowed to swap from FPP to TPP during a FPP Squad match. Previously my teamate today was using it I confirmed it by watching him camera peek players while on a FPP server after reporting I went for a new match me and my squad made it to last 5 where suddenly the last player was tilt peeking and instantly sniping everyone in my team I made sure to test the player and see if he was TPP cheating I pretended to poke out but only tilted enough to have my full body behind the wall however when i had tilted without actually peeking out he started to spray directly at me each time i attempted to peek he shot directly at my head (aware it was my head because whenever i rotated to the opposite side there were bullet holes all in the same spot never straying from where i was standing).After dying to him and spectating him I noticed he was on TPP as well.Personally if you have friends to play this game with it's fun lots of action and very extensive mechanics to allow many types of playstyles however if you're a solo player or play games often alone paying for this game will only make you regret wasting your money as the community is extremely toxic and null of common sense when working as a team (You'll find players reeeeeeing in voice chat or players who are in discord unwilling to work with the rest of the squad)I enjoy playing this game however as of late this game has just been getting worse and worse and likewise with the community as I've seen more hackers and more players who aren't capable of speaking english or just start talking to teamates then kill them.As for the reasoning behind 3/10I gave it 1 point for mechanics 1 point for realism and 1 point for content as for the rest of the points this game misses is Community 1 Bluehole's lack of affection for their community 1 Server lag 1 No region lock/Max acceptable ping 1 Long term bugs not being patched 1 Adding content and creating more bugs instead of resolving previous bugs 2.As I said before I initially gave this game a better review as I was on I5 and didn't care so much for in game bugs however after switching to an amd and constantly having to deal with the Affinity bug finding more bugs during my games or hackers makes it all the more stressful to even bother with this game.

review: Several months on after purchasing the game...Overall game play and features have significantly improved! Unfortunately the Wall Hacking and Aim Botting is rampant. Such as it is game security (if you can call it that) isn't being taken seriously. (Only PR &amp Lip service) Please consider that less than .005% of the player base has been banned for hacking. This is out of 10 + million copies of the game sold to date. Of those banned odds are they'll just get another copy (legitimate or otherwise) and Smurf their way back into community. This is in and of itself very telling about the direction the games development will take. Other Developers that have followed a similar path found their game all but dead after the first year from release. This is due to either cheating being so common as to make the game unplayable or game monetization that's gotten out of control. While we can tolerate a certain amount monetization the cheating must dealt with in a very wide sweeping and public way. However this step is highly unlikely to be taken as this comes into direct conflict with the Developers desire to profit from and further promote PUBG's sale.Suggestions...1) In game reporting that works rather then just being "Lip Service". 2) Dual perspective Kill Cams only available when a report of suspicious activity is made.3) Empower the player base to police themselves by giving them the tools needed to do so.4) Player bans that follow a player across multiple accounts and platforms.5) Add "optional" game modes of play. Maybe something without the circle but rather a fixed objective.6) In game latency &amp tick rate shown on HUD. (Yes PUBG's tick rate is poo poo)Further thoughts...1) Posting comments that are counter to what the PUBG's dev's want to see will get you banned from their forums. Developers that can't handle constructive criticism need to find another line of work. (Aka "PUBG_Hawkinz")2) Selling keys to unlock boxes is a bad idea and only further pushes the game towards Pay 2 Win system.3) The PC player base may all but drop the game once PC vs. Console games become possible. Why would any PC player want to go head to head vs. someone with a built in aim assist? Other developers have tried this in the past and all failed due to significant differences between platforms.4) This is a prime example of a game that's falling victim to it's own hype train. Obviously the hype is used to generate interest and sales. Unfortunately such levels of hype have lead to expectations that apparently the Developers are unable to provide due to 3rd party commitments with other publishers / platforms.5) The endless prattle from PC Gamer that passes as "News" is just sickening. It's like having a drug endorcement from your Doctor knowing he's taking a big fat commision from "Big Pharma".

review: Latest Review The state of the game right now is just pretty pathetic. After 1 year of developping the game they finally "fixed" their game. It was running smooth (even when streaming) and it finally ran well. But then... for some reason they thought it was usefull to release a new patch with tons of new (useless?) attachements... "we dont want people to use their AR as snipers so remove the 8x scope from the ARs.... But.. Lets add a 6x scope which basicly does the same.. Lets add some other random useless attachements. Let's break the state of the guns by making smgs broken. And last but not least. Let's make the game Laggy as .... again. Why BlueHole Why??I really believe this is/was an awesome game if it wasnt gotten this popular early on. It feels like its still an early alpha game. And in my eyes they pushed the game into 1.0 just so they can have more microtransactions. Crates require keys which u buy for clothes and camo's. U can buy skins for your guns from big streamers like Shroud and Doc. Instead of fixing their game they begin a lawsuit against Fortnite... cause they stole BR?? LOL h1z1 was there before pubg Battle royale (the movie) was there before pubg.. BLUEHOLE STOP BEING GREEDY and fix your stuff!!! Listen to your community which is looking to other games cause u don't support your playerbase!So of right now I can't recommend this game to anyone anymore. It was a cool fun game but after being screwed over by the devs for a year im kinda done with it. Original Review Dont understand why people are crying about the micro transactions thing. Devs can make promises but sometimes they have to break it for the better of the game. U can decide if u want to spend the money! U are not forced to spend the money to make the game better! Its your own choice to do it or not! Spending the money doesnt make u any more powerfull in the game! And microtransactions are a thing of this time so I dont mind it as long as it doesnt give u any advantages. The game can be really fun but sometimes really not fun ) When u get crappy loot. It's fun alone but better when u have some friends to play with. The game can be pretty tough on your computer esspecially when u stream it. A lot of long range battle and a little close combat. Once u get that winner winner chicken dinner its really rewarding.

review: Product received for free. As you can tell from my playtime i haven't owned this game for very long however after having played other battle royales like fortnite and h1z1 i can safely say this is one of the better battle royale games in terms of game play. However this game was not ready to be released and still is not ready to be released. For one i personally feel that the movement mechanics are a bit clunky it feels like your floating ad when you try to go somewhere you seem to over shoot your destination however this might be only a issue to those who are used to the source engine where movement is very fluid and smooth or maybe it's just me idk. Furthermore the game still has optimisation issues the graphics are pretty bad yet on a ryzen 5 1600 and a rx580 8gb you only get 70 fps when there is almost no action (excluding the random fps drops). Compare this to a game like fortnite where the graphics are much more beautiful and the textures are more detailed you can get 144fps at all times on the same PC. Also this game has massive cheating problems and bugs that still plague it and limit it the former problem especially an issue in North America where the players often encounter Chinese players which are hacking however if you live in Europe or elsewhere this shouldn't be too much of a problem. The latter problem however is obviously a problem that affects everyone and the devs need to patch this up and according to their blogs they are trying to do it but the community thinks otherwise according to the devs recent actions you will have to make your own opinion on that matter.Other than that this game is great i am having a lot of fun and i am trying to learn how to play this game as quickly as possible. I love the fact you can customise your gun and that you have the option to use third person or first person perspective. However i often get frustrated when i am getting shot at and can't spot the enemy as i feel the directional sound is pretty under developed ( if you have any tips and tricks or things i should change in my audio settings pls tell me cos idk what to do and i might be doing something wrong). In conclusion i recommend this game (7/10) to anyone who is a fan of battle royales however if you take the game extremely seriously and hate bugs or hackers stay away as this game will make you rage unlike any other game. (UPDATE Also i heard that blue hole were gonna change their servers from 10 tick to 60 ticks if so then i am excited. good job!)

review: Bluehole developer's meeting room Dude "Hey Guys we got a brand new PVP game in the pipe. Still got to talk over a few things. Let us start with the player's perspective. Any ideas?" Another Dude "Sure. Just do it third person. That way a player could hide behind a tree see everything that's in front of it but nobody could spot him there." Everyone else "That sounds balanced! Awesome idea Bob!" YES YES YES i know they added a FPP only mode in which you can aim out of a window but shoot the window's frame anyway because it's still the damn third person engine. Good job on that one...This game could have been gold if it was done properly. Instead it is another example for Early Access meaning "half cooked but served anyway".
