review: Get dropped down unarmed from a plane against 99 other players. Alone a duo or a up to four man squad. Did I mention you are unarmed? Let the games begin... Can you pick up something to kill your opponent with before he makes a bump in your head with a frying pan and mocks you in a really bad Eastern European accent?At this date it seems like you have about 28 weapons and 40 attachments to loot +/ As the game progresses there is an electrical field that makes the playfield smaller and forces you to engage the opponents until there is one person/team standing victorious. Winner winner chicken dinner.This is a very good game and I think it will be even better when it is complete. As for now it seems like the publisher is keen to update the game.If you don't own the game yet get a copy. It will be fun they said.There are some silly bugs but some of them are just charming.The ones where you get shot trough a concrete wall is not that charming but not sure if it's a bug or just cheaters.22.11.18Still fun to play but for f... sake start gonsentrating on fixing the game before pushing out skin after skin. Fire a couple of the skin designers and hire someone to fix the desync and the others gameplay issues first.Shabby1981 logging out thanks for reading...

Hopefully things will get better.EDIT Changed my review to positive. I find myself coming back to this game and still enjoying it. Game seems better now than it did back in early 2018. review: OH MY GOD IT'S SO BAD AGAIN. It's like they announced the end of 'fix pubg' and the hackers were like 'THAT'S MY CUE!'it is beyond dark right now stay away from this game! I thought I just suddenly got really bad... then I turned on my death cam. Out of my last 7 deaths 5 have been to cheating. And I mean blantant cheaters. Like... holy aren't they afraid of getting banned cheaters! Which... they obviously aren'tThis game is going through a dark period AVOIDThis was my amended review My original review was quite negative. This game went through some DARK days. This game is still not fantastic and has some rough edges. The prevalence of Chinese punks is still ridiculous those dorks need to be kept from NA matchmaking. The hit detection / *desync* issues still rear their ugly heads. The in game story is greed af.BUT pubg runs smooth for me. The FPS no longer hitches. The game no longer crashes for me. My bullets *mostly* hit players again. There ARE fewer Chinese in my matches. The Chinese that are in matches cheat *less*.I'm having fun again. I didn't have fun with this game for a LONG time. At full price... I do not recommend this game but if you get gifted this game or pick it up on sale it can be a pretty good time. I don't think I would ever buy another game from this dev but I suppose I'll ride this pubg train to its final destination.

review: PUBG is one of those games which you hate but still love to play. This game is really fun to play but is hindered by gobs of issues which at this stage I believe will never be fixed/resolved as the Devs are more focused on milking more and more money out of the pockets of their player base.Instead of fixing severe issues like fps drop/stuttering laggy servers and overall optimisation of the game they are updating the game with more cosmetic items/Weapon Skins to get more money. IMO they even surpassed EA Electronic Arts in terms of Greediness. I really like this game because it's fun and challenging at the same time. I wish this game was never developed by BlueHole or was atleast developed by someone competent enough to develop video games.At last I would say this game is really good besides the issues that are on the end of the Devs I will continue playing it as long as it is fun for me and really hope this game gets fixed one day.PUBG 9/10 BLUEHOLE 4/10Thumbs up is only for the game not for BlueHole

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDSReview constructed as follow Intro Why did it look interesting to me. Positive things explaining the good things in the game. Neutral things things that aren't necessarily bad but could've been better. Negative things explaining the things that somewhat ruined (my) experience playing this game and/or things in general that need work. Ratings giving a grade to some core concepts of the game. Verdict Final grade and some explanation.IntroI was interested in the BR mode since the Arma III mod launched PUBG gave me the impression it was the same but better. Positive Engaging requires tactical approach. Nice variety of weapons. Airdrops are gathering people resulting in big gun fights Choice between 1st and 3rd person. Available maps are original and nicely made.Neutral Graphics they're not that bad but far from good. Sluggish movement. Servers can often be laggy. Opening doors/vaulting needs some tweaking. throwable object indicator seems off on my screen. Sometimes hard to pinpoint where gunshots are coming from.Negative Optimization The game still suffers since the start from very poor optimization. They did work on this but in my opinion still unacceptable. Vehicles are dangerous can get stuck objects resulting in exploding vehicles. Game crashing often especially in lobby. Render distance is bad if you zoom in with x8 scope on a house you're suddenly playing Minecraft.Ratings Graphics 6 Sound 6 Content 5 Controls 4 Gameplay 5 Verdict 5.2I would lie if i say that i never had fun with this game. I had fun at times while playing with friends but the bugs are so plentiful that it ruined my game experience as well.The game definitly had improvements but were closing in on 2 years of release and i think developers didnt have their priorities set right. Instead of fixing the most crucial and game breaking issues in the game they decided to focus on some sort of DLC and skins neglecting the most important thing of all improving their bug infested frustration causing game.I will definitly try it out once more in some months to see what it has become but in it's current state i just cannot say that i enjoy playing it because of the issues it has.

review: It's a fun game but the experience is annoying and frustrating considering that my game keeps crashing everytime I try to play it. Usually happens 1 3 matches and I'm using a core i7 with 16gb of ddr4 ram and a geforce gtx 1080ti. I'll change this once they fix this. Editors note from April 2018 Ok so I figured out the root cause of the problem. Apparently my video was overclocked out of the box so I had to resort underclocking the GPU. While it did fix the crashes it resorted to a new problem where the match faces network lag but this is only a problem on my end and not everyone on the server so during a battle if this happens most likely the other person is going to win the fight. I have a feeling it has to do with my underclocked GPU as it's trying to keep up with the visual effects happening in the match. Bluehole needs to optimize the game so that it can be overclock and underclock friendly without these issues. I have a strong feeling that they test the game based off of the original nvidia and amd video cards so maybe the game is best played on those types of cards.

review: A year ago I recommended this game to all my friends. I loved PUBG with all the firefights and ear cancer. The game has been out for almost a year and a lot has changed. It was slow in the beginning but the game was updated to the point of it actually becoming a really competitive shooter. Unfortanetly the passion in my eyes has come to an end. There are far to many hackers playing on the NA server for this game to be fun anymore. Im tired of getting all sweaty 10+ kills a match running down several crates and then get killed by a hacker at the end of the match. What's the point of playing if every match I play ends with me getting shot in the head by a guy who has been watching me through 5 buildings behind a wall on the otherside of a hill. Only to shoot me when a pixel of my head appears on their screen? I cant afford to spend 30 minutes of my life on a game that rewards hackers and punished good players.

review: April 12 2017 Maybe this will be good someday...... but it isnt good now not $30 worth of gameMay 3 2018 After playing on and off for over a year (mostly on since December 2017) Im really happy with the changes and updates to the game. It is by no means perfect or even really finished but it is fun and it is at times both frustrating and hilarious in its occassional bugs.May 27 2018 After the last 2 updates the changes to firearms damage and hit reg This game is broke AF! Probably not worth it yet again. Which is a shame cause for awhile there it was getting fun to play. But I guess Blue Balls is just trying to make some of that sweet sweet micro transaction money cause all they have really made any progress in with PUBG is adding mediocre skins to guns and parachutes and adding stickers randomly to their small assortment of building models. Hey guys maybe make the game playable fun and balanced before you start adding meaningless garbage? Just a thought.September 8 2018 Ok. They may have nailed it. It seems like since the Fix PUBG Campaign started in early august 2018 this game has gotten noticably better. There are still many issues with DSync do to client latency and there are still some occassional bugs... But the weapons seem to finally be balancing out hit boxes are better and the features they have added and are adding in game and in menus are fantastic frame rates are solid and the game looks great. The problem as of now is keeping everyone interested in a game mode (battle Royale) that is styarting to feel played out... I believe this may be to late for this title. It is not going to grow the player base all they can hope to do at this point is lessen the number of players that are just over it.

review: This game 'could' be amazing. PUBG has an excellent base for a game that could go down in the books with the likes of Counter Strike. However it doesn't seem that Bluehole has the motivation (or the technical ability) to do that 20 30% more that would make this game something really special. Is PUBG fun yes it's very fun but that doesn't mean that it's good. I just can't fathom how they've had all of this time made so much money and the game is still in the poor state that it is in. Do I recommend this game? Right now... No I would not recommend buying it. If Bluehole wants to step up and fix the mess they've made and turn this into something that has the potential to be one of the best games out there I would have no problem recommending it at that point. However based on their track record I don't think the game is going to be anything more than it is now. Bluehole if you read this just sell the game to someone who would make it what it should be.

review: The recommendation is more a "in the middle" than a full thumbs up.The gameplay is fun and exhilarating. The rush I get the closer the player count gets to 1 does not compare to any other game for me. The gun mechanics in this game are better imo than in any other BR at the moment including Blackout.That being said...PUBG Corp only cares about the money. 90% of the rewards for playing you have to pay real money to unlock. The lean/tilting feels slow and unresponsive compared to R6 Siege. so TLDRIf you dont care about being rewarded for playing the game and are only looking for fun gameplay this game can easily provide a couple hundred hours of fun.

review: With almost 600 hrs on record I can say I recommend this game!Is this game fun? Not always...This game manages to raise my heartrate over and over again during intense battles and sophisticated tactics. There is currently no game out there who manages to do that to me! While one match you can decide to go in 'Call of duty style' and 'run and gun' another time you're going for a more stealthy 'fully silenced' approach. It's all possible with PUBG!But the flipside of this is that you sometimes get killed in weird ways. Also I and many other with me are really interested in what the developers actually did with all the money they earned from this game. Because this game lacks optimizations performance and good support. If they used a larger part of the money on actual development I think this game would've gotten more support from the community to eventually grow to one of the biggest e sports games out there.

review: It's hard to say PUBG is a good game or a bad game. The concept behind the game is brilliant. The execution is almost unforgivable given the resources available to Bluehole. Some moments of gameplay remind players this could be one of the best games in a decade others are nigh unforgivable. I'll start with the good. No modern online fps rewards stealth and tactics like this game does. Proper use of camoflage and cover and people will nearly step on you without noticing. Weapons are balanced and dynamic map design is incredible. Three maps offer a widely variable gameplay experience and success is highly satisfying.Now the bad. This is a split second online shooter with servers running at 30 tics and client client latency is really never effectively lower than about 300ms and often much higher than that. (Modern high end computer proper networking proper broadbad connection etc.. the issue is not on my end.) I am constantly killed by impossible shots only to see in the death cam what's happening on my opponents' screens has little similarity to what occurs on mine. Many other issues have been addressed but without fixing client sync this game will never achieve it's potential. Somebody else will make a similar game and make it right. When they do I will dump this game like it spends its days eating junk food and watching daytime television.P.S. Bluehole calling Fix PUBG a success is an insult. It's We're going into 2019 online FPS games are old enough to have children in school. Stop pretending players don't understand client sync latency compensation and hit detection mechanics. If you don't understand them ask somebody for help. These are core mechanics and you have the resources to make them right. Don't be another EA be another Valve. We could use one.

review: So given that I've logged over a hundred hours into this game after owning it for awhile. . . I think it's safe to say that I can honestly judge my opinion on this game. I think PUBG comes very close to getting it right but through cutting corners it falls short of a game really worth playing. The servers seem to be lagging down lately and the player base must be dropping significantly as the match times take upwards of 5 minutes sometimes. There's a huge problem with cheaters and glitches that randomly mess you up. The graphics are lower end and it's clear the design team is green. The menu system is behind it's mobile and console counterparts. This game probably won't be around for much longer. I'd say save your money and play ring of elyisum for free. You'll get much of the same experience.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Very fun game at first and really intense and exciting experience if you have never played a battle royale game before. However instead of pushing more content updates the developers decide to focus on cosmetics and paid lootboxes so the gameplay gets boring after awhile with nothing much added aside from a few weapons and a map. Servers are really really bad cheating problem was really big but they managed to tone that down a little. Game needs a progression system or something to keep people hooked. If you have friends to play with there can be many funny and enjoyable moments but playing solo or even duos is pretty boring. CoD blackout or fortnite are probably better battle royale games than pubg.

review: I loved this game. I built my PC to play this game. I convinced my friends to do the same. It looked like a ton of fun and it met all expectations for a good year. The large amount of downtime and goofy bugs created a perfect recipe for messing around with friends and then suddenly an epic battle would come out of nowhere. The silent solitude of solo games immersed you in what felt like life or death situations where your opponent was just as terrified as you. In game all chat added an extra dynamic for spontaneous exchanges with random people and kept the community vibrant. It was accessible to people who didn't grow up playing shooters and it challenged those who did. The maps are well made. Although there are hiccups the game runs fine overall. All of this added up to a phenomenon which we may never see again.If you're thinking of buying this game you're too late. You missed out. The community is dead. You can't stack boats anymore. All chat has been disabled for some reason. It's a death by 1000 papercuts. They're eliminating all the things which made the game unique to try to position the game as a serious FPS esport. I think that is a terrible idea. Anyone who is interested in that will go play CS GO or something. Unless you have a big group of friends committed to this game I no longer recommend it. I still occassionally play it but the magic is gone.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Funny the game itself is great. Sure it's buggy but it's a fun game for the gameplay but holy cow is the development company awful! Microtransactions are all they care for the chinese have still not been region locked you can no longer choose your server region and all the same old bugs are still here. It's sad that such a great and fun concept got taken over by a F2P game that honestly is not fun at all.It honestly astonishes me how badly a company can do supporting their own product that made them a crazy amount of money. If you somehow haven't bought this game yet don't even worry about it. You're better off getting Ring of Elysieum or whatever it's called.Bluehole sucks their customer support sucks and their priorities suck.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Finally headed in the correct direction. Desync has been greatly reduced frame rates are getting better (my 1080 can actually hit in the 144hz range) and weapon and game balance is pretty good allowing for varying styles of play. Still feels highly unpolished with a dire need for QoL improvements but at least now it works on a technical level.Hopefully they keep the momentum going and maybe capitalize on how shallow Blackout turned out to be and Battlefield V's flop as the fragmented population over 6 game modes 3 maps and however many regions has started to adversely affect queue times (good luck getting a Miramar game outside of peak times at least NA FPP).Turns out the pubg killer is still only likely to be pubg in the long run.

review: I have played PUBG since early access and is has come a long way from its rough beginnings. With 3 maps training map custom modes and many other little nuggets added to the game this game has a good foot to stand on. The realistic feel of the game gives a fun yet stressful feel in its hyped moments. PUBG has given my family and friends hours of fun anger and even some laughs. The gun play is enjoyable and fulfilling. Not to say it is perfect in anyway shape or form plus with the rise of really polished competion it is still worth trying. It can feel slower compared to the other BR titles out there. Still has some lack of content in certain aspects of the game (i.e. progress and ranking). Skins sales can give the feel we are getting gouged sometimes.But with that I would still recommend PUBG for BR players new and old. This winter we are supposed to get a snow map and improvements to the parachute system. Hope to see you on the battlefield.

review: Updating my review after the recent drama. The intent is to provide players with a sense of pride and accomplishment for unlocking different event missions.As for cost we selected initial values based upon what we pulled out of our and other adjustments made to paid rewards before launch. Among other things we're looking at average per player credit earn rates on a daily basis and we'll be making constant adjustments to ensure that players have challenges that are compelling rewarding and of course non attainable via gameplay unless they pay the $9.99 for the Event Pass. Of course levels are purchasable for $4.99.We appreciate but will likely ignore the candid feedback and the passion the community has put forth around the current topics here on Reddit our forums and across numerous social media outlets.Our team will continue to make changes and monitor community feedback and update everyone on the next paid cosmetics as soon and as often as we can.

review: As you can see i was really not happy when this game was in early access (look below for original review) as poor optimization lead to the buildings not loading for me. They have since rectified this problem but by doing this have introduced the game into an unplayable state. the desync bad netcode and awful hit reg have inturn soured this games core aspect... shooting other players. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNTIL THEY FIX IT!!!THIS GAME WAS FOOKIN AMAZING WHEN I FIRST STARTED PLAYING I HAD GREAT FPS AND HAD NO PROBLEMS AT ALL. THEN THE UPDATES CAME AND I THOUGHT OH GOOD THIS SHOULD OPTIMIZE THE GAME EVEN MORE. BUT NOW I HAVE TO TRY AND PLAY HAVING TO WAIT FOR MY ING BUILDINGS TO LOAD IN PROPERELY A MINUTE AFTER I HAVE ING LANDED. MEANING I CANT GO TO ANY HIGH POPULATED AREAS LIKE SCHOOL PO I OR ANY OF THE REST OF THE HIGH ACTION FUN AREAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Just isn't fun

review: PUBG is a game that fulfills what im looking for in a FPS at this time. I started playing very soon after it entered early access and have seen it through all stages of development and at times it can feel a bit broke. The game has improved drastically and I do think that if they continue to "FIXPUBG" that it can be a sustaining game in the BR genre. Personaly I've been looking for the most realistic challenging not as hardcore mode like yet fictional game since I got Call if Duty 3. This is the game that is currently available that has been able to meet those needs. Getting kills and wins is still rewarding because the gunplay can be challenging. Each gun has its upsides and downsides that must be weighed when deciding to swap guns or not and can directly impact your abilty to win. The gunplay is among the best I've ever experienced. Getting into a SR duel is a favorite of mine. Trading body shots to ultimately get that headshot is just effin rights bud! sometimes it can feel unfair but I think this is a result of in game decisions. I mean do you really think you should win a gunfight if you decided to run into an open field before making sure someone wasn't behind 2 boulders and tree camping it?Headphones are a must as the sound and lack of HUD notification where you're being shot from can take time to get used to because of that though I feel transported onto the maps as opposed to just running around on a screen. Running...yes this can feel like a running simulator at times but this can be overcome with your choice of play style. I'd recommend hot dropping every match. With hot dropping you're more likely to get into combat and die so you wont be running for miles on end. However that is also the beauty of PUBG because you can play how you want. If you want to drive around all match and fight everyone that shoots at you you can! If you want to hide in the grass and ride the wall all match you can! Playing the smaller maps also makes it feel less cross countryesque but I feel that the running after the first circle is a direct result of in game decisions The in game items and weapons management is something that meets my needs. I can see what's attached to my gun and as long as im not carrying around a bunch of random ammo everything in my bag and what is on the ground easily. There haven't been many instances where I've run into hackers. I've seen a few but playing FPP in NA exclusvely is a mitigating factor. I used to come across a lot of Asian players months ago but I haven't encountered any for a long time but I've also been playing solos for a long time so take that for what it's worth.Currently I find myself needing the new map but I do like that they are adding more skins I just wish I didn't have to pay for them and I wish skins were tied to progression. If the game was free then I'd be more accepting of the number of things one can buy. I despise how you can get locked crates with earned in game currency. It's like "I just paid you $30 or whatever for the game spent however long enough getting 700 coins to get a locked crate and oh don't mind if you do but now I have to get 1400 coins to get screwed by another locked crate." Personally what I want to see done is all of the locked crates opened for free attach new skins to challenges make changes so that BP can be used for other things like 7000bp $4.99 or something so that if you really want that new skin but don't want to pay more money then you can grind for it. Or make the game free and give everyone that paid for it like 60000bp and the choice of any single item that's been available except for PLAYERUNKNOWN's Bandana (even though I don't have one). For the most part I continue to play this game because I love the core game and gunplay eventhough it may honestly be the only thing it has going for it but I'm willing to be optimistic because if they fix it then I it'd be hard for me to think of another game that would be able to meet my needs and more.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: NVM. In my previous review i said "they fixed tons of issues and optimized the game quite a bit". Then i uninstalled the game because once again they messed up the whole thing and it was a buggy and unplayable game. Now i gave it another chance (i've tried to give it another try like 6 times by now) and what did i find Terrible FPS. At a certain time my PC was able to run it around 90 100 FPS. Right now i get around 30 FPS as soon as i drop and then the rest of the match i get around 54 which is terrible. The servers are trash once again. Bullet reg is terrible player movement seems laggy from time to time and sometimes even with low ping you can't get loot because it will literally put it back on the floor. Sound is even worst. You hear someone coming from the right when its from the left which is stupid considering how important sound is. Sometimes a car or the plane suddenly increases the volume to like 500% which makes impossible to hear anything else than their sounds. Hackers are still a thing. First match i got into i got killed with a pistol from 200m away which makes no sense. Then i spectated the guy and he was literally sniping with a pistol. I reported him but i guess he'll continue to hack.From what i remember they did a campaign called "Fix PUBG" but looks like it was only to hype players and make them come back but it ended up being "Break PUBG More".Terrible game go invest your money on a game where developers care about the players and not the money they can make by hyping but never delivering.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

The game has been an incredible laggy mess. Warping around Putting 20 bullets in a guy that stays alive Crashes after nearly every game Audio glitchesNot to mention all the hackers and afkers that were introduced with lootboxes.

review: Mixed feelings here and hard decision which way to point the thumb.Let's get one thing straight right from the bat this game is fun and is even more fun with friends. But I have very serious issues with some aspects of it.Mainly net code/servers servers perform poorly which affects the game in various ways e.g. you cannot pick up items you get stuck in doors you see doors closed but they are open for other players you get shot before you see your enemy or after you get to cover cannot see grenades flying your way or you see them bounce elsewhere than they finally explode your bullets disappear your audio is all over the place etc.What I feel is frustrating is the fact that the development team doesn't address this in appropriate manner.Almost year after version 1.0 with many updates and bug fixes the game still doesn't feel right because the source of the "bugs" is often poor server performance and it seems like developers are more focused on adding paid cosmetic items (hard to consider them "micro" transactions with prices like $10 for some of them) than tackling the issues head on.This game must be FANTASTIC LAN experience with proper server settings but it is somewhat random and at times frustrating online.I am giving this game a negative review not because it is not fun to play. If you are more casual player looking for a little harder game to try out or if you just don't care about the issues I mentioned BY ALL MEANS BUY IT.I give this game negative review because as a competitive player I have a high standards and I don't like the game becoming a cash cow instead of what it deserves to be well optimized e sports title with a team of people behind it who want to make the best possible battle royal game out there.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I recommend this game BUT there are a few conditions. I only recommend this game if 1. you are going to play this game with friends its much better that way.2. you are ok with an unfinished product and have the patience to wait for the developers to fix the game.3. you have a beefy computer. This game isnt optomized so if you want good FPS you need a good rig.4. you are playing from a region that has servers. (For example USA and EU)Further more this game has a lot of potential. It is a realistic battle royal and can be very intense at times. The developers just need to focus up and improve the game one update at a time.

review: Great game. It has come a long way from it's Early Access beginings and anyone who says it's worse than it was in EA is full of Desync has recently been solved (during routine maintanence no less) hackers are getting squashed region selection is gone and combat feels good most of the time. There are still a few server issues I'm experiencing (Network Lag Detected) but other than that everything is great.

review: Latest Update Good improvements death cams are useful to improve and report hackers more accurately although there is much to be improved on it recording game matches for later review like call of duty is great but it needs much improvement the new optics overhaul is fantastic. Variable zoom 8X and 6x scopes varying reticles on weapons very nice. Improvement of healing in vehicles and what not is a good start.Optimization of course is terrible my PC will max out Crysis but won't on this game.The game has seen a lot of improvement for sure. It is much better off now than it was a while ago. The stuff like vaulting and new map and weapons and what not plus optimization improvements make this game's future look bright. Still I've only one a couple times in a few hours even with some good teammates.

review: Biggest i have seen now. At the beginning nice game and very well made but now after a long period of so called fix PUBG still 500+ bugs. Cars flip over and over and over again. I get hit full life by a car with like 2 miles per hours dead. After a flip with a motor bike i got knocked up into the air about like 5 kilometers. Lobbys won't start. I hit people 5 times at the exact same spot where they hit me 2 times with the same weapon and i got killed and they still had half life. Cars bug into into walls and grounds. Also bugs do exist since the Release. Do i have to mention other examples or is it enough? I would really like to refund this t bader than Wolfteam and also bader than Tetris. Would enjoy every game more. Can i still refund it pls? And Yes i got 300+ hours gametime and now its enough if u think the game can't get worse wait 1 week. I don't care of any wrong written word or wrong grammar. And now just let me say this one last thin To everyone who wants to buy this game or who wants to play it play any other shooter and battle royal game pls so bad and so !!!!

review: PUBG is the type of game where it starts off with not caring too much if you die in the first few minutes (approx 90 players alive) after a little while and some reasonable loot and gear has been found you would prefer not to die at this point but still not too fussed if you die (approx 60 70 players alive). After the 3rd/4th blue circle You start to believe that you can achieve the impossible...you could possibly win...you'll taste the sweet fruits of victory...(10 players remaining)...you've made it to top 10....but you still want more....no more mistakes or joking around now...you're close....(last 2 players)...you believe in this...you can win! But alas...you make an idiotic mistake. You end as #2.....that moment will haunt you forever...This is what will happen every game you'll feel rage anger and above all serenity when you die because you know that the game is over....until you start the next one. Welcome to the battleground.

review: What can I say about this game that hasent already been said. Sure its the most played game on Steam atm but I think when a new Battle Roayle game comes out that is more polished and better designed I think this game is going to die. The devs are very slow to make changes to this buggy mess and are more likely to sue someone for using the BR formula even though they were not the first to do it themselves. I must say if they think they can sue Fortnite and get away with it they are going to be so suprised when they cannot use Epic games Engine for this game anymore. This may be a smaller gripe about the game but its too realistic. Gun shots that hit your body sounds like your hitting metal and not flesh The movement of your character is too clunky and heavy feeling. I know this game is going for that realism but I think it takes it too far. The game even a year later still has bugs and all the devs have done is add a new map and weapons. Not a single thing has been done about the extrodinarily intense recoil of the AKM or the fact shots that should hit when your point blank range from someone and then come to find out in deathcams that not a single shot hit. Overall this game needs a complete overhaul before I can recommend it to anyone. If you like the realism I think this is a good choice for you. But im just warning anyone thinking of playing that it could be too much for you.

review: PUBG has changed the face of gaming its no doubt. This took your usual "running and gunning" routine and changed it to a full nerve racking survival of the fittest There is almost no room for being slow or making mistakes. In my opinion this game has helped me hone my gaming skills and brings me to the highest level to playing every time i load into a game. If you are a new player i would highly suggest finding the areas that people drop into the most and join them there in those areas this way it gives you a start to the blood flowing action this game has and takes your skills to an extreme level. also another tip... check out Twitch.com and watch how some of the world class players game and take some notes!

But they only invested money on skins and crates to gain even more money without fixing the base problem. With a huge difference this is the worst looking unreal engine 4 game considering the size of the company and the time and money they got to fix and develop a great game. It is on alpha yet while pubg released some updates since release. PatheticEverytime I try to jump in again it dissapoints me even more and I already lost any remaining hope.

review: An online first person shooter currently the game is not yet fully completed and there is no campaign yet. The game starts off with you on a plane that is slowly crashing the aim is to jump off the plane and loot buildings for weapons and armour to fight against other online players in a quickly closing circle. If you get caught outside the circle you slowly die and as the circle gets smaller the health loss becomes much greater this is known as the blue zone which more often than not will kill you. If you are new to the game be prepared to die a lot in order to learn how to play and hopefully fight back. Im over 100 hours in and I am still bad at this game but it is highly satifying to get more than 1 kill in a game.I quote a friend of mine that has also reviewed this game and I couldn't word it better myself "Somehow even though this game hates me 90% of the time I still keep racking up the hours of playtime because damn it's good!" DemolitionDemon.It can be played alone or with a squad of 4. It is highly addictive and a lot of fun with mates. I recommend this game to all gamers that enjoy a good fast paced first person shooter.Edit I am almost certain that there is no intent on them making a campaign for the game since it has come out of early access. Haven't played it in months due to the large waiting times on the Oceanic servers. May have changed however many of the players I played alongside have stopped playing therefore I haven't played it in a long time.

review: Worse Rip off than No Mans' Sky. You will give money for a game you won't be able to play.Every game will contain of at least 15 cheaters if you play solo or of at least 70 cheaters if you play Squads. You will never be able to connect to the loby and will always tell you that an Error occured and offer you to "reconnect". Reconnect of course will take you back to the "An Error has Occured" screen and offer you reconnect again and it will get into an infinite loop of reconnecting. If you EVER get into a game you will try to pick up a rifle or a pistol you'll have to hit your pick up key at least 15 times before it takes the shirt that's under the gun you want to take and get shot. If you ever manage to pick up the gun and load it you will shoot at someone blood will fly out you'll hit them at least 10 times but it will do absolutely no damage to them and they will down you with just one shot from a .45 acp pistol thoguth your Level 3 helmet. Developers have most likely given up on this game since it's made them enough money so they don't have to do anything in their lives anymore. They will never get rid of the cheaters and never fix the servers. This game will never work as one would expect it to. They had more success making a mod for Arma 3 than this load of.... In my opinion all the current developers should be fired and have their names tagged so they can't ever find a job in game industry again. Hire new ones to fix this thing which we had to pay to play under promise of it working.Strongly recommend you to NOT buy this game don't waste the money you have just to be regretting it.

review: Edit Recently this game is getting a lot of for the devs being "Greedy". I disagree with this. They bring us scheduled weely and monthly updates which all have new features and fixes. The possibilty of actually finding a glitch in this game has decreased substancially the same goes for cheaters. Maybe i m just lucky to not have found many cheaters but i think others need to understand that this is one of the biggest games in the world and its not going to be perfect but to me its a really fun game and would recommend it to others. Also fortnite is a trash game let it die already.What can i say it's brilliant. I started playing battle royale games with h1 and i liked that too. When pubg came out i was eager to try but my laptop hardly ran it now with a proper pc i can enjoy what ive been missing. I love all of this game (but mostly cause im a fan of br games). The gameplay is realistic which is what i strive for in a game and why im starting to get bored of fortnite. The combat is nice and mostly smooth. And as much as people dislike the new map i think its really fun and i can still enjoy erengal.Pros RealisticGood Graphics (On PC)Combat is funFunny momentsGood rewards (seriously just sell your crates u will get a lot more than opening them)Nice customizationCons Driving Mechanics (but its sometimes funny)bit of lagThe start of the game requires skill to survive but the end is mostly whether the circle is on you or not.I would definately buy this game if you're unsure. It's so fun and hopefully the developers will keep it alive for the the next few years.Updated this sentence for the nominate game awards challenge.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. This probably the only game that I have the most hours in that I'll give a clean and solid no for. Do not pick up this game in its current state. In fact do not pick up this game at all let the battelground franchise die but at the very least show the developers we expect more from them for this game. It worked better at launch than it does now and that's not even saying all that much. Gunplay is often unrewarding and feels floaty satisfying sniper shots outweighed by aggressively bad over the shoulder aiming and lackluster CQB. Lobbies are packed with Chinese Hacking Advertisers and half the time you die in the final circle the kill cam shows them auto locking to your head or tracking you through walls from a mile away. The wins are so rewarding and so fun it keeps you wanting more but don't give in to this game not now not for a while. It deserves the hate at this stage.

review: Update 2 With the Vikendi map where they done a great job and well worth playing and with all the stuff they made right now for a while I have to once again change my verdict to that I do recommend PUBG.IMO it looks like they did hire a new project manager that have some good visions and have a drive.Update Due to the inability to deal with cheaters and also now for the third time when actually doing something issue a massban latest destroying a saturday gaming evenig for tousands of gamers.Twitter PUBG Help 2018 06 16 https //twitter.com/PUBG_help/status/1008091296936972288Twitter BattlEye 2018 06 08 https //twitter.com/TheBattlEye/status/1005206162780893184 PUBG Anti Cheat Update Falsely Bans PC Players Fix Incoming 2018 03 08 http //www.newsweek.com/pubg anti cheat update false ban pc fix 836194So third time in a short time I see this mass ban false positive makes me wonder if you actualy can play this anymore not to risk destroy your several years old account....... Great game First I was a bit uncertain if I would give an "Up" or "Down" on this one but with the amount of time and fun I had in it "Up" did win with a narrow margin and did come out as my choice.A game unfortunately plagued with an ongoing cheater problem of the highest magnitude So spent a lot of hours in the game with friends but even now after more than a year the cheater infestation is worse than ever why is that?During more of a year of development we have crates and keys and a market and just recently a lobby/friendslist that starts to work only a year later still audio (voip) problems but not as many disconnects as before but still IMO an apparently extremely weak underdeveloped anti cheat package.Sure I understand that any server side check for flying boats and flying cars etc do cost money with the need of more server sided power which do cost but does not unhappy customers the game reputation also cost in real time and definitely in a future venture when they try to sell the next product?There have IMO been many very valid suggestions on how to tighten up the anti cheat without causing a major impact on the server I made a few my self and one from a friend that I know would work and I will give some samples here 1) Grab the replay files after the round is over for lets say the 4 in top or 4 random of the top 20 and let an external server do all the sanity check of speed heal time reload time height distance on kills movement speed and so on so forth from that replay file.Should at least be easy to find flying cars and boats and would not cause any server load cant grab one or no data to grab? Try some more and if not possible flag the account.2) A Server side load efficient client sanity check of the client reported data.During lobby phase use clients stats to decide let's say 3 of 100 clients to monitor for the sake of server side load use stat as selection criteria.During the round could even be in periods do a "sanity check" on those selected client's reported data like rate of fire movement speed heal time height movement over water and so on and use result to flag or not. 3 event mode) Self sanitation from tk'ers can easily be achieved by add 5min to 10min block time before you can enter the next match even 5min/tk block time and a 24h event lockout after let's say 10tk's. Popup window for the killed person Was the team kill intentional? YES / NOAnyway Still like the game but not so much the road it's heading down or even lack of a road.IMO some cheap shoot grab it now never mind the future beancounter rulings is probably causing major damage because I have a hard time imagine that gamers/developers with some soul would handle the PUBG big ship of opportunities this bad.Last Personally I hope for some redemption and a bright/brighter future for this game that really had everything going for it. cb99

review: They're heading the right way on this as of lately I don't know what made them change gear but they're doing things right as of lately. I would highly recommend storing this on an SSD instead of HDD and not playing on some dead end PC and complaining that it does not work. Honestly there are a few issues with the game that's true. New maps and updates coming out quicker and of better quality nicer animations and the game feels less clunky it feels decent as of lately I am getting over 140FPS most of the time. No matter what game comes out no other game seems to replace the gunfights/combat in PUBG. It's getting better.

review: EDIT Even after months in bugfixing and further development the game is still buggy as hell. Well what do you expect when the developers spend time rather on paid cosmetic content than on making the game at least as technically stable as most of the clones. Fighting against the game itself gets tiresome really quick and you will rather move one to the next big thing than hope for brighter future which will probably never comeSimplistic yet addictive like hell. Great atmosphere fun gameplay that gets better as you get used to it and unbelievable shot of adrenaline once you enter the final few. This thing is a solid action piece for solo play but absolutely shines if you have a friend or two with you.

review: UPDATE 2 The game's in a far better state now server location is automated there have been significantly helpful UX overhauls the game runs better. Gameplay can be frustrating but those golden moments are all worth it. There's nothing else like it give it a shot.UPDATE 1 Optimization is almost there and crashing is almost non existent but bugs and performance issues are still present to the point that this is not an acceptable release state and alongside Brendan Greene's horrible stances on "hate speech" stream sniping team killing self defence and acting like not wanting high ping players on your server is "xenophobic" I will continue to not recommend this game no matter how much I may be playing it myself. Call it hypocritical but the core game is still enjoyable and I'm mainly riding on that high until I inevitably get banned for nothing.PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS PUBG Plunkbat or whatever you want to call it is a sensation in more ways than the obvious.Is the game fun absolutely... when it works.Do they update frequently? About enough and they keep it to the important However this does not excuse PUBG Corp. and by extension BlueHole Inc.'s actions that have been brought to attention recently The liberal banning of so called "stream snipers" and offering privileged support to popular Twitch streaming personalities over the average user rather than applying proper justice and chastising the streamer for not hiding their map with their streaming overlay.The implementation of microtransactions and a loot box system in Early Access going against a prior statement they made about not going to do such a thing.The poor optimization across the board delivering sub par performance even on the lowest settings.The server issues that result in game breaking lag unfitting of a simultaneously tactical and reaction based game as this. (The BETA servers usually perform smoother than the vanilla ones!)Finally the crashing is just absurd spitting out cryptic error messages and never crashing for the same reason twice alongside rarely being able to rejoin a game following a crash.The implementation of anti "hate speech" guidelines for a "T" rated action game where the primary goal is to kill everybody.And perhaps the most offensive act being the threat of banishment for editing .ini files to gain performance by reducing graphical fidelity due to the poor optimization every PC game allows the player to edit their .inis to gain clientside convenience over how they configure their game they should just block in the engine any commands that might override the graphics of the game in such a way that they offer an objective advantage to a player over someone playing on in game settings only.While I wholeheartedly enjoy PUBG (like I said when it works) and everything it offers truly I've played nothing quite like it but I seriously advise any prospective buyers to wait until the game is out of Early Access before diving in the strikes against it in its current state I believe make it not worth the $40 not even $20. Play Fortnite or a PUBG mode in Minecraft or Roblox or what have you if you must but don't give PUBG Corp. your money until the final product is available.

review: So after 49.1 hours playing RECENTLY To play this game you will have to accept that YOU cannot cheat but if you are a Twitch streamer (most of whom have thankfully moved on to other games) the developers will allow your cheats in order to rack up as many kills as possible and show how awesome it is to be successful at this game. If you are not a Twitch streamer you will eventually tire of constantly being killed by cheaters from SE Asia. The developers in their infinite wisdom made the servers random. Since they can only control North America the rest of the world does whatever hacking they please. This makes the game into complete garbage.There are people who get 45 kills in a match and average 99% headshots.The cheats are Name Hacks(other players see your name over you at all times) Supply Hacks(other players generate guns from nothing) Headshot Hacks(other players pull the aim button and it centers on your head) Aimbots (other players sights follow you) wall hacks(they can see and shoot through walls) lag hacks(Pull the trigger and your game freezes so you miss) speed hacks(other players move so fast you cant hit them) dodge hacks (other players press q or e while walking so you cant hit them) ammo hacks (their mag never runs out) instant kill hacks(one shot one kill any weapon). Oh there is nothing else to do with the money so you buy crates...that are 99.99% worthless since you rarely get anything useful.I bought it so I'm playing it but...the game is irreparably hacked.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: NEW ONE Becoming better with updates but still not stable like it should. Devs are putting new emotes like that will make big game change but so much fixes and optimization need to be done that should be priority for fixing. At any case i change review to RECOMMEND because in past couple of months only this PUBG is that I am playing in free time.RECENT REVIEW Terrible performance of servers for game that costs 30 euros. Until there is no fix dont pay for this game. So much months waiting and hoping something will change to better but you are always hoping that you will have good 2h of play without network lag. Shame!FIRST REVIEW If you put on side all bugs server stability and performance issues this is one of best FPS that I ever played. Graphics are not on level of another games in this moment on market but gameplay is 10/10. Personaly i prefer big maps slow progressed game 30 minutes round is in my opinion perfect scale. Game have still place for improvements but compared with another games in battle royal franchise this is simulation not arcade game.From another side like I say on begining performance issues server problem can sometimes kill your energy and make your blood presure very high but as soon you jump in next game you will just forget about issues and transfer to new problem loot kill and survive )From this hours spend on game I am suggesting it even if you play only solo games but full potential is playing team.In time writing this review still it is having so much MIXED review results I think game definitly deserve POSITIVE reviews.

review: I wanted to buy PUBG for a long time now and I had a lot expectations. Ive been playing free br games to this day set on all performance settings not the graphics. Capped it on 60 fps even though I have a gpu that can handle more but I am awfully poor that I cant even buy extra vrams and 144hz monitor to support it. Ive set my settings on the lowest settings to get higher perfomance but the game is still laggy. I would not recommend this game at its current state right now. Oceania servers is dead but I can still play with guys on NA servers decent ping but man the lag. I can move freely no lag spikes but everything is lagging.(December 22 2018) this what the hell is happening the game is broken Im stuck with the menu screen with icy mountains with nothing on it. It says that TSLgame is notresponding on my task manager I ended its task but the game is still running I checked the task manager again its still there but I cant end its taska anymore so I had to restart now my computer is not working and I had to change its bios settings I thought it was my computers thats at fault but when I opened the game again its still the same. Its telling me access denied wtf? I cant even uninstall the game.Everyone is telling me to restart my pc after this I will uninstall and refund this (December 23 2018) I swear to god if this game crashes again I will tell everyone I know who owns to refund this game and play ROE how is this possible BlueHOLE I uninstalled the game but tslgame somehow doesnt want to end its task. How many times do you want me to restart my pc?
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is probably the best game of its type. I know many will disagree but its a true battle royale for these simple reason.1) Loot is random and varied with no benifits or downside beside the weapons inherit atributes.2) The selection of map from large to small to suit all types of game play.3) Realistic mechanics i.e. bullet drop/leading sots.4) The last moments are more intense than any other battle royale making winning feel much more statifying5) Its always fun by yourself or with a team of friends.I know many other will say fortnite is better but a game with chests in the same place/house and people surfing on rockets isnt a battle royale its a clown fiesta of random where someone can pick up the exact same weapon as you but have a better grade and win what should be a fair fight. Not to mention bunny hop shooting battles quick inform themilitary they have to jump up and down while shooting to be victorious. Games like fortnite sure may be more fun but sure arent a more statifying or true represntation of a battle royale.

review: I mean I could talk about all the other stuff every other review talks about but the one thing that really me off enough to come write this negative review wasn't even a bug or any lack of optimisation its something far more petty but that I really cant understand. why the hell are crates allowed to land in parts of the water behind the freaking invisible wall in the sea? bc 1) I had no idea there was such a wall for starters (granted its likely bc its a big map and there's nothing at high sea but still) 2) as the name implies it's invisible so the only way to see where it is it's to hit against it and be unable to move forward 3) and lastly I just watched a ton of time going after a crate that in no way was shown to be outside of my reach by the game itself. the crate landed inside the circle normally no problem I went to loot it and look at my surprise when as I'm about to reach it I hit a freaking invisible wall I had no idea existed or at least allowed crates to fall on the other side of it. as I said this is a really petty complaint in comparison the other reviews many that I agree with. but i've never felt the need to write b4 bc I expected the game would improve. but when this happens I feel like the people behind the game couldnt even think of something as simple as somehow telling the player a crate is offside or just not letting the damn thing fall outside boundary. feels like there's a lack of care tbqh.

review: Is this a good game? I don't know. Is it a compelling game? Yes. There is something addicting about the experience. I recommend it. It has its bugs and flaws aplenty but in the end your heart will pound. Also the game is shockingly good with friends in either duo (my preferred mode) or squads. Whether you are hot dropping into milbase or Sanhok or trying to win by landing in the middle of nowhere and poverty looting for 30 minutes doing it with a team makes the experience better. Also play it on PC. Controller support is terrible.Pros Compelling addicting engaging excitingCons Competitive poor mtx model laggy buggy clunky frustrating

review: In all honesty Player Unknowns Inconsistent Battlegrounds is the best Mediocre game I can think of at the moment. Why? because between the genuinely enjoyable moments this game provides it has severe persistent quality of life issues the Lag still being the most egregious of them. half the games I've played are smooth while others are rife with rubberbanding characters and bullets that seem fly through hitboxes and even curve around walls. considering most of the game's netcode is still trash after all the patches this isnt a BETA anymore this is a release and it seems like the quality has barely improved past that and YET there are still expensive asf Microtransactions in a game that costs $30 ($10 for a silver skin for one gun) the MOBILE version is free and offers a more complete experience.. wait for COD Blackout or Ring of Elysium to release if you want to play battle royale that s pseudo realistic. if I have to use call of duty as a benchmark on GOOD hit detection GOOD level design and GOOD microtransaction implementation then a lot needs fixing TECHNICAL BREAKDOWN***optimization is terrible. If you dont have anything better than a 960for nvidia users than this game'll be a struggle to run properly in general. summary It's a gigantic pain in the for something that works well 20% of the time. The hardware requirments are pretty insane and even at low resolutions the game tanks. Granted I have a gtx 860m which is very dated by todays standards and it can reach 40 60 frames on all maps with most setting turned down and resolution scale set to 94. still despite all that tinkering the game FPS can drop wildly. During gunfights (THE MAIN PART OF THE GAME) the frame rate can tank from a smooth 60 to as low as 25 in microseconds it's jarring on my hardware and Ive seen similar drops and hitches in much more powerful rigs too. it has to do with the items and the character models guns and gathering loot s with the frame rate so its not the environments of the game but the static objects that kill FPS for some reason. It doenst help that the tickrate (which its claimed to be 60hz) feels below 20hz at one point the servers were at 17HZ. all you need to know is that Low tickrate means you're going to be missing a lot of shots even when youre on target because the animations and server dont refresh fast enough to register your shots. I've had shots visibly GO THRU enemy hitboxes at close range center mass. And sometimes objects in the gameworld will clip thru static objects ie backpack stuck in floorboard even though it looks interactable like this hurts the quality of the game and he devs seem to have no interest in fixing it. to end If the shooting such a main aspect of your game is broke then it wont be an Esport. Ever. Even if streamers and popularity say otherwiseThankfully I havent run into any cheaters but Im in North America where they enforce anti cheat more strictly Asia and Oceana is different. Save your money and yourself from frustration. fighting the flawed mechanics of the game just makes it sweatier not better. This game'll just give you a headache. This isn't entirely some Indie Dev either at first it was but then was acquired by another publisher. the time and money theyve recieved to fix the games issues IS WORTH criticizing. this isnt because fixing the game is too hard and this isnt some small indie studio in this case the devs and publisher are blatantly pockeitng most of the revenue PUBG generates anyways not bothering to care whether the product works or not. SO if you pay $30 full for this game. shame on you .
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: There is a lot of hate toward PUBG. And it's unjustified.The game is mindblowing tense fast scaring hard and puninishing and it also have some crazy fun moments.Imagine a dark souls without monster patterns to learn. Every door could be the last you open every window the last you peek in. To survive you need to tame your nerves and ride your fear use strategy tactic and luck.The maps are huge and the weapons are plenty and with beautiful mechanics.Sure there are some bugs but honestly nothing that breaks it and the game has DRASTICALLY improved in the last months. In regard to performance with competitive settings I get reliable 100fps with a gtx970 and 40ms ping on EU servers.While the developers may not be the most skilled they keep working on the game continuosly trying to improve its experience. They should deserve much more respect and less toxicity.imho PUBG is still the best battle royale experience on the market and by a very large measure.

review: Waste of money DO NOT BUY. In the beginning pubg was a rough playing game so of course early access was expected to lang and have low fps. Then the golden year 2017 early 2018 and the game was looking promising it was running well genuinely fun and was giving me consistently over 80fps on very low settings with a couple things turned up like shaders and textures. With the #fixpubg the light was glowing brighter and the future for the game seemed promising even more so now than before but as soon as that innitiative ended the game once again fell into a buggy and laggy piece of crap. The game constantly gives me splashscreen and i know i've loaded in i can hear the play and look around which changes direction the splashscreen stays on the menu too i have to go into inventory to stop it. Second WHEN I SHOOT A GUN MY FPS GOES FROM A NICE 100 to 3 and almost always results in me getting killed for no reason despite having the time and aim advantage. If you are looking for an alternative look at Ring Of Elysium its made by tencent who run pubg mobile (a far better game) and is free to play. Pubg is no longer early access and a fullpriced game yet they constantly roll out cosmetic garbage instead of fixing their game having spent money when i thoguht the game was looking good i feel so stupid i was like lets buy skins beause the game is getting fun and consistent.

review: Battle Royal is fun and PUBG implements what a battle royale fps should be like it has the most realistic visuals and combat systems than any other battle royale game out there. However this game was doomed the moment it was entrusted with a Korean developer team. Koreans absolutely suck at making games and this is a fact. PC Bangs dominate the gaming market in Korea so there is no emphasis on making a "good and well polished" game. All Korean developers need to do is make a multiplayer game with a cashcow system such as adding cosmetics and lootboxes which they eventually did in PUBG. There is no real incentive for Bluehole to make this game better by fixing bugs optimizing it better because the real money for them comes from loot boxes and cosmetics.PUBG was "OFFICIALLY RELEASED" out of open beta on December 20th 2017 and it did not feel like a fully finished game then and it still does not today November 2018. Optimization is still terrible there are tons of bugs out there hackers roam the servers and Bluehole continues to milk the cow by making PUBG mobile starting COMPETITIVE PUBG when the state of the game is laughable compared to other games and making more cosmetics available.Bluehole made a ton of money from an incomplete game in open beta so why make the game perfect at all if they could just continue the cycle?
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Played for nearly one thousand hours don't roccomend it.For players who are playing servers like Oceania it takes forever to start a lobby and a game. I think the servers simply broke and the developers are not fixing it because of its small playerbase.For players who are playing in big servers such as Asia or North America the game is always laggy and desync is everywhere and this is after I used a gaming VPN.The game developers are not putting effort into the game. This game needs some evolutionary changes instead of just adding new guns and vehicles.Last thing is the anti cheat system. Although hackers are no longer frequently seen in this game obvious cheats are still everywhere. In lots of games that I started there was someone selling hacks using the voice chat.Recently I got banned for literally nothing. I never used any hacks or insulted any players. Playing this game is now more frustrating than enjoying.The reasons I still stick with the game is because it has realistic graphics sounds good shooting mechanics and lots other that other BR games can not beat. Though if the game is still developing in the wrong direction it will certainly end very soon.I really don't want PUBG to die I hope it can recover its glory it once had. I want PUBG to be great again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I put some good time into this game back when it first came out. There where so many glitches but also so many moments that you could only experience in this game. This game had horrible optimization back then and with a gtx 970 it worked ok but now that its been I think more than a year you would think that they would fix the optimization but no for some reason even after upgrading to a gtx 1080 my framerate is still the same but with more frequient FPS drops im talking like going from 82 fps to like 10 15 when I get in a gun fight yes I run the game at 2560x1600 but that doesnt change the fact that this game should already be fixed. Im just gonna give up on this game until its actually working if you have friends who are willing to deal with performance issues then buy the game but if you spend good money into building a PC and you want the performance you paid for just go to ing Ring of Elysium or Fortnite not only because its free but because their games actually work. Ill be waiting quietly. hopefully this game will shoot back up and actually be fun once again.p.s. blah blah blah game bad game bad my hair toothpaste.

review: I like the game I do certainly think it's much better then say Fortnite and I also heard about the crossover they're doing with Capcom with the new RE2 Remake and that they have the Suicide Squad movie outfits for players. They do constant updates for the game constantly add new content and honestly I think it's good. I don't really have too many complaints about the game itself other than no one I know plays it anymore and I don't really play it without friends oh and I've seen myself people with aimbots who just shoot into the air and hit me from miles away though I haven't experienced that in a long time so I'm not sure it's valid. This is one game where I feel you need to have friends in order to enjoy yourself a good bit otherwise it'll just turn into a boring and frustrating game even with all of the new content they added. Only complaint I have outside of the actual game itself with the actual developers was the terrible idea to try to sue Epic Games over Fortnite over "stolen ideas" when a lot of the Battle Royale genre was done before but that's a different can of worms.

review: Overall not a bad game. The concept itself is absolutely fantastic and despite its flaws one can still have a great time with it. So why the negative review? Because PUBG Mobile is just so much better! It runs better has better netcode has Facebook friend integration there is better loot it's just as intense while being more accessible and best of all it is FREE! That accessible point might be a bit of a turnoff to some but let me explain. Yes there are some bots in matches especially at early levels enemy fire and footsteps are shown on the map the direction you were hit from is shown on your screen and there is likely some aim assist working alongside the netcode... but so what? It is still challenging intense and most importantly it ends up being more FUN. Isn't that what is important in the end?Now if you are turned off by touch controls here is the best part of it. There is an OFFICIAL EMULATION PORT of PUBG Mobile you can play on your PC. You can download it at https //syzs.qq.com/en/ (in case the link doesn't show Google 'PUBG Mobile PC' and it comes right up). The controls are very similar to the PC version and it has a similar setup to Fortnite in that emulator players are matched up against each other but you can also invite any of your friends playing on mobile into your party. Lightning and Quantum Studios did an incredible job with this title.If you like the idea of PUBG but just find that you are not 337 enough to get ahead in the title or just want to play a better optimized and more accessible version then definitely check out PUBG Mobile PC. You can always move to the Steam version later if you want a greater challenge. Even if you are a PUBG vet you should check this out so you can play with your friends who have phones but not high end PCs. Finally if you enjoy this version let people know about it. There are probably lots of people out there who have had bad experiences with the Steam version and have moved on to other games (coughFortnitecough) and may find PUBG Mobile PC to be the perfect experience for them.

Controls are awesome especialy in dire situations2. Maps are pretty big which is good.3. review: I've had this game from almost the start. I've seen a lot of different changes and bugs that either made the game better or worse. The new Vikendi map is easily the best map they've made. Friends and I have been absolutely hooked on this map since it launched and the new weapons vehicles and challenges really help keep you playing. This game is by no means perfect but you should already know that. The people that hate/complain about this game probably don't have the hardware to really max frames and get the gameplay they want. The engine isn't optimized as much as you'd like which raises the bar of hardware you need. Even still before I got my new PC I could still win while only hitting 30fps (gross I know.) You'll never be able to get a sense of this game if you play it for the 2 hour refund mark and give up. You have to hone your skills and really dive into the locations and tactics that will keep you alive. I'll be playing this game for as long as it's being played.

review: This game is ...like... not bad? its ok ...sort of...Playersunknown's Battlegrounds or in short PUBG is an addictive and fun game(Mostly with friends).The gameplay sort of reminds me H1Z1 however it does feel a bit diffrent.playing solo isn't that fun to say the truth at least for me.The game gets boring real quickly tho playing with friends or in groups is way more fun and exciting. The loot boxes can help to recover the money you spent on the game if you play a lot ..(A LOT).Other than that the hitbox is funky mechanics are ok and overall the optimaztion is fine5/7 would get ear in starting lobby again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Good and fun ballistics and gunplay graphics and visual style is decent (I'd only like some military apparel to go with you know military guns and all).You can customise your character with plenty of clothing items to choose from of various civilian styles I'm still waiting for something I like though pilling up my BP. One set I like I got from a Twitch prime drop and the other few items were ridiculously overpriced on the market (like the black coat). Finding what you want also isn't easy as the game uses the cancerogenic horrible lootbox system lately the new items have also been available as a direct purchase (good) BUT mostly (all the good ones) cost more real money not BP (horrible).The gameplay is often intense and engaging battle royale with 99 (not really at least half of those die within the first 3 minutes...) other people last person (team) is the winner.The game used to have many de sync and network issues and whatnot but recently it's been getting a lot better. I haven't had any bad experiences due to network issues in the last 2 weeks of playing (at the time of writing this comment.The ranking system is broken at the moment I wouldn't recommend 'grinding for rank'.The game is receiving relatively regular updates and patches and seems to be going in a good direction overall there have been several set backs in the form of faulty patches and questionable mechanics released.Overall I enjoy the battle royale gamemode and PU's Battlegrounds offers enjoyable gunplay for it. Based on that I'd recommend it.P.S. WackyJacky101 offers great in depth videos and tutorials for many aspects of the game (and even some others) I definitely recomend checking out his YouTube channel if you want to get better.

review: Not a bad game but it needs better optimization instead of more content at first.As someone who played both PUBG and Fortnite nearly the same amount of time I can see why people tend to complain about PUBG. At first you have to buy the Game for 30 bucks only to be faced with terribly overpriced In Game Skins (at least they don't give you any advantage and you don't have to buy them but to be honest the Sanhok Event Pass seemed like a scam) Then there are tons of hackers and I can say I've seen many of them. Most of the time they're using an Aimbot or Wallhack (but you can report it after getting killed by them and in the end they often get banned and you receive a message about it but they won't stop to exist in my opinion like in every online game)And like I said in the beginning the game is quite unoptimized. I experienced it myself read about it everywhere and my friends who all have decent machines experienced the same. (but it's hard to tell an example because in my opinion 90 % of the time these are minor issues and the devs are working on it even when it takes a lot of time as you can see)So in the end you can see it's hard to tell wheter to recommend it or not but I guess 600 hours speak for itself D

review: Audience Children Everyone Casual players Pro players Graphics Terrible Bad OK Good Beautiful Exceptional Price/quality Full price Wait for sale Free Refund it if you can Stay away Requirments 90' PC Minimum Medium Fast High end Beastly Difficulty Difficult to lose Rather easy Easy to learn / Hard to master Hard (first few hours) Impossible Bugs Barely if at all runs Everywhere Lot of Few Bugs (Not game breaking) Nothing Overall Burn it with fire Terrible Bad Meh Ok Good PerfectI love the concept this game has as a battle royale it has evolve the franchise since its day as a h1z1 king of the hill mod to something of a new and fresh genre. Now look at the triple A title's trying out the battle royale genre. This game has came a long way from its times with a lot of bugs de sync and frame rate loss whenever a huge update has came out. But right now i would say its playable even for me with bad to mediocre internet connection with my family memebers using the internet most of the time. Only gripe i have is the frame rate drops plus a bit of de dync im having in Vikendi which i hope they can improve upon. I get that its still a new map lot more effects is going on especially with the dynamic weather and the foot prints being there for only 15mins but its honestly hard to tell if the problem is because of de sync due to my internet connection or to frame rate suddenly dipping below 30fps. I have a medium spec pc with every option running on low excpet view distance on medium and i usually get a frame rate of 60+ but never 100+ for me im fine with it being as constant 50+fps and above as i dont have money yet to upgrade to a better gpu(graphics processing unit).
