review: Product received for free. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS REVIEW PUBG is a battle royale style game where 100 players are dropped off a plane without weapons and fight to the death on an island till the last player/team wins upon winning or losing the game is reset with the only thing carrying over is your gold you earned in the game for player accessories in short 100 player king of the hill. PROS Still Pretty Popular despite being overtaken by Fortnite but reduced to only a fraction of what it was before Occasional updates to the game although very few map updates it feels lately Very Fun + Thrilling for first 100 hours Stealth is an option Extremely high Victory satisfaction Challenging to the point where winning is quite uncommon Vast variety of playstyles even going to the point of only sitting in bushes the entire game using fists to kill other players Bullet travel and range finding at long ranges Large map that takes multiple matches to discover it all Occasional crate drops in the middle of the zones movement which contain power weapons and items like a ghillie suit the AWP from CS GO (Well its actually the AWM but close enough) M60 Adreneline Syringe etc Unique locations on map often containing good loot Fun for friends up to 4 players (currently may be more players per team later) Customizable outfits CONS While updates are made to the game they can take more than 4 weeks sometimes to make meaning no new content is put out which can lead to repetition While there is occassional bug fixes there are many bugs that I have encountered since launch that still have yet to be fixed even a year later with more bugs being added than I remember the first time Very Buggy High End PC needed for decent framerate Occasional server issues Pre game mic spam goes unpunished often No single player Potentially rage inducing Developers lied to player base stating they wouldn't make micro transactions in PUBG which was during it's time in beta but ended up making battle pass and locked loot boxes like cs go Developers sued Fortnite for "copying" them (I'm not a fan of Fortnite but this was a childish reaction to it's popularity) Boring after 100 hours (Personally) On a steady slope downwards in player count over the past year According to some players in Australia the game has severe performance issues as of this review Cheaters are prevelant Developers sometimes ban honest good players in the game because some streamers on Twitch blame "Stream Sniping" happening (2017 Version of this review still worth mentioning)My current recommendation for this game is VERY MIXED because while the game has many good points to it there also are many problems which are just as impactful therefore I only recommend it for the first 100 hours of game play (at this point) and for playing with friends unless if you would rather the many other alternatives. As my personal thoughts on the game I would've buy the game again in a heartbeat if it wasn't gifted to me by a friend in 2017 but now I have gotten quite bored of the battle royale genre as a whole and haven't played in around 6 month's as of this update to the review and while I may dislike the game for many reasons it was quite fun. This is the end of my review I hope I helped in YOUR decision to buy this game and I wish you luck out there on the battlegrounds.

review: It's been 788 hours I can write this review now I guess.Been a CS 1.3 1.5 1.6 Source CSGO player for over a decade. I can say that I'm quite used to this kind of games.The game was amazingly fun with all this bugs and everything. Over hundred hours of gameplay I've seen only like a 3 or 4 speed hackers. Hey! You can't really blame the publisher for that the game was early access bugs and cheating is understandable.Then 1.0 came nightmare began.If you are an old school FPS player you'd easily understand if someone is cheating or not all you need to do is checking the recoil of the player that you suspect.Maybe it is gone mad after 1.0 maybe always was like that we are just realizing it now. They implemented kill cam I can assure you that there is no other disappointment in the world that can match yours when your squad got killed by 1 man from miles away with his AK 47 with no scope attachment or whatsoever with no recoil at all.The list goes on and on I'm sick of playing this game till the last circle and getting killed by some cheater there. THAT DRIVES YOU MAD. And believe me I ain't no guy who can get mad over a game easily.I don't expect them to remove all cheaters from this game I know that's not possible whatsoever. But facing a cheater every single damn game is so annoying.Also region lock became a must thanks to chinese people using hack on all servers.Till they implement some sort of solid cheat protection and region lock. I will not recommend this game. Please check if there is any update after reading this in case I might forget to update this post if those are solved this game would be the best online game I ever had. If there is no update after a while you probably won't be reading this since the game will die as quickly as it rise.EDIT Now it is much more better.

review: This review rambles a bit but I'm not a great writer so boo hoo! pWell a while back I left a negative review and deservedly so. But I came back recently and all the problems I'd had seemed to be gone. I no longer question whether or not I should have won a gun fight. Things seem to run really smoothly. No longer am I see micro stutter during gun fights like I always did last year. One criticism is the options in the custom game need to be streamlined BADLY! Different modes are restrctied to certain weapons. I want to have a crossbow warrmode! And why is the VSS mode limited to one map only? What happened to the ability to customize every single weapon option for any game mode? I LOVE war mode but most of the hosts are AFK FFS!! Almost no one in NA plays the custom games except for private matches. I am constantly trying to get a match going but it seems only the AS and EU servers get any players. This may be because of the lack of options for custom matches that used to be available. IDKAnyway the game is as smooth as ROE now. I do think the new snow map is a bit too open. I think a smaller sized map would improve things especially the action. Hot dropping lasts about 2 or 3 minutes before the action dies down for instance. Maybe it's just like that in solo mode. I try to play squads but people are just too ignorant to use a headset in a MP game apparently. So I'm searching for a very active PUBG discord if anyone wants to chime in here. )

review: Honestly want to like this game I really do but the negatives to this game just simply outweigh the positives too much. I used to have fun playing this game but not anymore. The glitches and unoptimization have just become to much to handle. And PUBG Corp has just become greedy and given up on their players they'd rather sue Fortnite instead of fixing this unoptimized garbage. I feel like at this point PUBG is just a complete money grab. A $30 game mind you has MICROTRANSACTIONS. Now this is justifyable if the game is F2P but that is far from the case. It's a shame too as this game really helped pioneer the battle royale game scene and had a lot of potential to be a very great game. But now PUBG has just devolved into a cash grab and a game that is slowly but surely going to die out.I'd rate this game overall a 2/10 it could be a better game if it wasnt so glitchy and unoptimized and if it wasn't such a blatant cash grab.

review: Decided to jump back into this after not playing for a while now every time I launch the game it crashes. One fix used to be to set the affinity of the task to use just 1 cpu core instead of multiple however that fix no longer works and it just crashes anyway... Update After the fix PUBG capaign has finished the game no longer crashes so I figured i'd play a couple matches. Third match our fully kittted out squad all died to the same player that knew exactly where each of us were and pelted shots at us even in cover clearly cheating literally shooting at the other side of the wall tracking my movements as i walked from one point to the other i went to revive a teammate in a spot he shouldn't have known only to be hit by 2 grenades and him running inside and prefiring that specific spot... Sure the game works now but the hackers are back.... or did they never leave?

review: so my review has changed from negative because of the hackers then the finally fixed that and then it was negative cause i had a vac ban for nothing then they fixed that and gave me 20 000 BP for my trouble. now i have to change my review. this game has had lots of toubles over the last couple years. i have been with it almost since the start. i have played over 400 hours by now. ive had a lot of fun. a few chicken dinners. and ive made close to 100 bux selling crates on this game while only paying 30. if you like shooters but havent played this one yet then i recomend you check this one out. the gunplay is good. thats about all i care about it a game. the endedit there was a desync bug forever that happened after this review. i was coming back to change my review to positive but i guess it already was. the games in a good state now i think. but it can change. just keep that in mind. if you are in a remote region local servers are hard to find. but if you have a server in your country then this game is worth it for fps fansedit dont play this game between about 3pm and 3am asia time. im sorry but such a large part of the asian playerbase is using hacks. i can find and get a verified hacker on any day by just playig a match during peek time for asians and watching the replay and making a couple reports. then a day or 2 later i get the report back that they were banned and hacking. call it racist or not but the asian playerbase are ruining this game and if they all want to use hacks then they should do it on their own servers. we need a region lock

review: This game was fun during the initial launch hype (before Fortnite took the nation ) but it has since then gotten bad updates which I do respect the updates being pushed still but its just so toxic and glitchy. It still runs bad on most computers (I run a GTX 1070 Ryzen 5 1400 16GB RAM) Its not that I hate to hate but when there are so many other battle royale style games taking over our generation of gaming this one just doesn't take top anymore. It feels clunky and feels that their nearly putting more hours into graphics and new weapons than they are optimization and good gameplay. OH AND DON'T GET ME STARTED ON THEM MAKING A MOBILE PUBG!Idk if I got to add more after all I've only got 50 hours go to one of the many other countless downvoted reviews if you feel unsure.

review: A pragmatic and objective review . Overall The game is frustrating at times but generally quite fun (it's better with friends!). It has some bugs but in my six months of playing things have steadily improved. There's a definite ebb and flow to stability you'll need to be patient as unexpected bugs occur occasionally (usually after major updates but that's pretty standard for the tech industry in general) but generally it's quite playable.. The community of this game is definitely competitive and at times can be quite judgemental but there are definitely good people here too. (I recommend finding a discord server that's associated/affiliated with PUBG).. Driving cars is pretty fun you can do a lot with them in game.. The projectile physics seem pretty spot on and the weapons seem well balanced.. Loot spawning for the larger maps isn't balanced at the time of this review. It's pretty bad you better be prepared to play the game with a pistol sometimes!Regardless of its shortcomings definitely a fun and addictive game!

review: Product received for free. Battlegrounds is the refinement of a new language of play but what may earn it a spot in the video game canon is that conceptual efficiency. It isn t accessible for every player but it s understandable. Anybody can easily learn to read this game to watch it to spot the tension and excitement and drama. Critics and fans have speculated on how PUBG will operate as an esport whether or not its pacing works for competitive play. But that ignores the obvious fact Battlegrounds works as entertainment. Sport or not it has found its audience of players and viewers alike.P.S. Proud to have presented and played this with a crowd on IEM 2018
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The following is my Pre Release Review It was negative However after the official release most of the problems have been fixed there are still a fair number of cheaters and hackers but gameplay has improved dramatically. Some work is still needed but I feel the game as it is now warrants a positive review.**********************************If you are playing this game and everyone else is playing fair then it is brilliant. An arena/hunger games style game that is fun to play solo with a mate or even a squad.The biggest issues are 1) The RNG placement of weapons You can hit a house or even an apartment building that has absolutely NO weapons/gear whatsoever while the guy in the next house gets level 3 backpacks helmets body armour a full selection of automatic rifles/smgs/sniper rifles and craploads of ammunition.2) Cheaters There are any number of hacks/code injectors/Aim bots/Kill bots etc that can be downloaded free or for a small charge that make this completely unfair and a waste of money. Why buy a game for $29.99 when all you do is chute in land and get 1 shotted by a guy with a mini uzi from 500m?There are also some guys who can stand there and take 5 shots from a AKM 7.62mm rifle who kill you with a frying pan because they are using an program that sends incorrect info to the servers about being hit.The anti cheat measures in the game are useless In 1 case an update to the program which "stopped" cheaters using Aimbots was patched in less then 3 minutes.3) The sheer number of Hackers who dominate the game using these bots makes it impossible to play I recently had a game with my Duo partner we hid in a building for 1/2 the game and saw a group of players single shot more then 40 people with crossbows. When we ran towards the circle and were in the open both myself and my partner were killed within 1 second with crossbow bolts to the head by the same person a weapon that takes 5 seconds to reload and is very inaccurate in the game from over 200 meters... I mean seriously?Look if you can find a match NOT hacked or filled with cheaters this could be a great game. If the developers were more concerned about stopping cheaters rather then helping them (no poof but there are a lot of rumors going around about this game right now) then It would definately be worth the money those people who got it for free were lucky but others like myself who paid full price? We got wroughted.I'd like to give this game a positive rating because it is quite good on the VERY RARE occasion with no cheaters but in it's current state?No.Maybe after it comes out of early access.

review: After over 200 hours I can confidently say that this game is one you can skip. Between the desync *yes its still a common problem despite the patching* and the lag that will get you killed behind cover too often the game is still a mess. Not to mention you spend all of your hard earned in game currency on a random crate that will 9 out of 10 times require you to buy a $2.50 key to even unlock meaning even when you do the work to earn your reward you still will usually have to give up real cash to even redeem your reward that will almost certainly be a pair of brown shoes or a dirty stained tank top that looks like it was fished out of a dumpster. None of the issues compare of the overall horrible hitbox recoil mechanics and the general lack of any real optimization. Play Ring of Elysium and skip this game

review: EDIT Just Play Rings of Elysium the only reason this game was good was because it was new. Had they fixed the game it would of had alot of potential. Many people hate it because of the hackers and the bugs. There is alot for both i will admit but ive had so many hilarious times with my friends in squads and duos. Even solos tbh. I will agree its annoying as when your killed by a hacker or bugged out and die. My bike literally glitched into a wall and blew me up I also onced bugged into a counter in a kitchen and couldnt escape it eventually having to blow myself up with a grenade cus i wanted the BP. This game has many flaws but the pros outway the cons by miles.The game in Early Access admitidly was a trash bug filled game crap FPS terrible rubber banding and a massive onslaught of hackers. But since the games official release they have fixed the FPS improved the graphics the servers and hit registration have gotten much better and an overall decrease in hackers. This is a great game with few flaws even if theyre big flaws.The game is definatly worth the price.

review: So. Where to start?I'm honestly going to come right out and say it I love Player Unknown's Battlegrounds. I bought it not to sure about it. A number of my adult friends had been playing Fortnite and I am not a real fan of that game so I was looking for something else and I found this. I knew alot of people played PUBG but I wasn't really sure how fun it would be. Within the first few minutes of playing I immediately fell in love with the game. Compared to Fortnite PUBG is alot better. Bullets and the way they travel is simulated alot better than Fortnite and the maps seem almost endless. I love the variety of guns and how they actually require an amount of skill to get a well placed shot with an SR. I would reccommend this game. This is also the only game I have downloaded in my Steam Library. Now lets get into the details shall we?Pros The game has a four large maps with alot of places to explore and vehicles to run people over with. The gun mechanics alot better than most Battle Royale games (Ahem ahem Ring Of Elysium). Alot of customization though some of it costs money (Alot of money) and I am not really a big fan of spending my dollars to buy a new T Shirt in a video game. But alas customization is always cool! Alot of things to destroy Windows doors tires car engines fences etc. Even if I don't win just playing the game for a bit is always fun! The game requires quite a bit of strategy to which is always good. Lucky for most of you battle royale players their are no Peter Rabbits constantly jumping their way across the maps like Fortnite (Actually that doesn't even deserve to be capitalized!) I mean fortnite.Cons PUBG requires alot of camping strategic waiting in houses which isn't always the best thing so you must have patience young grasshopper. Stuff costs money! (GASP!) For instance with my first few hours in game I unlocked a crate and it was an Aviator Crate! I was excited and went to open it because for those of you who know Aviator Crate has some of the better gear in it. I went to my items and lookie here! You need an Aviator key to unlock the Aviator Crate! That me off pretty bad and almost made me write a complaint but I held back. Oh! Forgot to mention the Aviator Key is $2.50. For one piece of gear. Rip Off. Hope you guys liked the review if I missed anything crucial you would like to mention please do so in the comments. Thanks!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The best battle royal game out there gameplay wise. First hours with it was unlike anything I have ever played. Truly revolutionary. But as a fully released game i got to say it's disappointing. I forgave all the bugs crashes and unoptimization when it was in pre alpha. But now this has turned into a money milking machine. It has more micro transactions than a EA game. $20 for a skin and $10 to change your in game name. This is just madness. Everyone has asked pubg corp. to make replays re playable even after a new update. It's been a year and nothing has changed. But ohh wait something HAS changes...more and more loot crates and skin packs that almost cost as much AS THE WHOLE DAWM GAME. I'm pretty sure it doesn't cost you that much.I loved the game will still have fond memories of it but I don't think I can recommend it in this state anymore.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Most of your playtime will be nonviolent running. Players are only likely to get a handful of kills per match. There is nothing graphic or disturbing about the deaths. Just cuz a game has shooting in it especially if its for the sake of survival doesnt mean its going to derange anyone under 18. If killing in a T rated game like Uncharted wont derange a young teen than this wont either. Game is very basic deathmatch yet in a huge open world where vehicles items and gear are scattered at random. I like how despite the aesthetic the gamendoesnt attempt realism. Health bars are adequate damage is balanced and bullets go wherever you aim. Younger players may be bored. As longs as you dont expect anything fantastical or large scale battlefield devastation pretty much anything can happen if you are patient enough. Every online game has its toxic players. Even the kid friendly Overwatch.

review: I really tried hard to like the game. I cannot say that I do after 80 hours. update Still there are issues about liking the game. UPDATE 400+ hours into it and it has become way more entertaining after repeated gaming with my gf. And we became better during the phase. 1. Learning curve it is very steep and requires some time but basically it is a FPS or TPS depending on your settings. You need to find a strategy and some tactic to survive but in the end you will wrap your head around it. It is way more fun together with people/friends. UPDATE Nothing new to it but I seriously recommend playing it with friends and watch some streamers.2. Gameplay UPDATE + mechanics it is simple drop out of a plane look for a good starting point loot drive shoot. Not more... and that is one of the let downs. It has become better since I just play Sanhok since then the loot part is way more easy. UPDATE But there are a couple of mechanics in the game which I just purely HATE Jumping like crazy not only are the pubg soldiers the toughest sons of very nasty women and run around in full speed no they also jump around like some athletes on steroids Russians you could assume. Next thing is the friggin leaning lean to the left and lean to the right... spectate some gamers and see how just purely pathetic they lean towards left and right but the mechanic obviously allows more accuracy. It should be the opposite you are less of a target behind trees but you may shoot but at the moment it is the opposite you are less of a target AND you shoot more accurately. And sadly sometimes the rng of bullets not hitting is annoying. 3. Luck it is also simple... the loot is distributed purely on luck. You may get a good starting point or some lone guy with a rifle picks you apart because you run for 10 minutes with a shot gun on open field and sadly there are no ducks to shoot with it... and even more sadly since you need to be in a zone to survive you need to be heads up to it all the time which requires a car since running for the zone takes ages. And that killed me in the last 10 games five times to be just outside the zone and running senselessly for 15 minutes and not finding ONE vehicle. Frustrating loot things frustrating running and pure random drops on weapons and vehicles. UPDATE Playing on Sanhok is less of a luck thing... so try there. But still the Zone is sometimes annoying and even there you run after it like hifi geek around the super known online shop salesweek. 4. Fun there are fun moments but in the end you need to sit wait for a poor guy to show his head at the wrong time shoot him loot him proceed to the next zone... do the same and HAVE LUCK! Could be called Player Unknown Battlefrustration/Battleluck or any way you might put the words. And I didnt even mention the cheaters. UPDATE Some situations are awkward and I encountered some Chinese cheaters but not too many. Those guys just stayed in my mind. BUT playing more and with another attitude gives some experience and therefore also success. So nowadays often in top ten and also earned some chicken dinners with GF. 5. Performance it is a very consuming game and there are a lot of glitches lag spikes not rendering buildings drop outs the need for restarting the pc and so on... so performancewise it is way below optimum. Need for improvement. UPDATE They improved it a lot. Still there are some issues but it is more stable and less of a problem. So I can nowadays say it is good enough.6. Conclusion At the moment I regret buying it since the 30 Euro I could have invested elsewhere... it has its moments it is addictive but also super frustrating. A nice game for people with paranoia and some skills... but a pain in the a$$ for people with above mentioned problems. UPDATE New conclusion is of a mixed type. There are funny games... but sometimes it is very frustrating and not always good for my nerves... or my keyboard... or my mouse. 7. And more? Well... try it on a free time or watch some vids. Problems is the name of the game Problemsknown Battlegrounds. Cool idea nice features but performance issues like crazy. UPDATE Still there are problems crashes glitches spikes and crazy vehicle stuff BUT.... get your first chicken dinner and you know why... and after houndreds of hours gaming like a dork I became better watched some replays and got some advice and learning by doing you improve and get more secure then a chicken dinner feels seriously earned.

review: Love this game my hours reset after early access for some reason. I had almost 3000 hrs lol.Its a great game to play with your friends. Takes time to master unlike "Fortnite".Requires a decent amount of brain power. Strategy and postioning is key to win and be good.This is one of my favorite games of all time. It has a good mix of strategy and action. I also like how there are 3 maps for different times per game(basicly Erangel is for medium paced games Miramar is for slower/longer games sanhok is for fast paced action) . If you like BR's likie fortnite or H1Z1 pick it up its worth it. Ive been playing since day one.

review: PlayerUnknowns Battlegrounds started off in a rough patch in the earlier times even to this day it still has its qwerks. But the Developers have gone to great lengths to improve their game by adding new content fixing up OPS fixing servers hunting down cheaters/hackers and so much more. They Delivered a solution when there was a problem. They have continually put in the man power to insure the game not only survives in the market but also keep interesting in playable over the course of its realese. This game has been one of the greatest BR I've played. (Obviously not the best but still good). PUBG will give you the fast and fun gameplay of the Battle Royale genre and give you the skills to improve yourself on the platform. whilst also giving you the option to enjoy funny moment's and extreme scenarios with your friends or strangers across the globe. The game still has a lot to fix and a lot of room to improve with things like connections with servers bugs and OPS. But it has gone far over the time span. To conclude my review I would recommend PUBG greatly for those that are looking to start in BR and to gain skills while having fun with other's. FP_DP

review: Pros Very enjoyable game mechanichs. Good graphics. Runs well on my PC (though my PC is over powered). They keep adding new weapons and items that keep the game changing slightly. Slowly releasing new maps. I enjoy all 3 current maps and they play very differently. Cons Too much money grabbing for a game that you already spend money on to play in the first place. I used to not mind throwing a bit of extra money at the developers but it has gotten to the point that a majority of the loot boxes I get require me to purchase a key to open them. The addition of a season pass has made me decide to never spend additional money on this game. I wish I coule rate the game and business practices seperately. I still enjoy the game but the current busness practices make me not want to reccomend the game.

Until this day there are hackers still roaming around the battleground it is sad to say I don't really like this part and I'm not so sure about how the developers are going to settle with these problems at least the game is still playable and I'm OK with that.After all battleground genre is not for everyone but for this price range it is worth playing it let's not compare this to Fortnite maybe? review: I spent a lot of hours with that game and still it doesn't make me bored. Every game is differenet ends up in a various way provides at the same time huge dose of extreme emotions. It all makes you want to keep coming back to this title. It's true there are still some problems which developers have to fight especially optimalization and one thing I can complain is that these changes are being introduced to slowly. Beside that it all goes in a good direction. Anyway I think nowadays it's definitely the best battle royale game on the market which I can recommend to all fans of this genre. It's fun when you play solo but if you have friends to play with you will see the whole potential of this game.

review: This game is so addicting.... I often look for the crate in the sky as the planes pass me bythe circles is closing in as I run forever within.As a bush I pretend before shooting you in the head.my monitor is shattered for the anger you made matter.my chicken dinner was gone but don't wory my bullets no longer stray so far.PROs MECONs Your deathSCORE Every Day and Every Night.After having played this game pre steam ando over 600 hours in I can honestly say they have taken a game with a solid concept and the gift of breaking out from nothing and drove it in to the ground.They wasted more time on loot boxes than anti cheat software and now they are losing their player base to AAA studios and the poetic justice is they never stayed true to their indi roots no mod support and we never even got all the features promised before 1.0.At the end of the day the AAA studios are going to destroy the sinners that tried to emulate them blue hole you deseve it has you been true blue and stuck to your plans to support the player base rather than your greed we might have both benafitted.Sold my player unknowns jacket at least I got my money back through steam money and paid for a few awsome games.

"servers are too busy". wtf ?BRING THE SALT.Game is awesome with friends... fire fights will get that adrenaline pumping... somethimes you do find some hackers ... game is very optimized 11/10 would china numba 1 againGame still has a long way to go sometimes it's just a loot delivery game... you gather loot and then you die providing the awesome experience of PUBG to another player by arriving and getting killed imediatly and BAM back to the lobby over and over... but sometimes oooh sometimes you just have so much fun (with the right people) and when you get to the final circles the adrenaline is real... when someone is shooting at you etc...still needs alot of optimization and it's rage inducing but it is worth it for each firefight you win each chicken dinner each tense situation you may find yourself in. buy it learn it git gud bring the salt because you will get rekt alot! but you'll have fun in the process.

review: This is NOT how you make video games. Development is so awful that I can hardly describe how broken this game is. Infinite loading screens (loading finishes when I already landed from the plane) when my rig handles GTA 5 on ultra settings. Awful stereo sound image and sound quality by itself is terrible. These guys should really hire some good sound engineer trust me they can afford it after selling tons of copies for 30$. RAM memory leak. It runs good for first game but longer you play the more game becomes laggy until you go mad and restart it from steam. Graphics are that blurry that people install some third party utilities to sharpen image to spot enemies better. Synchronisation is so bad that you can get shot even when you have already ran behind a wall. No latency compensation cuz devs dont know how to make online shooters at all. Kill cam is absolutely terrible. You can see enemy shooting in one place and bullets flying to other direction. Terrible usage of Unreal engine. While engine by itself is very good movement and driving in this game is the worst I have seen in my life High amount of hackers. Devs dont care when there is a guy in top of a leaderboard with name advertising website with aimbot. Buildings dont load sometimes. They remain as low poly distant 3d mesh even when you are very close to them and you cant enter them. You get stuck somewhere in textures way to often If you alt+tab a game there is a chance you can not go back to game and many more bugs and glitches.And they want 30$ for this unoptimised piece of crap full of bugs. These devs are unprofessional in nearly everything
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I remember the hours of fun I had with this game when it first came out. It had so much potential. I picked it up day one and as someone who had never played a Battle Royal (aside from Minecraft survival games when I was 9) it was so exciting. Also when you weren't experiencing gamebreaking desync or lag the shooting felt incredible especially the sniping. I havn't played this game in over 6 months simply because bluehole are complete scumbags who care about making money more than finishing their game. They took something with the potential to be utterly incredible and pile drived it straight into the ground. Don't give these people your money. Do something more productive with it like burning it.

review: Imma be honest this game is absolutely fantasic! Tho it does require a somewhat good graphic card to make the game feel less choppy. There is also many bugs that causes quite some negative feedback to the game. Such as the extremely buggy death cam i've seen many people raging over how they got killed by the "hacker". They would continue raging as how this game is a piece of sh**it and how many hackers there are. I do admit that there are plenty of hackers but what game doesnt? But i can tell from my own experiences that i haven't met a single hacker except for one when i went for the care package and the guy perfectly sprayed me down while i was driving full speed.(Maybe he was just lucky).Another stuff that's been happening is the new big update where they increased the AR's recoil and made some bug fixes+added a new gun. People now are saying SMG's are way too OP. But i feel like this new update forces us to actually aim and percisely burst fire enemies instead of spraying them until one of the bullets hit them in the head by the small recoil before the update was made.I do admit that SMG are pretty good but if you were to get good at ARs you would be much better vs the other people using SMGs.Back to the positives. It really rewards the people who knows how to aim rather than being lucky involves positioning not just point and click with the new nade's deafening effect whenever it blows up near them allows for more strats. Feels amazing to get a kill Feels even more amazing when you get #1This game overall just a feel good kind of game with great strats.(about the hacking "problem" i doubt that people actually meets 1 2 hackers EVERY game or two. They are most likely sore losers)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: *Update* My original review was from a couple months after this game came out in early access. Since then I've logged over 800 hours on the game (700+ on live 100+ on test+experiemental branches). After playing so much of PUBG sadly I can't recommend anyone buy this game in its current state. The game uses client side hit registration and the netcode is a mess. These two aspects combined creates an FPS experience more "laggy" than old peer to peer hosted CoD titles. If I had a dollar for every time I've been downed or killed even though I was behind cover on my end for multiple seconds I could retire already.The developers say they're working on fixing this and according to the "Fix PUBG" campaign it should be done some time this month. But until that happens stay away. Stay FAR away from this game don't get addicted to the concept of it like me and so many other players already have. The gunplay feels amazing in this game...when it works. So at least currently it becomes a game where you're riding the highs of matches that worked perfectly only to have it ruined by ones that are so desynced you get killed through solid objects. Because on your end you got behind cover but on your enemy's end you're still wide open...and for whatever reason this game doesn't have the server reject hits that don't match up with what the server "sees" happen first. If a client sends a packet that says "i got a hit!" the server just accepts it no matter what. It's incredibly frustrating to deal with and causes more stress than enjoyment to come from the game. If they fix this problem then PUBG is a great game worth picking up. But if not don't bother with it because it's like being in an abusive relationship. The game just keeps slapping you around with desync but every once in a while gives you a great experience to make you forgive it. Original Review I was super skeptical of this game at first. But after playing it for a couple of hours it's a blast. If you like PvP games that actually can get your heart pounding I highly recommend it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

The core issue of this game is the over whelming Chinese and Vietmanese players who are cheating non stop for 2k hours plus on accounts without seeing bans. This is just like the CS GO epidemic but far worse. CS GO system is dodgable in terms of cheating which the community has known for sometime now with no fix. CS GO ATLEAST GETS PLAYERS BANNED atleast some of them while PUBG many of the cheaters that I see never get banned. They all have chinese names or vietmanese accounts... even in duos watching them cheat isn't enough for my report to mean anything. This game is awesome but ing blows and doesn't deserve 30bucks. It doesnt deserve any money. give the game 8.5/10... give the community 1/10 all i get is chinese in my duos who don't speak a little bit of english.

review: I've played this game almost for 450 hours but I don't enjoy the game anymore. When you play the game for how long I played you can really see that this game is going down hill. Some bugs like invisible barriers are still in the game even after half a year.The developers are taking a completely wrong turn with squeezing every single penny out of the game while they still can. Instead of fixing bugs and putting more content in the game to keep the game fresh they keep adding new skins and loot boxes in the game. And let's not forget about the hackers becauese there are a ton of them. If you play this game for a whole day I can garantuee you that you're going to find a chinese hacker.In my opinion don't buy this game. Don't gave them anymore reasons te keep milking it. just let this game die!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. As fun as this game is it's really not fun. The grand majority of the time you'll die without ever seeing who shot you and the game controls like too. I can't really explain it but in any other game I can dome someone from 100m but in this one I can't even shoot someone point blank accurately. I've tried and it's given me nothing but grief over and over.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So I feel like most of these reviews either do not play multiplayer games much or they are just ragging on this game for vague and pointless reasons like "poor optimization" which only shows they do not know what the word optimization means. I used to drop in and wait in the grass while the surroundings load in now its always loaded before i get near the ground. The game is optimized your connection will be the bottleneck for most of the game breaking bugs that are possible. Decent connection ignoring most bugs that are mentioned in the reviews.The game is alot of fun escpecially with friends. Less kiddy than Fortnite but more relaxed than games like CoD or Tom Clancy stuff. That being said it's not the easiet of games if you are not on point with aiming then you will feel useless for a while. This leads to a nice satisfaction boost when you realize you are improving and can hold your own in a fight.The content seems to be coming out regularly with microtransactions being limited to cosmetics so you cannot pay 2 win.Hackers are a problem in every game but there used to be alot and that seems to have been mitigated so something is obviously being done about it.All in all a solid game that will get your heart pumping and great for a laugh with friends.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: In my 30+ years of gaming i ve never been so thoroughly addicted to a game such as PUBG. i m 500+ hrs in and don t see myself stopping anytime soon. PUBG probably is the perfect blend between a realistic hardcore shooter and a fast action game. Sure it s been bug ridden from the start and in some respects it still is. Also server performance leaves a lot to be desired. Then again all Battle Royale games with more than 60 in game players appear to suffer from this.. Likely it s a matter of server technology that needs to catch up. Regardless it s tons of fun never grows old and a crazy adrenaline rush to boot... times two when played with friends.

review: Lately PUBG has been a ton better since my last review. Since my last review the game has been updated plenty where the feel of the game is almost buttery smooth. I rarely get frame drops anymore atleast not as bad as before.It's so much more playable now I'd say the only problem at this point is there is still a little bit of desync within the game but still manages to be fun and enjoyable especially with friends.Though content hasn't changed much within the past months the game is still super fun to play with very satisfying gun mechanics.FPP mechanics personally aren't the best considering the game was never meant to be played in FP anyway this was a game made to be played in third person. If there was ever a way to make FPP mechanics feel better and smoother it would be much better.The games biggest problem right now is new content needs to be added they aren't really doinig anything with it.

review: Okay so as you can tell by hours i got into the game after leaving this review. Now I am not recommending it for another list of reasons. First and foremost the lack of oceania servers means any Australian has to play on South East Asia servers which means getting killed behind walls... shooting someone and doing no damage because they always have an advantage against you. There are constant hackers in the game but you can't always say for certain because the death cam is so borked you cant say for certain what happened. There are chinese spammers advertising hacks in every region. Even when oceania had players there is a desync from the server so even if you don't have 400+ ping you still will have a disadvantage. I loved this game so much when i got it but now it is literally unplayable

review: I used to enjoy this game but over time it became more and more apparent that it would never get better. For the first couple hundred hours or so you can get past the buginess and lag because you are just focused on having fun and you are still kind of new to things. After that though you start to realize how desperately bad this game is. Horrible optimization terrible physics and movement desync hackers.... etc. I owned this game for around a year before I finally decided to uninstall it and leave this review mainly because throughout the entire year that I owned this game nothing got better. The only updates that changed anything were adding new guns or skins or the new map. They can do all of that but for some reason they can't ing make parachuting physics work worth a Games that came out 10 years ago did parachuting better than the sad excuse this game has. That is just one example. The final straw for me was when blackout came out with black ops 4 and I saw how smooth good looking and fun a battle royale game can actually be.

You just need to get used to the fact that you suck and the only way to get better is to find fights get good at listening for sounds and understand that not every gun fight will ever be the same. It might get frustating when you have to run all the way across the map or the pacing of the game is slow but that's the point. This game isn't meant to be fast. It's meant be tactical and quite fun. It honestly does battle royale better than almost every other battle royale and in my opinion it does it better than fortnite or even Blackout mode on BO4.

review: CATEGORY RANK &amp COMMENT TOTALAverage sum with a secret formula to adjust nuances... 69% a VERY INTERESTING game... almost GOOD!Do you want to try a battle royale game for the first time? You may start with this one... or you may try another one. PUBG is a very interesting game of its genre and may definitely keep you entertained for a while if you have the right conditions with you (no bugs some friends and a good sense of compromise).No matter what I tried when giving grades to this game it would not go above 70%... I felt a bit embarrassed for it at first but eventually I guess it deserves that harshness. PUBG has too many flaws while it could be so good even great! I still recommend it because I believe it is one of the most sober and entertaining games of its genre which I know very few so take my review with a grain of salt! It is a very interesting game and you may have quite some fun if you try it yet you will lose nothing if you don't. VIDEOgraphics performance port physics arts visuals... 6/10The game is not beautiful actually even a bit outdated. Some people experience frames problems graphics bugs and all I have an excellent PC and no problem so I can not help you on this. For me the game is very fine and smooth. However outdated a bit foggy and such. Do not expect much. AUDIOmusic sound effects voice over audio balance subtitles... 6/10Nothing special here either sounds are okay. GAMEPLAYcontrols difficulty level design luck strategy skill balance... 8/10That is where half of the game shines the gameplay is really smooth and pleasant. A nice FPS although I hate bending with Q and E not my style of FPS but you can play kind of okay without! Note however that many people play in 3rd person which I hate and find anti fairplay and such. So do not consider my review in terms of third person analysis... CONTENTstory world solo immersion multiplayer depth overall idea... 8/10And this is where the other half of the games shines a battle royale is a unique genre extremely trendy for a few years now and created many many clones. For me this is the only one I tried and I am content with it. I find it very pleasant addictive full of adrenaline and although it would deserve more content (more maps etc) I find it great the way it is. OTHERlength replayability price community economics devs... 4/10Finally this is where the game is hurt the most I will not talk about the community (lots of cheaters apparently though I am not good enough to notice that) nor about this game history (lots of turbulence even now) but about present facts I know very slow and poor developing an economic scene (costumes and lootbox land...) that I despise bad servers bugs disconnections platforms problem (do you know for instance that in my country the FPS mode was removed entirely? reason given not enough players used it...) all of this will probably make people flee away from that game and that would be well deserved. It should have been better it should even be better now it could be one of the best games ever it could be classic but I am afraid it has not this status because of its own flaws. Too bad. DISCLAIMER I never won yet (ie "finished first") so my review is not complete sorry about that. And I do not play it anymore recently because FPS mode has been removed from my country and I would rather play it with friends... so all in all... it takes dust in my library.

review: I love PUBG it is by far the most fun and realistic battle royal I have ever played. That being said the DEVs lack any care for fixing this game. To list a few very simple fixes Parachuting is still broken I have landed thousands of times and I cannot begin to the frustration of still being kicked off the roof of a building and taking fall damage because it is STILL BROKEN. The same can be said about hitting trees or power lines still drops you every time at a decent height that does (while minor) damage. DESYNC holy cow is this atrocious now. Whatever you did DEVs to "fix" the game you've broken it more. I have been behind many many many buildings walls trees rocks anything and everything and still been shot. When watching my death cam not only was it from someplace that was impossible it was THROUGH the wall. Being killed when it is physically impossible is not fun. I truly think that while there are complaints about other things in the game on this review my biggest issue is desync. The DEVs have to have to have to fix the net code for this game without this being fixed the player base will continue to be angry. The gun loot on the bigger maps is still minimal. It is frustrating at best to enter multiple houses upon dropping to find nothing not just "nothing" but literally nothing at all. No meds no gun and no ammo. The blue zone is frustration waiting to happen as well. You can see into the zone but not out the zone. This needs to be fixed. Either you see in or you don t being shot from outside the zone as you can t see out makes fighting very difficult. Also whatever anti cheat they are using isn t very effective. I run into many an instance where there is obviously someone cheating in game. I am never happy to die to someone who snaps their gun on me and misses no shots. Another while minor fixes that could be implemented is the vehicles could handle way better. The UAZ now feels like a piece of paper when driving. The UMP does far too much damage now I understand that they are trying to equalize the guns but it is now WAY too powerful. Not only is the UMP too strong the beryl has now been stripped of recoil where the recoil previously was far too great. While I may have only 151 hours in this game compared to people who have many more I still think this game needs so much more fixing.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I am frustrated with this game. I sometimes get long waits to join and it annoys me. I sometimes get thrown into a server in Asia and my teammates don't even try to communicate with me (not so much that they can't speak my language but that I was put there in the first place). That annoys me. I have been playing FPSes for over 15 years. I've played with some incredibly good people who practiced several hours daily. I think I have a pretty good idea when someone is playing straight or when they are doing some fairly impossible shooting. It annoys me that some of those people are still playing. But when I do report those people I'm pretty sure aren't legit I have a decent record of the Devs actually banning those people. I appreciate their involvement and their communication back to me that my concerns were addressed. This game beats up on my video card but it is by far one of the better looking FPSes I've ever played. I wish that this game didn't give such an advantage to people who are able to spend much more money on their rig than I am willing to do but it is what it is. I hold this game to a higher standard than most but I do that because I really do like this game. I criticize this game just like I do any other game that I see a lot of potential in. But I would completely recommend it to anyone who prefers semi realism to cartoon character battles.

review: *Sigh* Where do i begin? When i first got this game I absolutely loved it. it was great. Everything felt fantastic. And it was one of the first games that i was legitimately GOOD at. Not mediocre not ok. but DAMN GOOD. Like win consistantly with a double digit kills. But now? Now it has devolved into The devs/Blue Hole not listening to their Community. There are hackers STILL rampant and the Desync is worse than it has ever been. 1300+ Hours and during those 1300 hours i met and played with some pretty cool people. People i still play with all the time. But now none of us can Touch PUBG. No one can stand where this game is heading. There is a MAJOR problem when you have to release a roadmap and an entire CAMPAIGN to fix your game and yet it just seems to keep getting worse and worse. I Honestly think im done with this game. Which sucks cause its brought so many good and bad moments. I wish it could go back to August of 2017 before i noticed and real desync issue before all the nerfing because people were ing that no one was using an SMG in the Final Circle Before the hacking and before the general ery. That seemed to me to be the golden age of PUBG. you Blue Hole for ruining this game.I do not recommend getting this game. Not in its current state.

review: edit 07.11.2018 The game only got worse massive lags connecting problems etc..... really annoying.PuBg is a game that got me interested from beginning and even still in Early Access I enjoyed playing it right away.++ Silence. Unlike in other popular shooters like CS GO you can enjoy the game in peace when going Solo no screaming kids no need to ask for people to talk English please no flaming no spamming! If you want the teamplay you can go Duo or Squad preferably with your friends+ Battle Royale I like it!+ It's up to you how to play the rounds you can go all out and try to make as many kills as you can but you can also play sneaky and just survive till the number of opponents shrank to a minimum basically 1 kill would be enough to win Solo D. + Well done for an Early Access game and developers keep on workingStill I wonder as priorities of the developers seem wrong... the game has quite some problems they should attend to Performance. Facing problems like for example random game crashes disconnecting canceling matchmaking doors not opening properly lags ... Graphics basically nice but All over you can find floating stones or loot stuff is also sticking through walls just like you can get unluckily stuck in them by landing with parachute or if you drive a vehicle into a house for example. What annoys me too is that when you look though your scope and have free sight on target you shoot but actually hit the wall/wood or whatever in front of you if you are too close fine with me that I cannot sit too close but why can I not see that? Shouldn't it be in my sight then?(On this point I want to mention that this is not gonna be my final version of the review.)So even with those rather important issues the game has developers work on new loot new map and money making.I admit I would love new maps comming up but I even more want the game to run well!As I do have hope that they will take care of that and in my opinion the game has a lot of potential I will for now recommend it nevertheless!

review: Up front because this review will sound very negative I just want to be clear that I 'am' recommending that you try this.PUBG is a battle royale style FPS/ThirdPersonPerspective game. The gist is this You and up to 99 other players take flight on a large plane that traverses the battlefield once. Players choose when to jump and then parachute in to. On landing they scavange materials (weapons armor fuel grenades ammo medicine weapon attachments). Whereupon they have a short time (about 5 minutes) before a blue wall begins encroaching from the edges of the map. Get overrun by this blue wall and you begin slowly losing health (in faster increments every time the wall constricts by another phase).PUBG has a fairly steep learning curve owing to a few factors 1) High lethality characters can only withstand a few hits before being knocked to the ground (in duo/squad) or dying (solo).2) Rampant cheating. Like you won't believe how common this is. When combined with the former you're going to be looking at a large number of restarts.3) Tower of Babel syndrome. You'll frequently find teams with 4 people none of whom speak the same language.4) Frequently disconnecting teammates (probably caused by #3 but this usually isn't that big a deal and not at all in solo mode).The one silver lining of the massive population of cheaters is that PUBG's mods are actually quite responsive when you find someone who's blatantly wallhacking (and there's a convenient death cam provided that usually makes it clear if an opponent was).The other irksome? downside is that there's a wide range of pay for add on skins most of which can only be gained by those willing to pay money on top of the game purchase. I find that fairly unpleasant as a business model but there it is.Still despite all that PUBG does the battle royale style of game well and it's worth a try.

review: Hi friends! Welcome to this update analysis on Bitcoin! Let's get right to it! Looking at the daily chart you can see that the breakdown below the rising blacktrendline is sustained. This is technically concerning but I have noticed that several of my followers did not seem to recognize the importance of this event. Perhaps it is due to the fact that my charts were zoomed in too far for people to see the actual points of contact on the trendline but nonetheless I will explain why this is concerning price action. We all know that there are rising trendlines falling trendlines and parallel trendlines . In terms the current bull/bear cycle of Bitcoin 0.54% the rise to the all time high produced several pivot lows. Those pivot lows can be used to create rising support lines to gauge the sustainability of a longer term bullish continuation or a turning point in the bear market. As you can see the two points that create the rising black trendline are the lowest pivot lows that are relevant to this cycle. In other words that was the last hope for rising support. Sure there are other parallel and descending trendlines in the mix but for a gauge on a bullish continuation this black trendline is pretty significant. Now that it has been taken out some significant technical damage has been done. That's not to say thatBTC 0.54% won't continue to form a bowl like structure which it appears to have half way formed already (meaning we could be bottoming soon.) However the deeper technical picture tells a more bearish story.

review: Product received for free. I got PUBG as a gift from one of my dearest friends. I have a good computer that can run bigger games like GTA 5 KF2 and so on. Whenever I launch PUBG I don't get a warning or anything It's just plain black screen. When I check out the details in the task manager It's labelled as "Not Responding". I tried everything. Restarting the game Restarting steam Validating files etc. But it just doesn't work. My opinion will change about this game once I can get at least one hour of actual gameplay instead of just Black Screen.Edit I now have a better opinion about this game. I have bought a new computer and the game now works for me. Pretty sad it did not work on my other old computer though.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great concept poor execution.GRAPHICS Seems like a lot copied and pasted assets from the Unreal store. This leads to poor optimization.GAMEPLAY The BR concept was already overused before PUBG ever came out. Now it's just more of the same. With PUBG specifically the gunplay is awkward and sloppy. Movement is terrible and very floaty. If you hold a direction to move and then release the key your character will still surge a bit in the direction you were moving (momentum based). While this is slightly more realistic it makes controlling your character really awkward and fails to feel as tight as other accomplished games like CSGO COD BF etc.SOUND Not the worst but a lot of the guns sound farty rather than huge and explosive like they would in real life. The footstep sounds are mediocre ambient sound is almost non existent.NETCODE Was bad at the start and is still bad. It's better than it used to be but there are still many issues with interpolation and latency.PACING Games are usually like 30 minutes of hiking and looting followed by 15 seconds of gunplay. Terribly slow can easily make someone fall asleep while in the middle of a match.MULTIPLAYER The best part about this game. The game is paced so slowly you can queue with friends and catch up on lost time. It's kind of like you aren't even playing a game it's so boring you just chat with people. This is also why it's so popular on Twitch TV. The awfully slow gameplay allows the streamers to constantly interact with their audience.TL DR If PUBG was created by a company who knew what they were doing it would probably be one of the best games of all time. While Bluehole has managed to make a solid profit and create a popular game it dwarfs its own potential by being riddled with technical bugs and sloppy gameplay.Overall 4/10 Not recommended.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Game is full of major issues including shutters horrible optimalization laggy servers laggy gameplay sometimes you just want to kill someone and shots doesnt register you see the blood splatters and when you watch the replay opponent is intact. At the start of the game if you dont have high end PC you will experience serious lags if you land in highly populated area. Gameplay itself without the bugs and lags is excellent and i guess thats the only reason why i keep playing it there is many similar BR games around but i think after all the PUBG is the best. But if you have the raging problems just avoid this game because you will get your keyboard smashed.

review: Product received for free. I personally don't think the game deserves as much bad reviews as it's getting. But I can still agree that there are still some unrealistic implements in the game that could've easily been fixed months ago. Some examples are Cars that instantly kills you when they're going 5km/h ( The fact that you don't slide down cliffs to reduce fall damage (because of friction) instead you just keep picking up momentum just as if you were falling and NOT sliding. You often don't land on what you're on top of after you've parachuted. I'd say those are my only complaints on the game right now. Other than that I'd recommend this game to anyone else reading this. People should also stop complaining about the ingame transactions. They're not necesarry it's just more of an add on if you're interessted in supporting bluehole or collecting skins. Optimizations in the game are decent they're not trash like everyones saying I'd say that the system requirements are very accurate if you want a smooth gaming experience. My system has worse pc components than the recommended system requirements but it can still run the game with a solid 100fps+ on (avg.) medium settings.I mean is aight.

review: Can honestly say im very impressed with this Early Access offering. Ive had plenty of fun with it and have met some pretty decent people to game with. As it stand this game tops a lot of others the devs seem to be involved at just the right amount they dont bash people for neg reviews or comments yet they are active in getting things tweeked. They are trying to clean house of all those pesky cheaters that everyone but themselves hate. I think I read 20 000+ banned which is def a step in the right direction. The game is very fun at first you dont mind if you get killed as it takes a bit to get your inventory built up to be able to even consider going top 10. Then as the game progresses you really start to feel the pressure. You hear shots off in the distance and are basically forced to go that direction as the map starts to shrink in on you like that Red Hot Chili Peppers t shirt from when you were 15. The only issue I really have with the game and its a small one because im well aware of the strategy behind the game is that usually those who have a decent long rifle and an 8x scope are usually going to win. Especially if you have the high ground or were lucky enough to be in good position when the map comes in. If the devs could the whole waiting for the game to start while every 10 year old on mom and dads pc trys to annoy you into being a snake should be changed. Able to mute players would go a long way during that wait time or when your waiting to jump in the plane. Overall this game does kick booty in its current state im very excited to see what the future holds for this. 8/10Edit 10/25/18Dsync Hackers no working region lock NA servers are full of Chinese hackers. Ive played enough to say i gave the dev team time to fix the issues they havent.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I was really excited to play this game. After watching several hours of gameplay from different Youtubers I decided to try my hand at the carnage....2 hours and 10 attempts later...I got ONE hit on a player....and TEN...count that....TEN... lost connection to server errors...the rubberbanding and lag make the game unplayable. ( Extremely disappointed....Update June 8 2017After trying multiple different work arounds and fixes spending $1200 on computer upgrades and getting the game to play at least occasionally....this game is A LOT of fun...and I would love to recommend it. I still can't in good faith recommend it however due the inconsist playability...every time I get a work around and think I'm good...an update happens and I'm right back to square one. That being said...the developers are EXTREMELY active and are openly trying to fix and optimize the game for the customers...I sadly am one of many who have yet to see full fruition of it...but I do have faith that they will eventually fix it and are not just making a cash grab and leaving you with a broken game.The game is in a real good state for an EARLY EARLY access game but with the current server stability...I would say wait for an actual release to buy...that being said...the minute the server issues are resolved...my recommendation changes to "BUY BUY BUY" whole heartedly!Update 2018While still somewhat frustrating at times this game is fun and well worth the money! review: Product received for free. Disclaimer I got the game from a Facebook giveaway (from a fan page not related to Bluehole/PUBG) free of charge.After several tweaks and new maps I think the current game is quite playable and fun to play with friends. Of course there are some flaws and things that Bluehole has done wrong the overall game is quite good and deserves a recommendation.Things the dev did rightContinuous updatesLet's be honest guys the new map (Vikendi) is actually well made and good looking. It has a lot of buildings for lootings while the size is not that big (as compared to the original map and the desert map) / small (as compared to Sanhok). It is a right direction of making maps and Bluehole definitely deserve some praises here.More new guns are always welcome but they should put more attention to gun varietyLimited time game modesNot as frequent as it used to be but the deathmatch mode is actually quite good to practice your aiming skills without all the hideous looting processVarious optimizations to the gameThe game has become more stable in terms of FPS consistency players with a mid range GPU can enjoy the game at 60fps with acceptable graphic quality.Continuous and improved cheater detectionMaybe I am lucky but it has been a long time I saw a cheater on the server. I think Bluehole is improving their process of finding a cheater and actually banning them. Anyway they should NOT rest now they should keep on improving their anti cheat system other than announcing something like "We have caught a number here cheaters today". I think all of us can notice the work they did and they effort can surely attract old players back to the game.Things the dev did wrong/not enoughPay to reach season pass with difficult and tedious missionsThe new season pass is a joke I cannot see the point of paying a large sum of money (nearly 40% of the price of the original game) for getting cosmetic items which REQUIRES repeated tedious grinding within a limited time period. This system is suppose to attract players to play the game but the whole season pass has transform into a easy cash grabbing system for Bluehole. Secondly some of the missions on the season pass are just impossible to complete and/or uninteresting. It makes the whole season pass unattractive for players to purchase. Bluehole should re think the design of each missions carefully and keep them interesting for players to reach. Some of the great examples are on the subreddit of pubg and worth considering.Thirdly the whole pay to reach system is just outrageously wrong. I don't know what they are thinking when they decide to add the option for players to "buy" season pass levels directly and I cannot see a reason for players to do so. Come on guys you have charged them for the season pass and you charge MORE for "helping" players to reach certain levels. It is just ridiculous and I don't think any players will support this idea.I know that the dev needs to earn money for the sustainable development of the game but the whole season pass is just a joke to all of us. I surely think that Bluehole can think of better ways to earn our money other than some ridiculous pay to reach season pass that has very limited duration.Inconsistent network latencyThis has been a problem since early access and it seems to become more serious since the release of Vikendi. Network delay and packet loss makes the game stutter even though the player has a powerful PC to run the game at consistent FPS. It is understandable for players to become furious when they died in a match because of network lag. If they can reduce the network lag I am sure that players will enjoy the game more.Lack of different gamemodesAs mentioned before the dev should consider putting more time on bringing new game modes that is different from the core gameplay to the game. It allows players to experience the game in a whole new perspective and sparks interests among players.Lack of communications and interactions between the communityAs mentioned before some of the suggestions from the community is actually quite good and worth consider implementing into the game. If Bluehole listens to the community and cooperate with us I think the game will become a lot better over time and attract new and old players to the game.In conclusion the gameplay is quite fun and enjoyable. This game is a great for playing with friends as each round feels different when you land on different places/has different weapons/faces different enemies. The game surely has its flaws but overall it worths recommending to new players to experience the excitement of battle royale while spending time with their friends. The dev should put more efforts on fixing the problems they should think of a better plan to develop the game sustainably without losing old players. The new map is just a right direction and I hope they can continue on putting more effort of putting new elements to the game in the near future.

review: First of all The idea of this game is good. The concept of this game is good. And this game would be amazing if it was not bad. But unfortunately it is. Now PUBG is a sort of an E Sport game however it comes with several flaws. These flaws ruin the game experience so much that you actually get way too frustrated. Don't get me wrong I am not an idiot in CS GO I am ranked LEM so I am not complaining about "cheaters" and being too bad at the game.First of all performance and lag. To give you an idea I am not playing on a potato. My PC achieves around 600 points in Cinebench. But still it is not enough for this game. And it is not a matter of refresh rate but also technical game design. So I achieve something around 100 120 Hz which is decent on a 144 Hz screen. However at certain situations the refresh rate drops down to rates as low as 30 Hz and the game becomes unplayable. That happens especially when there are enemies around. And that is quite unfortunate. The next big problem is that this game is technically made for GAME CONSOLES. So it plays VERY mushy and steering wheel like. Do you know the swift feel of CS GO? Forget it. PUBG sucks at giving you a decent quick gameplay. Which leads to the next big problem. LAG. This game is full of it. You want to pick up something? Click on it and wait. It does not pick up for ages. Sometimes you even click on it and nothing happens. When there are enemies around it kills you. Literally. Also the game does not come with a limit for latency. Which means that you might end up playing against enemies with latencies greater than 50 ms. They are unhittable. The worst thing though is that in the death camera the aim of these enemies is virtually off always. They cannot hit you the way you see it from their perspective. The aim is 100 % off target and still the game registers a hit. It is not a rare occasion that you on the other hand hit the enemy several times but nothing happens. In situations that require quick action the game is dead and unplayable. It forces you to play defencively and refrain from fighting. That makes it sort of boring.Second instead of fixing bugs and improving game performance the developer focusses on adding more and more features to attract new players. The game is not about being a good game they start milking it not caring at all. It still feels and plays like Summer 2017 the performance is still horrible. There is a bug? Don't expect it to get fixed. You see a cheater? Don't expect them to get banned. One of the most annoying things in this game was the lack of map selection. In April 2018 they had finally added it however with the introduction of the third map map selection was REMOVED from the game again. Seriously? The desert map sucks and nobody wants to play it! By forcing players to play a map pool instead of letting them choose the map they want to play on the game just becomes more frustrating. By adding event modes the developers have tried to make the game more appealing. But often the event mode feels like a DLC nobody has ever put any bit of effort into. I don't want to play a shotgun gamemode when the shotguns are random and the enemies spawn with S12K automatic shotguns while I have an S1897 pumpgun. Sorry but that sucks. Especially when your mates immediately disappear after joining.One thing you won't find many people complaining about are the vehicles. But again they suck. First of all they don't come with a manual gearbox. That means that you might end up going uphill and it decides to shift up and down up and down up and down... you cannot decide to put it in a low gear or something like that. No. Next The parking brake is buggy. In the vehicles that were available in the Early Access Version of the game it works. In the vehicles added later it does not. You pull the parking brake when getting out? The vehicle keeps moving. This is true especially for the trucks. I have been killed by that way too many times. In certain situations you would want to turn off the engine or at least cost with the clutch disenganged so you can approach enemies quickly without letting them hear you. But no it is not possible. Lifting your "foot" off the accelerator leaves the vehicle in gear. So it brakes and shifts down It is slow and loud. Insanely annoying. And last but not least there are vehicles such as the boat or the minibus that come with more than four seats. Why would they need that? I mean you can play as a Squad but not a Quint. They minibus is a cool concept but while it has a very weak Diesel engine it is not particularly fuel efficient. I would appreciate if it would be more fuel efficient than other vehicles. But it turns out that the fuel efficiency of all vehicles is exactly the same. That means that the faster your vehicle is the better your fuel economy will be. And I still wonder why they have not yet added drivable lorries to the game. I would appreciate a drivable URAL 375.Let's talk about the maps. The game features three maps. The original map the Asian map and the desert map. The desert map sucks as I have said. The other maps feature a neat design and the gameplay would be great if the game was not so buggy. Back in 2017 I could forgive the buggy and laggy experience since it was Early Access. But as of 2018 they have not done anything about it. But they could add two more maps to the game. And new weapons. And new vehicles. Sorry but that is unforgivable. After one year the game idea is still amazing. But what they have done about this game is just sad. You could say that they have wasted all the potential. That is sad. Sorry but I gonna go switch back to CS GO. Or maybe one day there will be a copy of PUBG that is better from a technical standpoint. If you have not yet purchased this game. Do not buy it.And I have to make edits to this review. Now they have issued the "Fix PUBG" campaign. It feels like a really bad joke. The technical design of PUBG is underwhelming it sucks. I keep falling through the map in ten per cent of the matches I play. I have to face death so many times due to bugs they are not fixing. Actually when I die it is most likely caused by a game bug. This game is not out of Beta yet. The game developers are abusing the players as beta testers.Great. Yet another update that changes the controls of the game. It renders it useless. Before the recent update controlling the player whilst parachuting was fairly easy. Now there are no more 3 dimensional controls instead of rotating the player model moving the mouse now rotates the camera which is a fairly useless function. In fact it is so useless that precisely landing is virtually impossible now.

I can't name a single thing they haven't fixed or updated (multiple times) in order to satisfy the community. Yes it still has a ways to go but it's still a great game at the end of the day and I'm excited to see where it will headEdit well the games still fun but the creators are being right about pretty much everything. Starting to become a little concrened about the future of this game when the only thing they see is not a better game but more money
