review: With no explanation Bluehole refuses to host servers on the West coast US despite millions of players playing from this region. This would fix a large number of what people know as "desync" issues and significantly improve the overall gameplay experience for both west coast and east coast players as everyone would have lower ping/latency. This would benefit EVERYONE. Amazon their server host offers west coast servers all Bluehole has to do is ask for Amazon to re allocate SOME PUBG servers to their clusters in Oregon/California instead of purely using Ohio. Throughout the course of the "fix PUBG" campaign there have been no significant improvements in the great complaints plaguing the game and more bugs have actually been introduced. Currently vehicle physics are significantly out of whack causing vehicles to occasionally go flying when striking a player on foot and to explode much more easily than before. Bluehole does not inspire confidence in their userbase. Bugs are reported on the test server and are put on the live version of the game anyway. Even game breaking bugs like the bug that allowed people to play in 3rd person while on 1st person servers. The maps have far FAR too many gaping wide open areas particularly in final circles. This means that in a lot of end game scenarios you'll be forced to march across a wide open field towards your enemies that are sitting safely behind the cover of houses edges of hills rocks etc thanks to pure chance. You can hedge your bets as much as you want someones you get lucky other times you're screwed and have 3 different teams all shooting at your team at the same time as you try to move to the next circle. The game needs significantly more objects towns POIs trees need to be bigger not a bunch of big flat open terrain. It makes for extremely unsastisfying game experiences. The recoil control is done almost perfectly except for the "settling" guns automatically do to auto recover from recoil after shots which can cause your aim to be thrown off by the game trying to "correct" your recoil for you. In other FPS games like Planetside 2 this behavior was actually considered a BUG. In a game going for "realism " why is my recoil being auto corrected for me in any capacity? It should work like R6 Siege or any other mil sim shooter you the player should have to control it 100% with no unpredictable "correction" mechanics messing up your aim for no explainable reason. The performance of the game is summed up in one word inconsistent. You can get a smooth 120FPS but then you will inexplicably stutter hitch pause have a significant frame drop or some other inconsistency no matter what drivers you use no matter how low you set your settings you'll experience these stutters intermittently that can get you killed in the game.Overall if it weren't for the fact that all my friends are always playing this game I never would have bought it I never would have played it and I can't understand how so many people continue to play it so regularly. I just can't stand it anymore. I'm fed up with the game and it's broken shenanigans. The frustratingly broken elements of the game make it very difficult to actually have fun while playing the game and fun is the most important part of any game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I changed my opinion one more time from negative to positive and again to negative. Encountering people with radar hacks at the end game like mushrooms after rain. Its no problem to get to top 10 for me but then these ers are closing in on me carefully even if i am not moving or making any sounds walking with cntrl but still they know exactly where i will exit or my head will pop up they are running just in the open. Why Blueballs! You fixed the chinese problems thats very good i really aprreciate that. BUT! Radars and macros. I have been killed so many time from like 300 metres by guy who shoots AR like its a airsoft gun. NO ING RECOIL! I don't believe that there are so many skillful players that can control a gun like that. But the radar is the worst. Whatever i do wherever i hide or make my plans to further move to circle it has no meaning because they will know exatly where i am and put a bullet straight trough my ing tier 3 helmet without recoil.. I have seen many videos of streamers AND OOOHH BOY half of them are cheating. Is this how you want to make a game? I really like this game but devs like money more. I cant say i will quit because sometime i am playing this game with my friends time to time but i will not recomend a game at its current state.And the last one is shotguns worst weapons in the game! (they didnt even fixed taht) The shotgun must be deadly accurate in close range by all standarts. But when a guy walks like 5 meters from you you miss because shotgun in blueballs universe is the most inacurate weapon in close range. So dont bother its better to pick a sickle or pan and kill someone. Ive seen how to guys trying to shoot me with shotguns and they missed i killed them with a pistol. Pistol Carl! They should have shreded me to a unrecocnizable meatball.

review: considering recent updates and some well needed fixes this game has improved overall however there is a contrary alot of the times the chinese come in troves to the US servers and ive had to litterally avoid playing squads for a bit duos are okay if you can find a buddy that speaks your language even somewhat. However id say if your not looking for teams and you can play solo then this is the true battle royale and when i mean true battle royale i mean based off the japanese movie. It holds its title very well. PUBG isnt about the chicken dinner its pushing yourself to be the best player you can possibly be. Winning in those tiny circles at the end game is all about location location location.... there is no way to win without being in the correct defensive position And getting there is easier said then done. This game is the only game that can still get my blood pumping with the thrill of a drive by with a shotgun ( its more effective than you think) popping a motorcyles tire and watching them crash to their demise. Jumping off the rock by Bootcamp onto the island across the river on bike in high speed. Sniping that perfect 1000m shot at just the right time. nailing that guy with a winchester 94 at distances you didnt think were possible on it. This game is more about the satsfaction of beating another player at their own game of camping. There is nothing more satisfying that pushing yourself to be better win or lose. I have killed streamers without their streams. Ive made friends just by being me and having fun with this game. I wouldnt trade it for h1z1 or Blackout or fortnite. This to me is the original battle royale since i played the arma 3 mod for it back in 2012. The game itself now feels like a cleaner more crisp version of that arma 3 mod speed up by the circle. In the End it doesnt matter how much anyone can claim that chicken dinner but the satisfaction of a kill and thrill of a chase is all i need to be content. Thank you playerunknown for making such a delightful hunt for the next player no matter the equipment.... its a game of brawn and brain like a true battle royale should be..... learning its secrets has been a wonder on its own in the high pitched combat realm that is..... PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS *cue music*

review: Pubg has fallen victim to a lot of bad reviews from people who have logged hundreds of hours in to this game. Perhaps I view things too simply but a game that keeps me coming back and has earned almost a thousand hours of playtime is nothing but incredible. I play this game a few times a week with friends and it is always enjoyable. I've had several incredibly memorable moments in this game and it has been fun to watch a small develop release a game that completely changed the gaming world. You now have massive publishers doing everything they can to jump on this bandwagon. Pubg needs to be recognized for setting the world ablaze and releasing a game that is just fun to play.

review: Awesome fun &amp exciting game. Though it puts quite a load on my PC (I'm running I5 6500 GTX1060 6GB 16GB RAM) it's well worth it. For new players there is quite a learning curve but you'll get a hang of it in no time. Do not be shunned off by its price tag though as you can sell the crates that you buy in game to recoup the price you paid for the game (Well at least I did). The game servers does crash from time to time but that is expected of since its early access. A number of hackers exist in this game (obviously) but sometimes you'll beat them sometimes you'll lose to them. Main con to be concerned about is the poor optimization. You can either wait for the full release for less bugs &amp better optimization or jump the gun &amp charge right into the game without giving a single f**k. Your choice!

review: This game is literally the epitome of garbage. I have so much time in this game and 1/4 of the time was just a cumfest of desync and lag. If you're playing with friends sure buy it and around. If you really value where your money goes don't touch this game. Pros It doesn't look like some cartoon bs like Fortnite. Gunplay better than Fortnite but subpar to games like Tarkov. Killing people is still fun.Cons They hold maintainence at the most r3t rd3d times possible. Get home from work on a Thursday and you want to PUBG with friends? Sorry maintainence. Rendering strategies for the game is terrible as well. Objects at a distance don't render to reduce load on weak machines but that literally destroys the shooting. There are many clips online where shooting a gun in the head doesn't hit them because there was an object not rendered in the distance. The devs are just complete potato. It started well when crates were free and you didn't have to spend on a key to open. Now 75% of the crates you get require and key and it's literally disgusting how money hungry the devs for this game became. Never going to buy a key and hoping no one else ever does so these devs can go back to sucking DlCK for money. Desync. Enough said.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I got the game since first or second month of Early Access. And still I face the following bugs #FPS drops ONLY when enemy close to me. and sometimes I use this bug to hide and kill the enemy near by. UPDATE FPS been fixed but still game doesnt feel smooth .#Servers The servers are really bad sometimes my hit does not register or when I land and take weapon I shot the other guy first and he shot back I die while he stay alive even if we are using same shotgun. UPDATE This happens only at the beggining of the matchs .# NEW Keys While using healing items it block stand button for no reason while causes death. UPDATE Most keys priority been fixed . UPDATE Nov 2018 The game forums says the devs reached the right optimization level. But it doesnt seem they did. ________________Why I still recommend this game Even with the bugs I mentioned you will find out this game is fun because every round is different and unique from it combat.________________What I hate about it #Lower Spec PC's have adventages over the high end. Because of some rendering is not showing on low end pc's Its always problem with PC games .#There is lot of cheaters / Hackers which means the anti cheat system is really bad and need to be fixed. As you can see all I mentioned can be temporary from bugs to bad points about the game. And that If the developers worked harder before the game lose it popularity./Happy gaming.

review: I really enjoy this game....when it works. There are serious issues. Since the latest patch (28 Dec 17) i have been having serious lag issues that will freeze the game for up to 20 seconds at time over and over again for about 2 minutes at a time. The game isn't playable in its current state.There is also quite a toxic online culture already. I have had to turn voice chat off because people in the lobby will play loud music and abuse one another over comms. There are also serious issues with hackers wihin the game (from all nations) that make it difficult to enjoy.Finally they need to considder a Chinese only server. The constant abuse (some of it exceptionally racist) being sprouted in chinese is terrible not even looking at the constant screaming of "China Number 1" at the start of every round. Please Dev's the anti Chinese messages you are getting are coming in for a reason (not because everyone who posts one is a racist) you may have a lot of Chinese players but their methods of interacting with the rest of the community are currently very poor. TL DR they need to optimise their game to fix the lag issues the need to region lock their servers and they need to add in functionality to see ping and who is playing in your game....same as every other online game out there.This game has so much potential and I have enjoyed it but in its current state I can't recommend it to anyone. I hope the developers take notice and fix these issues and if they do i will be more than happy to change my rating.12 months later update stability has been improved but lag remains an issue that can adversly affect enjoyment.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is fun in its own way few bugs here and there but nothing game breaking however my porblem with it is the lack of things that this game offers specially when you have to pay to play it.I was wondering why the Pubg Mobile got so much more to offer?It's a free to play graphic is not that bad and people found ways to play it on pc using apps and such so why it got so much more to offer?Some of the things that the mob version offers 1 Tutorial a shooting range with all the guns in the game that you can test as much as you like.2 Huge store with so much more stuff in took me 15 min to take a look at it and didn't even finish.3 Events and you don't have to download 9gb for them.4 Lots of options for Player camos and Guns camos (the camos in the PC version are really bad not attractive and only a few are available). 5 We all know that you need keys to open locked chest in the PC version and it's the same on the mob version however there is key shards in the mob version you collect enough you get a key to open a locked chest with so a player that paid nothing for the game gets the chance to open locked chest while a player who paid for the game have to pay more to open any!!.It feels like the owners are Ignoring the PC version and tryin to move on to the mob version since according to the number of players active says it all on both platforms (PC 600k mobile 3 million).PS for all new players don t buy the PC version get the mobile one it got more to offer and its free (you can work around and play it on PC too) PC version have nothing better to offer other than better graphic that you need a super PC to enjoy.

My internet is absolutely fine with a ping of 30. review: The game is amazing. Giant maps good variation of weappons cool gameplays.Pros Large map more possibilities.Good variety of weappons armour attachments and vehicles.Bullet drop addes makes it more skillbased.Fun events and cool skins.Compared to fortnite you can disconnect from the server and rejoin.Cons Requires strong and expensive computercomponents to run this game. Not everyone can afford it.Lag when multiple people drop at the same place.Dsync is a hugeproblem. If the zone is on the other side of the map you have a lot of sprinting in the game.I recomend this game for gamers that has a good computer and is dedicated to become good.If you have a school computer or a week computer i suggest you to wait for an upgrade.

review: FIX PUBG simply the best. But game is dying and the only one way to return players is to 1. Game engine development people are beginning to get used to the smoother and more drawn picture as in Fortnite of COD so one of the ways could be to improve graphics by creating more simple graphics (I'm not saying that now the graphics are bad it's great but for most people it seems to me to be too hard for people to even come and relax to play their favorite game and not sit and look out for a bush or a man lying down).2. Creating smth new like a large number of ""pleasant for the eye" animations" or the innovation of new maps and interesting daily challenges (i mean i could be random Snow map (for the time of winter it would be Supper interesting and attract alooot of attention) for 60 70 players and only for 3 5 month (like test map) )3. The idea came when I wrote point 2 of course you might be a little violated for plagiarism but what about the idea of changing weather? It will be winter now and on all maps there will be snow frozen lakes and water and so on. (Yes I know it looks like Forza but it can really help and show everyone that this is not just a game with 3 cards but really a game that lives)P.S please do not repeat the fate of H1Z1

review: After more than 1000 playing hours I need to write this review.When the game was published it had a lot of technical teethings and bugs but because of the alpha version the games idea and the realization I could really accept this.Multiple months later namely now they solved most of this bugs. BUT with each update they deliver new bugs or bugs which has been solved already earlier. With one of the last patches they introduced network delay. It is really AWESOME(!!!) if you lose each day at least one match by getting shot behind a wall... If the network delay is not getting fixed soon I am going to uninstall the game there is no fun left.My personal impression is that they prefer to bring out new skins to earn money than fixing bugs or trying to improve the games performance shame shame... and even more shame.I hope they are going to give me the possibility to edit this review soon but I do not believe in it anymore.JUST WOW! They really fixed the network delay with the last server patch! Thumbs up for this )

review: Piece of game now. Too many hackers bugs and lag. No ing way this is "E Sports" ready. Love how I can press f on a gun 5 times and my guy still doesn't pick it upEdit I've played many hours of this game. It has gotten much better in the lag and such and since battle eye has been adopted I've only come across one blatant hacker who was speeding around 1 tapping everyone. Parachuting is much better than it was but it still sucks every now and again when you get caught on nothing or a nearby building and have to wait like 10 seconds to cut it away and take damage. Overall I recommend it especially to play with friends I rarely play alone since it can be boring during the mid game.

I tend to play solo but when playing with friends it is still very enjoyable (maybe more so in fact). Highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys a slower more tactical gameplay for FPS.

review: To start this game has come extremely far in it's efforts to provide it's consumers with a very promising product for only $30.00. I am extremely satisified with the abilities of the development team and it's quickness to action based on community needs and demands. I believe this game has alot to improve upon like any other game but if it's team maintains its current posture I believe it would be the greatest game I own in terms of performance and experience. This game has alot of issues regarding dealing with hackers and organizing it's servers by region ( BUT THIS IS JUST MY OPINION ) and I think there are some minor issues with vehicles that need to be addressed in the coming times. Overall this game is the perfect representation of what a battle royale should strive to perform like and I'm HIGHLY impressed with the game overall in every fashion. I would highly recommend it and I hope this aids in your purchase and amplifies your content with your purchase!

I currently cannot recommend this game because of all of the bugs.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Absolutely the worst devs of all time. can't focus on the issues that ned fixing and instead introduce a battlepass to copy fortnite (a game I hate but at least the devs are great). A testiment to how bad the game is I tried to come back about 30 minutes ago because I was feeling some pubg for the first time in months but low and behold I was greeted by the "failed to connect to server" screen that you get at least 5 times a session. No amount of pressing reconnect or restarting the lobby solved the issue so I just gave up. I used to love this game (I have over 500 hours) but being unfailingly let down by the devs in virtually every promise they offered just pushed me out of the game. I really do wish the best for pubg and I hope the devs can get their act together but I can't recommend this game to anyone (unless your looking for a very competitive experience that is about the only demographic this game can appeal to but since I discovered EFT I realized that that can be found in a better game with better devs.) All in all if you are looking for a battle royale don't waste your money on PUBG it'll let you down eventually. If you're looking for a competitive game go with siege or try out Escape From Tarkov.

review: When this game first came out it wasn't revolutionary in anyway but it was one of the best Battle Royale games since the Minecraft hunger games mod (we don't talk about the culling here I'd like to forget that even exists) but as of now with the game being out for almost a year. There's almost nothing new about the game. All Bluehole has really done was add 2 maps and skins/loot boxes to make more money off of people and copy fortnites "progression" system.+Tactical gunplay(?) Almost nothing game changingly new to the game since launch Most games consist of just waiting in the zone for somebody to approach you Or you get sniped randomly while running to the zone and wasted 10 minutes of your life just running in a game Slow paced gameplay (can be a positive for some) Maps are generally empty and too big for their own good Hackers still common Servers/Hitreg are garbage Added loot boxes after stating they would never add themConclusion At this point you're better off playing Black Ops 4's Blackout mode if you want a semi tactical Battle Royal game. It's a perfect mix of what makes both Fortnite and PUBG fun while listening to the community on things that need fixing

review: Product received for free. So... Pubg... I see alot of negative reviews that are quite frankly somewhat fair and unfair to the product. I can say having paid for a few keys and the pre release game that for the $30 $50 that this game has cost me I have gotten my moneys worth. Over a year of solid online play has been had with friends in squads and thats definitely a ton of time. The issues suggested by others are many 1) Region blocking due to cheats2) Cheat protection was poor3) Network Latency/deseync is high and still a problem4) New content has been very slow to release maps guns etc5) Poor release schedule on updates almost always ran long6) Game seems to have become a skin engine (like Counter Strike)7) Map glitches causing damage/movement issuesSome of those issues are with the company and some with the gamer design. Here's the fundamental goods about the game.1) Methodical paced games.2) Solid gun play feel and weight3) Great positional audio/sound work 4) Enjoyable coop feel for a small team6) 3 large/well placed maps.7) Decent transport systemOverall I'd say this game when played with a good group of well intentioned fun seekers is still a fun game. Part of the original fun was in the jank from the game and as BlueHole has tried to push this game into a more polished and e sports capable state it has suffered some with the crowd due to the ridiculous nature of deaths and general fun/sillyness dropping away. At this point the game has large flaws map issues with odd placement of momentum stopping dips vehicle oddness in movement code general desync between players engagements and some basic problems with region protection and cheater prevention. It is still however fun with a good group of people. Is it worth the price now? I don't know but I will say that it was for me and I've enjoyed my time with this game. Will I continue to play? Probably because its still relatively enjoyable with the right friends. However I will likely move on eventually to another more polished game due to the slow release and often poorly defined release cycle of the developers game updates. I think it is getting better but I'm not sure if the future holds any meaningful updates for this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have played this game since it was closed beta it was a fun game with almost no cheaters and there wasn't a lot of performance issues however after it was open beta and than the release it was flooded with cheaters bugs and glitches. Work still needs to be done in the game still having the same issues since open beta which is the loading of the game (hearing people running and hearing the plane) sometimes it loads in time for me to choose where to jump to otherwise nowadays its after I landed and trying to run away. I will still recommend it however my loyalty to it is on and off. I give it a rating of 7/10 since there is less cheating now and their GM's are more responsive.

review: When this game was first released I had a blast with my friends. The original map is still my favourite and I didn't mind the long trips in a Dacia to get to the next zone. The best part for me was grouping with 3 of my goons experiencing the game and having a laugh.With that being said the updates to the game made the game less enjoyable. The second map (although I do like the city designs) was very barren and wasted. The colours of the map are utterly disgusting. This and the lack of any Life or Charm to the map made it unenjoyable. I know that the original map is arguably just as bad but in my opinion there was a lot of variety. The mountain beside the hospital the shooting range the military base. All of these created a huge variety for the map. What does the Desert Map have? A city... And a city... Possibly a graveyard or some Furthermore they added a few more guns to the game which don't break up the hierarchy of guns whatsoever. Don't get me started on the attachments... God... The attachments...Regardless I'm gonna rate this a positive review just for PUBG being one of the best experiences I've had with friends when it came out.

review: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNLESS THEY REGION LOCK. The number one issue in this game is the De sync caused by players from around the world with different pings all mashed into the same game you will experiance being shot well after you have gotten behind cover and bullets that disapear in mid air. The number one thing that players in this game have asked for is to region lock and the developers have spit in our faces with a new matchmaking system that doesnt even allow you to pick a region It forces you to play with whoever their broken system syncs you up with. I end up matched with players on my team from around the world who have a ping of 200plus while I have 35 40 ping so I know my enemys are also all over the place which makes for a terrible time in a game where fractions of a second make the difference all the time. The PUBG devs do nothing but try to squeeze every penny they can out of this game with in game purchases of skins but absolutely spit in our faces by refusing to address the matchmaking issues the vast majority of players complain that they want region lock and instead they took away regions alltogether and mixed us in to one big laggy pool of players. I have never hated anyone that Ive never met as much as I absolutely despise the people who make the decision to refuse region locking I seriously HATE HATE HATE THEM and wish many terribble experiances upon them like their ghame has visited upon me by killing any joy Im having with network related problems that they refuse to change!!! DO NOT GIVE THESE PEOPLE YOUR MONEY. Unless you want to I sure do....

review: PUBG is one of the most exciting interesting and engaging games in the last 10 years. With the amount of people playing it is a phenomenon. At the moment it has optimisation problems and struggles to get a decent fps UNLESS you have a high end PC then it becomes playable. I have faith that this game will become good as it is in PUBG's best interest to fix the game otherwise everyone will abandon it and switch to another battle royale game. I can say I enjoy playing this game a lot but there are frustrations with the optimisation. If you don't mind spending money on a game YOU KNOW has some serious flaws at the moment then buy it if not I advise you to wait until they have fixed the game to a playable standard.

review: The game is absolute fun to play however there are some major issues involving game play strategem that the developers can't seem to understand about a game that has a pro/tournament scene along with a casual scene. I refuse to play this game again until they make every item in game usable in some scenario rather than utterly useless as the game progresses in each match. RNG is a factor in this game however due to poor implementation and balance of certain weapons that RNG factor goes up even more after factoring in if you can or can't grab certain items in the start of a match let alone if you see some of the items you just run past them because you can't be bothered. This company needs to look and analyze other FPS/TPP games to really understand what they're missing when it comes to concrete gameplay versus drastically unreliable spawns and uses of certain weapons at any given time.

review: I love PUBG!! I have been an online FPS gamer since it started. I have in my posession the best FPS game ever made BFBC2!!!!This game is the only other game I have played that allows the player to go so far and do so much! It is practically open world. It took me a few games to like the game it took me 100 more to love it. I am now in my 5th or 6th season and the game keeps getting better. The optimizations are coming along nicely. When I first started playing I could hardly run the game now she is smooth. Granted I have a first gen i7 if I had a better computer I am certain I could enjoy it more but with the rig I have it is no problem to compete. I personally reported 2 people that I knew for certain were hacking due to what I saw in the replay. Within a few hours I was sent a message stating the users had been removed for review and later I was contacted to say they were banned and thanks for the heads up. Other then those two times I have had no such bad luck with every game being full of cheaters but I guess I would feel that way if I was not good enough to win....

review: Back when the game was more popular this game was extremely enjoyable. Whether it was alone or with friends this game was always fun. The weapon system/RNG felt decently fair the gunfights were enjoyable and overall the maps were good. HOWEVER ever since the game started to become like fortnite it all went downhill. With the addition of more complex skins emotes different maps (I know fortnite doesn't have different maps but they change it) dift. game modes etc. What I actually liked about this game were some of the features that were unlike fortnite. As an avid fortnite hater I felt like PUBG's style of gameplay&gt skins/looks was awesome. But then... the game became more like fortnite... and dropped dead. I do not enjoy fortnite but the way the game works fits well with their system of skins/map rotations and everything.If you want to play this game now be sure to check in to a mental hospital beforehand so that you can get through all of the paperwork. After several hours at a time you will want to take that frying pan in game and smash it on your skull until your face has been beaten into a pulp. After getting killed by a chinese hacker and having to pay 45 dollars for skins that you may have wanted I guarantee that you would rather suck on a massive sweaty chode than play this embarrasment of a game. Fortnite a childrens game is considered better than this heaping pile of garbage. Take time to ponder that.

review: This game is much better than it seems. Its the best game I have played ever. Pubg has some bugs but they dont occure that much and arent really a thing. Most times its just one small annoying thing that doesnt matter alot(died once to a bug in 1k hours of pubg and me and my friend thought its actually pretty funny). The lags are as bad as pictured. It runs slower than a dog with 2 and a haf legs. The game gave me and my friends alot of good time and will always be memorized as on of the best or the best game I ever played. I love playing the game for what it is. Its a semi realistic game and I love that style. Im certainly too bad for Arma but I dont really like CS GO s realism but PUBG just hits the sweet spot. I would recommend this game to anyone who wants to get into some more realistic stuff than CSGO or just Battle Royale itself. (I came here from CSGO and learning the game is hard but awesome) The graphics are pretty good and I like themAll in all this game is very awesome with bad perfomance a few but not really important bugs good graphics and a great gameplay.9/10 would recommend

review: I ve played PUBG since October 2017 so a bit over a year. I ve had a lot of fun and have enjoyed many of the updates. However I feel that the company doesn t care about improving the game at all. I m often left feeling that it s SO close to being a really great game but that the network/performance issues are COMPLETELY negating all positive aspects. It doesn t matter how great the gunplay is or good the ambience is if it s all detracted the moment lag sets in. I ve tried and tried and tried to give game more chances I WANT it to run well. It isn t even worth it to TRY to play because it s a toss up as to whether or not anything will even register or be worth the effort. All of these feelings have been amplified by the silence that Bluehole (PUBG Corp) gives towards criticism. They haven t completely abandoned the game and community but #FixPUBG was a failure and there s been no official statement on it s future. The people who love this game are constantly left with the quandary of whether or not to quit playing it forever. We re hopeful and holding out but I m losing hope because of the company. This game has been incredibly successful compare the success and growth of Mojang and Minecraft with Bluehole and PUBG. It IS possible for indie companies to expand and improve their games.

review: I've never experienced such a rush from winning a video game ever. It is amazing. The game itself it extremely fun and if you're concerned about buying it based on all the negative reviews just go for it. In my experience the negativity has been exaggerated. In my (currently) 68 hours which translates to hundreds of games (yeah I've played a lot of 5 minute games....) I've experienced hacking twice only. I can't recommend this game highly enough the thrill of winning a match is just insane.EDIT I'm now well over 400 hours and still give it a glowing recommendation. I tell all of my friends to buy it and play with me because it is just amazing (and more fun in squads). Yes there are issues. It's not perfect there's occasional hacking opponents some annoying bugs but it is still (even with all sorts of issues) the best battle royale game out there and so much fun. I still highly recommend.

review: Original Review (Don't Recommend) Should be better but it's fun. Servers are frequently slow hit registration is jank and hackers never get dealt with. Small EA style micro transactions are another thing that bring this game down. Game has been out for awhile and it feels the same as it did when it was in alpha. When this game is working like it should it's great but it doesn't more than it does lolEDIT (changed to recommended)Bluehole has actually been improving the game recently quite a bit. New daily and weekly missions give more of a reason to play. New items in the shop that support twitch streamers and imo steer me away from buying keys for crates (which I still think should just be removed from the game) Various permorance tweaks bug fixes a competitive system has finally been implimented and they still promise more to come out soon. Good steps in the right direction and i have to bring that up. Hackers are less common now because of a forced region lock which until they can figure something better out is working just fine for me. Optimization is much better too. Less stuttering and rubberbanding.

review: Having played circa 500 hours won and lost matches I can tell you the following This game is ridden with bugs (and I mean Starship troopers sized bugs) It's so poorly optimized that even mid high tier PCs can't run it at stable +60FPS It's been developed by a team that despite good intentions is not up to the challenge they're learning on the way and have (shocker!) under delivered so far. It's trying hard and failing miserably to become a viable e sport Server tickrate is the worst I've ever seen in an online game. There's also de sync issues and lag. At the moment the anti cheat engine is deficent to say the least. In game vehicles are broken specially the 3 seat motorcycle which seems to randomly explode at whim. In game sound is terrible unbalanced to the point where some sounds are so loud they can even affect damage hearing of the player for life. It's extreme RNG may cause the best of players to be killed by a CS GO silverThen why the upvote? There's 2 main reasons. The first one being the very basic reason I play videogames at all it's fun with friends even the random vehicle explosions are fun. The second one is that having used the test servers and being part of the reddit community I see this didn't turn out to be a cash &amp run scheme. BH has hired more devs partnered with MS and is hearing the community. I can see they are working hard to meet their goals finish the game optimize it and add content. UPDATE Feb 9th 2018 I'm revisiting this review to point out that 2 months after the "1.0" realease (which by the way means nothing but a rename) hardly any new visible content has been deployed. The efforts have supposedly been put into the so called anti cheat system. But cheating is rampant and I doubt they can ever fix it since the very issue allowing people to tamper the game lays within games infraestructure itself (client side detection low server side refresh rate unencrypted packages). Other than this it's stil unfinished unpoolished ridden with bugs and still fun... when you don't run into cheaters. UPDATE Nov 20th 2018 Probably my final review. During the last 9 months things have nothing but got worse. Player base has shrinked to 1/3 it's still large but because of faulty MM algorithm it still results in relatively long queue times (depending on game mode region and time of the day). Cheating is still a problem. Basic issues related to game mechanics haven't been addressed. PUBG Corp. created a campaign to fix the game called #FIXPUBG to appease the public claim for quality they gave themselves a 3 months deadline and still fell short by a large margin (and even introduce new bizarre bugs!!). I've found myself playing less and less my squad jumped ship game is no longer fun for me. Would I recommend buying it? If you have the gift of foresight and are reading this in 2017 totally go for it. But right now it's no longer worth it. As a personal note I'm kind of heart broken as I write this. I've had very good times with PUBG but I can't help to wonder what it could have become had it had a good development team and a competent company behind it. PUBG will always be remembered as both the most unlikely hit and worst wasted opportunity in gaming history. A pity.

review: Impressive. Great community. Massive maps. It will get your heart pumping no doubt.UPDATE After 120 matches and 24 hours or so of playing I've discovered the game has a long slow learning curve. But progress is being made. Still having fun. Great game.2nd UPDATE Almost one year after purchase its still fun. It is a work in progress but its far better than the early version I started with. Even with its many competitors battling it out for the lead PUBG still holds a grasp on something special.3rd and last probably (423 hrs of PUBG later) Well after much work the game seems very stable and plays far better than it ever has in the past. I would say its great. Due to competition its population and popularity has dropped but is still a powerhouse in the category. Be patient while playing this game. If your new to the game you will die. Again again and again. Don't hot drop yet. Get used to loooting and demands of the game. In a way thats part of the fun of it. How far can you get? Probably the hardest game on Steam. Have fun.

review: Very fun game aslong as you dont get mad easily very fun with friends but is sometimes laggy but in my opinion better then any battle royale game on steam at the moment it is also being constantly updated and improved (i.e. Removing bugs and free content and weapons) Does have loot crates but they are purely cosmetic. some require keys but some dont you can earn crates by getting BP or battle points. In my opinion the pros weigh out the cons overall 8 10Also Please dont get disinterested from the other reviews I wouldent call this game perfect honestly far from it but the free content and fixes the developers are dishing out are helping the game so dispite a few bumps I still reconmend this game due to the adrenaline pumping laggy mess this game is.

review: I've changed my opinion drastically since my previous review what started off as a solid early access game with a few minor bugs and room for improvement has now become a game of glitchy ness galore. Not only is the whole game buggy and jittery but it's impossible to find a decent server half the time. The odd time that you do actually manage to find a server results in 15 minutes of looting and then an immediate death due to not landing in the right area. The weapons spread in general also seems slightly messed up although that may just be from my experience. Great if you want to be part of the realistic Battle Royale movement otherwise you're just better off playing Fortnite.

review: IN MY OPINION..this game was one of the greatest multiplayer game ever let alone as best Battle Royale game. it wasn't boring since everytime you landed on the map it's different possibilities(mostly dead). The mechanics and logic are on point I love this kind of game rather than a game where you start on small map and finish the round a same repetetive and small possibilities.Like I said it was a great multiplayer means it was the best if you played with your friends. Random matching kinda lame to me. Also playing solo is boring af IMO. This game can make a new player feels the chills runs down their spine for a long time my hands are shaking right after my first few game. It was so intense and fun that I could wet my pants.(I'm stlll shaking)I do realize that people are being mad on the devs coz of the hacker issue well I never met one but that doesn't mean they dont exist here. I do hope the devs works on this issue since it was a big waste if this game dead coz of hackers it has so many potential to be the best game ever.IT'S AN ADDICTIVE GAME FIT TO BE CROWNED STEAM AWARD
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: To those who are interested in purchasing be forewarned that this game is CPU intensive and your daddy's old Compaq in the basement isn't gonna cut it. I previously ran the game with an FX 8120 and R9 280x and was averaging 40 45 fps on low/med settings. Now that I have a 1080TI and 7700k I get 90 100 fps average with everything on ultra. That being said this is one of the best EA games I've ever played weekly/monthly updates that fix issues and add gameplay elements and a solid playerbase keep us coming back for more. Gameplay is like an arcadey ARMA which I personally love lots of tense moments and frantic looting. I highly recommend this game if you can run it ofc with Steam's refund system you can try it out yourself. I have faith in PlayerUnknown to publish a completed game in just a few more months.Update 11/25/17 Still runs rough compared to other games but 1.0 Test Servers show some hope. We'll see full release in a month or so and I'll update then with a full review. Still play almost every day.Updaye 11/21/2018 Runs "okay" but they put WAYYY to much effort into a battlepass and overpriced cosmetics. Still server issues. Biggest problem at this point in time is nobody I know really plays anymore and I haven't touched it in awhile myself. RIP PUBG.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I think anyone who plays this game has a love/hatred toward this game that much is kinda clear by the reviews already BUT.... this game is still amazing!!! review: You know I really really REALLY want to like this game. It's a very successful battle royale game and it's a gamemode I've been waiting a long time to really see be developed. However even after waiting for the game to get better since I bought it (about a year ago) the issues really haven't gotten better. I have a pretty good graphics card the game stored on an SSD and a half decent CPU. Even with all of this I can't load into matches half of the time. The game could feel smoother with movements too. I sincerely hope that the "Fix PUBG" campaign is real thing and not just some gag from the developers. I want to see this game get better. It can be a great game still. I just can't enjoy it until it's issues are fixed. If the only way to play the game successfully is to dive deep within the game's files and change numerous settings on your computer + graphics card then the game developers PROBABLY aren't doing something right. Again I really do want to like this game but it's plagued by choppy movements poor load times poor matchmaking and just several game mechanics that don't feel comfortable. This game isn't worth the money that you pay for at the moment.

review: not for the easily frustrated maybe for the masochistic. i'm an average to below average pvp shooter and this game involves looting and combat meaning it can be loot simulator 2018 where you just loot tons of for 10 20 mins only to die and give your supplies as tribute to your betters or you can kind of fight and maybe can win. this second part has a huge learning curve and some luck in terms of circle positioning (the blue circle of death) and also pubg server stability/hackers. if you don't get mad at games because you realize they are games then you should be fine and this can be a rewarding journey of learning how to proficiently play a battle royale and shooter and team communication with wins that leave you satisfied (until you stupidly press play again at the end of a late night thinking you can win again and instead you acquired new cancer cells). if you get mad at games that only give you one life like hardcore mode in some games then unless you're good at shooters you're going to get consistently frustrated and this game will be like smashing your head into the wall. not for the faint of heart. i'd recommend still based on the sense of pride and accompishment achieved

review: Very detailed battle royale. The only problem with it is it gets repitive. You wait in the lobby for two minutes drop loot for 20 minutes or so then die for the first few hours until you get the hang of it. I have yet to get a win and I have 27 hours and maybe I'm just bad but it doesn't provide a very enjoyable experience when everybody is camping on the third floor of a building sniping you every game. I prefer a much more action packed game such as fortnite where you loot for a few seconds then fight. The play style also is very fun in fortnite you rush your opponent rather than literally camping in a room for 30 minutes which I'm conviced is the requirement to win.

review: UPDATE 1.12.2018Updated review to positive.Havent run into bugs in months. The client is very stable. Havent seen a hacker in months.The hitreg is still somewhat of a problem if youre used to cs/quake. The game engine is more suited to military sim type gameplay rather than quake/cs style twitch shooting and performes well as such.Performance is decent. A cpu bottleneck can create annoying stutters during gunfights.Overall definitely recommended!UPDATE 5.4.18Was about to update my review to a positive but in the last few weeks the hacking has become rampant again. Granted there are less raging aimbotters since the replay update but blatent wallhacking and more subtle aim assists are once again frequent making the game unplayable.The hit reg is also still abysmal. Shooting moving targets is largely guesswork. The playermodel seems to have nothing to do with where the hitboxes are.Great game. Especially with a group of friends. Server issues have finally started to subside but...In the last few weeks cheating has become unbearable. Last 10 games 7 had blatent rampant cheating. A car driving through buildings full auto no recoil ars from 300 meters and blatent aimbotters not event bothering to ads but rather hip fire from hundreds of meters away... Until PU does something about this the game is completely unplayable. Do not buy!

review: PUBG and I have a love hate relationship. I've enjoyed the game thus far but as we progress and as Bluehole adds more and more microtransactions in lieu of bug fixes optimization and just bettering their game it can make being a fan hard.That being said I still enjoy the game. I think at its core it's a solid game and I can't say that I don't have fun playing it casually. If I played in a competitive sense this would be a different review but I think PUBG does more good than bad.

review: Honestly its a great game.While I'm being honest however it has some issues some bugs. Not all of these have been fixed and as each new update comes more will arise thats how games work and personally I haven't been affected by any bugs. I also have zero issues with hackers however many of those are in my region I do not know. What I do know is that the devs are working to fix these bugs which takes time of course it doesn't happen as fast as we'd like but it still happens eventually even if it takes an entire campaign to "Fix PUBG". I would recommend you buy this just keep in mind it might be frustrating hell it WILL be frustrating but keep in mind that if you die to a hacker or a bug stops you from getting that sweet Chicken Dinner they may not get banned straight away and the bug may not get fixed straight away. The devs are working hard to keep their game safe and fun to all of its players. TL DR I recommend the game it has some bugs and you might get killed buy hackers but it isn't a frequent atleast in my playtime.

review: After a year of playing lots of hours the game was fun and frustrating. Lots of bugs some fixed some are new. For example a recent one there was a gift for apologizing to players for a bad server update this bug gave some players including me the gift twice and bluehole decided to take it back even if it was their fault we have to pay it back. Now i owe about 12.5k BP ingame great! As for performance the game got better but not like other games. It still has many performance issues including endless loadings and crashes. I wont even talk about bad fps in some cases its awful.In matters of content not many things has changed either. We have few things from time to time. Only paid skins nothing more.Many things could be changed for the better. Small things but great for the user experience. For example the waiting lobby is really annoying and tiring. Some times the timer wont start for sometime or has 30 plus seconds remaing even if the lobby is comlete. People like me who like to hot drop and die most of the time in 30 seconds have to wait more than a minute to play next game.Tl dr lots of bugs bad performance few new content lots of paid skins developers don't listen to the community. Not recommended

I'm not talking only about bugs I'm talking about low budget development (despite its earnings) that impacts the game for example jumping and having one of your feet touch the edge of the platform you wanted to reach and just dropping down into the ground. Decided to move on to other games and finally realized that they didn't even bother to polish the most basic things they are going to milk it until it dies though. It made the BR modes a trend though so hopefully we'll see more alternatives soon but there's already some good ones on the table so I won't be touching this anymore probably.

review: I've been playing PUBG since it was first released it was my first battle royale game. It's a great game and can be alot of fun especially if you play with friends. Gameplay is mostly smooth with a few hiccups here and there. I'm not sure why or how but I experience more hitching and server issues now than I ever did before. I wish the circle algorithm was more random and finished in weirder places I seem to get the same circles often. Sometimes there's a lot of wait time early to mid game where nothing happens depending on where you land of course and mostly on the 2 larger maps Because of this I wish they would incorporate mini objectives throughout the map that maybe give you gold or rewards for completing. That way you feel like you're still doing something and the game doesn't drag on in areas with no action.Another thing is the reward system I have almost 1500 hours in this game and still haven't received any of the rarer items. I've opened numerous crates that includes the free ones and the locked ones you have to purchase a key for $2.50. It's not the worst thing I still play and have fun but it would feel nice to be rewarded for the many hours i've sunk into this game.All in all it's a fun game even when new games come out this one keeps pulling me back. Thumbs up to the devs and creators and I hope they keep working on it and releasing good content. Cheers.

review: It has a lot of potential and a promising ammount of updates. The base game as of currently is really fun but needs improvements.EDIT This game is still fun and had lots of potential for improvements but after the recent updates I have come to the conlcusion that pubg does not care about their game or community. They only care about the money adding new items in the game that you can pay for and so on... Still no optimizations or bug fixes. Hackers are pretty common unfortunately and can get really annoying.On top of that if you have a controller plugged in the game automatically thinks that you are going to be using that said controller. The only way to fix this is to restart pubg and unplug your controller before starting pubg back up. You used to be able to disable controller support through steams controller configuration settings but for some unkown reason bluehole thought they needed to remove that option as well.You have to be a special kind of stupid to be beaten by a game like fortnite(not that fortnite is a bad game).Another thing is that crossplay was something that pubg was potentially working on but the last news we heard from them was about 5 months ago (since I last updated this review). I understand it's probably extremely hard to make this work but they keep adding new things to the game which is time that can be spent figuring out how to set up crossplay for pubg or even bug and optimization fixes.The only reason I want crossplay is so that I can play with my sibling who own a xbox.Here's some gameplay of me and my friends screwing around when the game was good.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v oXlufjlM8Q8EDIT 1/5/19This game has not improved a lot on overall quality and just seems to me the devs are trying to milk out as much money as they can get. The movement in this game still feels sluggish the aiming feels off and the bullet drop is just ridiculous. That's just a FEW of the issues with this game. If you want to play a good variation of pubg just go to Ring of Elysium it's free not a horrendous disk space w**re and just downright runs better.

Since I wrote my review I stayed away from the game however coming back now I can say many issues have been fixed and the game is in a good playable state. Optimization and performance is still not great however has been improved. In general all aspects of the game have been improved. Not great but good enough. In general the game is a finished experience still a little rough around the edges however renewed developer support gives the title a great outlook of improvement. TLDR The poor developer support has been fixed and the game is back on the right path.

review: Great Game has a few kinks but has come so far in the past year for me it is the best realistic battle royale game (100 people on a map last one standing wins) there is at the moment. Absolutely worth buying the devs are active and are constantly updating the game and tuning the parameters sometimes it can take them a while to get something right but they do eventually if they had released the game as it is now it would have taken off way more than it did. They have managed to create a balanced game where if you think ahead you wont leave it to luck winning can come from luck as it can come from skill and if you have the skill you can make the best out of a sticky situation and reverse everything with a simple smoke grenade that draws their attention somewhere else ! The closing circle adds just enough of a randomised element to make it interesting and to change up almost every game you drop into. The only complaint i have is related to something that has no effect on gameplay Battle points the ingame currency are pretty much useless it is frustrating to let us buy crates but then require real money to buy keys that then open the crates. Other than that its an all around good game and i have yet to get bored of it after 300 hours of playtime! As a warning it is a fairly difficult game it can take months to get a win as you're facing against 99 other people! but when you win for the first time alone or with teammates it makes every other loss absolutely worth it.PS Play with Friends or search for teammates on a group finder it becomes a completely different ballgame !

review: Played this game a lot since it first came out. Always needed fixing. Patches came out every fkn week but seemed to break more things that it fixed. Major desync issue now updated and mostly fixed. Lag spikes when you encounter enemys still not fixed to this day Sound is still a bit fky (water too noisy direction of plane sound is STILL off footsteps seem to be fixed though) WHY WAS CHAT TAKEN OUT OF THE LOBBY?! SMFH When throwing items why cannot change the direction of the throw mid throw? thats stupid. Hackers still prevelant in games how has this not been fixed and how do these people keep getting multipl accounts? STILL seeing issues with headshots not registering Why do you put in challeneges that make people go out of their way to drive 500km that is ridiculous. Your map is 8X8 and you expect people to drive 500 KM?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!? Maybe you should make challenges that actually make sense for the game types you have available. Why do you give an arctic gun camo for a gun that isnt even on the arctic map?! Who makes these decisions? their team should be fired. Little stuff like that that makes no fkn sense to a regular player

review: i have 2000 hours on record (test &amp experimental server included) so you can assume I know what i'm talking about. Graphics You forget what reality is Beautiful Good Decent (for the 2d pixelated niche) Bad Don t look too long at it Paint.exe Gameplay AWESOME Good It s just gameplay Mehh Starring at walls is better Just don t Audio Eargasm Very good Good Not too bad Bad Earrape Audience Kids Teens Adults Human PC Requirements Check if you can run paint Potato Decent Fast Rich boiiiiii Ask NASA if they have a spare computer Difficulity Just press A Easy Significant brain usage Easy to learn / Hard to master Difficult Very difficult Dark Souls Grind Nothing to grind Only if u care about leaderboards/ranks Isnt necessary to progress Average grind level Too much grind You ll need a second live for grinding Story Story? Text or Audio floating around Average Good Lovely It ll replace your life Game Time Long enough for a cup of coffee Short Average Long To infinity and beyond Price It s free! Worth the price If u have some spare money left (better try to get a discount) Not recommended You could also just burn your money Bugs Never heard of Minor bugs Can get annoying PUBG (this says a lot) The game itself is a big terrarium for bugsYes after 2 years this game still has a ton of bugs bad audio and graphics. I don't really know why I still play this game to be completely honest. Not sure if anyone is going to buy this game now but if anybody is I'll tell you what i know. This game is very unique in good and bad ways. the devs not very involved with the community (not on youtube rewind level though) but that doesn't matter that much. You can play this game on and on untill you rage quit because of DeSync. I would recommend the game for new players if you have money spare but you should know there's no good ranked matchmaking system (yet?) so you're going to die to a lot to veretans. I don't think another BR like fortnite or cod can replace this game though the gameplay and gun mechanics really are unique and beautiful. Decide for yourself I hope I helped.

review: everything about this game is perfect...minus the fact that there are 4 different anti cheats and the game is still plagued by cheaters.minus the removal of region based match making and now it's "ping based" but you'll swear you're matching into AS servers.minus being able to actually trade marketplace items. That was locked months ago and they've been as transparent as they can be that the lock is never being liftedminus being a refined shooter like pretty much every other battle royale* (*excluding FtW) experience.minus the clunky controls that make you wonder if your avatar is a drunkard.minus the graphics that yesterday my mom gave me a look of "what the fuq?" when i told her this game is "next gen" and my mom knows nothing about graphics. and my mom knew how bad it looked. what the fuq?but perks the parachuting system is really cool now you can now parachute upwards!oh and we've got some really cool new and "free" skins in the vikendi survivor pass* (*premium)as long as you understand the game is still in beta even though they released the official 1.0 months to justify removing the 10% discount they were selling it for during "early access" PTLDR If you haven't played in a while now's the time to check it out while reverse engineers are dabbling with the new anti cheat that has been released. In a few weeks cheat software will be more sophisticated w/ subterfuge with the new anti cheat and the quick bans we're seeing will go away and the tug of war battle between anti cheat and cheat will resume.On the bright side numerous Chinese / Korean / NA "Pro" Players in both FPP &amp TPP have been banhammered. But in a game where cheating is so rampant that you're often wondering whether or not you died "fairly " in a game that is sadly dominated by a country where cheating is happenstance and accepted practice where a company named blueballs decided to merge all regions because region locking was seen as xenophobic there's just better games to play. Like you'll have more fun playing blackout. And I hate call of duty. And I don't even own blackout.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: MUST DO LISTPlease improve optimization.Please improve hacking ban wave efficiency. (some hackers won't even let us report them our death can is we dying not him killing us)Please fix game bugs.NICE THINGS LISTPlease add a shooting range where we can practice our shooting skills.Add matchmaking for all events. (Customs will do AND YOU GUYS DID IT THANKS)In custom games allow any number of players so we can challenge friends.(without that excuse of low amount of players to play that mode there always will be someone wanting to play that try considering the low amount of players with dev's lack of improving the game the way the community wants not saying to make the exactly like we want but listen to some complaints.)Return options to play with rain/fog it had the ability of changing TOTALLY the playstyle for exemple in FOG I would always prefer to play with a VSS than with a kar98.THANK YOU FOR Events.Optimizations (My pc used to run it in 40fps now it runs on 60)Some hack ban (not nearly enough but we did see some change)New maps.New guns.New attachments.New vehicles.Balance changes with the god M416.M24 spawning in the world (now I'm not dissapointed finding it in the crate AWM 20 bullets is more than enough)DMR and AR silencer compensator and flash hider are "all the same".Custom Games for all ( I LOVED THAT)And so much more that we are grateful for.Reason I'm writing this big as$ review.I want PUBG do THRIVE but you guys NEED to listen to us and pay attencion to our requests 34% positive reviews SERIOUSLY? I love PUBG but the way this is going.. maybe people won't like it anymore and we wont play it. You devs have a HUGE competition FORTNITE REALM ROYALE TABG ISLANDS OF NYNE ( H1N1 and so on... We love PUBG but please don't let it die.If you bothered reading everything leave a like and hope the devs will read it and listen leave a comment with new improving methods and your opinions. It's with sadness that I leave a "No" to the question "Do you recommend this game?" Hope to change it real soon &lt 3Edit You guys are listening to the community and tha game is improving. Sanhok performance issues remember this one.

review: I used to love this game a lot. It had intense close quaters combat a variety of well balanced weapons vehicles were fun to drive around in and overall playing with friends were fun. However now it's turned into a hunk of cash grabbing junk focusing more on skins than the game itself while I do like them I hate how they focus on it more rather than the game itself. I tried to play about a month ago and nothing has changed hackers are as abundant as ever and they've even region locked us. The path this game has taken is truly disappointing this game is no longer worth it's price. Come back another time buddy.

review: This is one of the few early access games that i did not regret buying YAY. Nevertheless here are some things you can expect 1. Ear in the plane at game start2. Holding down W + SHIFT so much they might as well rename this game to running simulator the devs even thought of that and included a auto run function. THANK GOD3. Toasting laptop up to a point where even the keyboard is pain to touch4. Oh wait you got a desktop? A friendly benchmark 300 Fps in CSGO &lt 60 fps in PUBG5. Turning your sound to max to hear those tasty footsteps then getting jump scared by a camper with a shotgun6. Highly addictive game no gf/bf7. Cheaters/glitch exploiters as this game is in development8. Winning that chicken dinner is literally as satisfying as eating one9. CHINA NUMBER 1!10. 中国人在中点跳!11. Squinting your eyes to see the small pixel of enemy miles away12. Sound is messed up. Gunfire from the front sounds like from the back. LOGIC? MY EARS ARE AT MY BUTT13. Most of the time you won't be able to see who's firing at you until you dieded14. You have 2 choices. First deploy in a highly populated areas like huge villages with lots of weapons drops but get killed as soon as the firefight starts. Alternatively deploy in a secluded area and get loot to be taken out later by other players with better drops. Both are equally fun15. If you have friends better co ordinate your deaths because either one of you died too early and get to watch for the next hour while your friend TRIES desperately to get 1st but never does.16. Oh i found AKM with no ammo...17. FINALLY ammo *tries shooting at some random guy a mile away and miss every shot because you have no sights*18. Pray your weapon drop is not a crossbow. 19. Tries to be a camper and listen for footsteps like a horror show ready to jump scare you at every moment20. Still remember H1Z1? Nah no one does21. Got in a room? Get teleported out of the room because lag says so22. Praying your pioneer crate drops a coat and not some rotten shirt that is worth 10 centsIn short PUBG is a fun game. 11/10 would smash again

review: Ah Pubg what can I say I loved you I had faith in you and you disapointed me again and again. I feel like a father who watched his son slip out of his grasp. I've been playing pubg for over a year. And last month I finally decided to uninstall the game after months of not playing it. There is too much broken in the game for me to enjoy it now and not only that its lost its appeal. I spent a long time hoping things would get better and they didnt. The most fun I had from this game with playing with friends aside from that i found i almost never touched the thing. I had no interest in it if I wasn't playing with other people. My true love for this game is not from the game itself but from how it brought my friends and I together how we would laugh and rage at the broken vehicle physics the phrase "we are proud of our vehicle physics" which was said by one of the top dogs of Bluehole became a meme within my friends because the vehicle phsyics is absolute It feels like playing with a hotwheels car theres no weight to it. We would spend entire games looting have amazing equipment just to lose it all from a headshot from a guy with a Kar98 across the map. While that risking it all is a part of what makes the game fun its not fun when you get killed by t reasons. Such as the fact that people recieve data differently than you do i could be getting shot move behind cover and still get killed because on the enemies screen I was still visible. Thats not due to me lagging its not due to him lagging its due to us recieving and sending information at different times which is entirely pubgs fault. Why is that a thing in a competitive game with Esports? Why did it take months for vaulting to be released Pubg? Why is there server wide lag where everone on the map freezes? Why is there so much broken in a game I payed $36 dollars for a year after I bought it? And dont get me wrong they do fix stuff frequently small stuff but the most important things to fix take or took way to long. If you read up until this point just play Ring of Elysium its free and its much better than PUBG ever hopes to be.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is a perfect example of how a great idea can be ruined by a bad development team. The game is so buggy its sometimes not even worth playing.I also fail to understand how the company responsible for this disaster (bluehole) is unable to employ competent developers to fix this issue. I mean it is the second best selling pc game of all time so it surely can't be financial constraints??Further to the above its also very badly optimized. You basically need 4 x 1080 Ti's in SLI along with 64GB ram &amp a bucket of ice to run this game on high graphics. You will probably end up overheating your graphics card if you run a mid spec 1060 or AMD 570.Anyhow avoid this game to avoid dissapointments!!

review: This is the third time I'm writing a review for this game. The first two times were positive I praised the game for it's mechanics but criticized it for the optimisation.My last review was after 1.0Now the game is pure trash. Hit detection is off almost every time. Optimisation only becomes worse after every patch. Devs work more on cosmetics than on the game (the cosmetics still look like trash. Minimal art that can be done by a child). Now there's a battle pass esque event pass which is clearly ripped off fortnite. Funny thing is bluehole is still sueing epic games (LOL).I don't know how they managed to make the world's most played game and managed to bring it to such a pathetic state. Says a lot about the devs. They were actually considering releasing paid DLC? What a joke! I really like this game. A lot of us do. So please fix it and give the players what we want. Spend resources on the right things.How does a game keep getting worse?
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game used to be my go to game when I wanted to play with friends. Lately though it has been evident that the developer is more concerned with microtransactions than actually making the game better. I don't have anything against microtransactions but I do think the game should be free to play at this point with the way they are handling it. Also even though they had their FIX PUBG campaign it feels like the game hasn't improved enough to be considered fixed. Blackout is a much better alternative at this point in my opinion.

review: I've been playing PUBG since it was still in early access and I can tell you the following things it's better that it's competitor you know the childish battle royale game with unnecessary Minecraft elements that begins with the letter F. it's great when playing with friends however not so much with random people. the game after how long it's been around still suffers from some technical issues they've released new content updates on a daily basis but still haven't completely fixed a lot of those issues although it doesn't render the game unplayable just lame at this stage seriously devs... the game is plagued with cheaters I've been killed while inside a window less bathroom by a guy inside a house at the other end of the map again developers don't seem to do much for this problem even with the game having an "Anticheat" app buildt into the game.I'm not saying don't buy it or not to play it but I am expressing the bad things that I'd wish would finally get fixed.

review: Edit AND... The "Fix PUBG" campaign has officially come to a close... Along with everybody's hope of this ever becoming a truly fixed game. What an absolute waste of potential. Instead of actually contributing anything to improve the gameplay it takes Bluehole almost a month to add sponsored DC "Joker and Harley Quinn" skins Halloween skins and a Twitch Prime AK skin. Fantastic work devs. You really stand against the competition... And by the way the two DC skins cost $45. Not even The Witcher 3 costs that much!! If that doesn't blatantly scream greed then I don't know what does...

review: I have a mixed relationship with this game. When PUBG was launched it was one of my favouite games and I accumulated hundreds of hours on it. However this game has turned for the worst. Let me elaborate. Servers This is by far the biggest problem with PUBG right now at least for me (keep in mind I play on OCE). If you are connecting from anywhere in OCE region lock will not work at most times of the day. I will be placed in an asian or american server every game unless for some reason I am playing TPP squads at around 5 30pm. Any other gamemode or perspective will route you to an asia or american server resulting with high ping. Fixing this issue will make this game MUCH more enjoyable for players from this region. Bugs This game is riddled with bugs. One of the more annoying bugs occurs when the player jumps out of the left side of the plane causing the player's perspective to jolt foward which is severely annoying. Gameplay Gameplay is what redeems PUBG for me. It is incredibly addictive for competitive players. Ignoring the bugs high ping and other problems gameplay is definitely the strongest assest to PUBG. Weapons and attachments are farily balanced and the situation with the bugginess of cars has improved.Hackers Being from OCE I rarely come across blatant hackers even when playing on asian and american servers. However when I do and I report them they are usually banned within a few days. What is more questioning is the severity of the ban. I was once killed by a player who was blatantly wall hacking and aimbotting and I reported them. They were banned but for only a day. Questioning slightly I let it slide as it may be the first time he was banned. However a few days later I was killed by the same cheater and reported him a second time. He was banned yet for only a day again. PUBG needs to add long bans if they want the cheating situation to improve.Overall I would recommend this game if the problems with it were rectified and you don't play on OCE until the servers are fixed. While the problems with it are infuriating the gameplay it offers in my opinion the competitive intense gameplay make up for it. If Bluehole actually fixed these issues the game would be back on track.

review: This game is so good the only problem that it has other than the accasional hacker which ive run into none of 29 hours in is the OPTIMISATION The optimisation really holds it back from defeating all other battle royal's out there Is there Desync? Yes. Is it that bad HELL NO CS GO has desync issues anyone complaining about it from the start of 2019 is either salty or has 300 ping Speaking of ping there are servers in North America. So with that said here are some questions that are generaly asked.Is this game Poorly Optimized? YesIs this game good? Fun good full of learning curves and Skill caps.Is it broken in any way? Loading times and Voice chat are currently broken Vehicles are still a "little" glitchy too.Who is this game intended for? Skilled First Person Player's or Third Person Player's How ever everyone can play it and get good at it.P.S. I learded how to Lurk in this game and its really fun so I do it a lot!Is it better than Fortnite and Ring Of Elysium? No HOWEVER It will be when (Very hopefull when) Its optimized... Other than that The gameplay Thrill and lurning curves are still higher then the other BR's.Personal Note Have a Very Very buff PC if you intend to play this game casualy Have a nice day!

review: i like how they recently worked on the game to help keep their player base. I like the winter map. I like the graphics actually even. Driving is ehh. Gun sounds are great. Biggest issue is making the game smoothe. The game itself is simply not smooth in regards to Transitions Running to shooting Jumping larger jumps windown climps and some shooting. It is simply delayed. When I see someone I want to shoot immediately but the game has to change animations and there is a delay in that. It is the iest part of the game in whole. Again I am impressed in their effort to revamp the game but it still has the core buggy issues. People will end up getting fustrated. And as for the fortnite copy of a battle pass that is ok but we paid for pubG. We didnt pay for fortnite. I do like how the revamped landing after parachuting. That is smoother for sure. I want this game to work. BUT THE CLOGGY SLOWNESS is messing that up.
