review: Possibly the most addictive experience in my 30+ years as a gamer (started on the Atari 2600 time flies! sigh ). This game WILL make your pulse race. It WILL create memories both fond and cringeworthy that will haunt you every time you revisit where they occurred. Victory in PUBG 'tastes' better (pun intended) than any other game for two reasons 1) Death is only an unnoticed/unheard/unanticipated action away and 2) The odds are just plain long 90 100 to 1 depending on how full the server is. Besting 90 other tenacious humans in ANY endeavor is a feat let alone in a kill or be killed unforgiving environment such as PUBG. Whether you go out in flames in the first 45 seconds or hide in a bathroom for 30 minutes you want to come back for more. You come back for the variety the novetly the comaraderie and the peril.Sadly all of this vibrancy and potential enjoyment are completely and utterly RUINED by the sheer number of hackers that have invaded this game. It happened once before and subsided but this last week has shown that they're back and they're worse than ever. It used to be an aimbot needed line of sight. Not anymore! Walls floors even mountains are no longer capable of offering protection.I love the Replay functionality of this game. It's smooth easy to use and downright cinematic. But using the Replay round after round to relive hackers skillessly rubbing you out when you hit that all important Top 10 is equal parts vindication and rage inducing keyboard bashing frustration.I almost never write reviews and to all those developers whose incredible work deserved my praise over the years I apologize. To Bluehole you jolted me out of my apathy to write this not by what you've done but by what you haven't FIGURE OUT HOW TO GET THIS HACKING UNDER CONTROL. There is no excuse for a game that is out of early access and that has this much funding to be going backwards. And while you're at it keep working on the netcode. You freely admit in your promo video that you have "2 billion" hours of gameplay data. Please use it. Don't have the in house capability to do that? Go buy the capability with a small fraction of the 500 million dollars in revenue you've taken in.I love this game and want to continue to play it but right now it's just not worth it. You really need to go back into early access. For those considering dropping your cash...be sure you know what you're buying.I will gladly amend this review if Bluehole steps up and addresses the hacking in an effective and lasting way.UPDATE One year later and I can now endorse this game. The new map Vikendi is varied in its architecture and locations enough to finally feel like someone put some love into the map rather than randomly assigning the same 16 barebones buildings to loosely inhabitable clusters. The cheating is still present but it has become more and more rare over the last 12 months. And as an added bonus you now learn the fate of those you report (four bans and counting baby! Yeah!). The game seems less buggy though crashes do still happen more frequently than in other games. Especially during that critical time between load in and the plane ride. Of course a good sense of humor from your squad and these crashes can add an element of dynamism to the beginning of a round forcing you off course and often to ride to the "end of the line" to ensure the relogging player is "back." Either way PUBG is still alive. It's still exhilarating and no doubt will continue to soak up free time around the world...

Its the worst assault rifle in the game im not even picking it up most of the time. Better go with UZI or something.EDIT After Vikendi patch game is unplayable for me. I even have better GPU now that runs game around 90 100 fps but stuttering is terrible especially at beginning of the game. Sometimes textures wont load every 2 games i crash to desktop and those loading times. Every game loading time is so long. I can hear plane flying i can head myself dropped out of plane and im still in loading screen. This is a big no from me.

review: dev's priorities are as follows. 10 20 dollars skins 5 dollars parachute etc... constant updates that don't fix anything. game size is growing out of control. trade locked items so Steam gets to keep the monopoly of buying/selling in game items. invisible walls when driving. game crashes during loading. game crashes during lobby. game crashes when joining a friend's lobby. game crashes when inviting people. fall damage when walking down a mountain lazy game programming physics. constantly restart lobby and when game loads you get a black screen. camera lock. you have to press ALT button to move around due to crappy programming game is laggy/frame drop when near people. CHINA NUMBA WAANNNNNNNN who for some ing reason plays on NA server rather then Asia servers... game dev's still haven't region lock to avoid this issue community been asking for this since beta started.things they need to do. remove the stupid useless emotes no one ever uses. adjust loot to where you don't get three lvl 3 armor in the same house and four houses later no helmet or weapons just attachments. fix the spawn location for ammo/gun at times you get 30 rounds of 556 or 762 without the weapon WTF? fix this crap. stop with the different keys so you can charge 2.50 per key for crates have you no shame? really this was a very greedy move. do something about hackers who use a full auto SKS or auto aim/no recoil. do your job as a developer.

review: This game was great especially in recent times before the Vikendi map update. Cheaters had been mostly dealt with finally and things were good finally the optimisations were actually beginning to be noticeable even one maybe two!! of the players suggestions had been implemented. HoweverRecent update with the new map has I dont understand how but a big drop is game performance client and server side it appears. 3rd person point of view has altered and kinda seems to look from a closer but higher perspective making peeking easier especially prone. The stupid sounds when in your backpack are new and bad ( click click click ) the wind sounds when parachuting are buggy the general wind is again buggy comes and goes sometimes all sound drops out for a few seconds. textures are softer and weird moving side to side or looking side to side is delayed and just weird 6X scope is even slower than before look the changes are small but NUMEROUS and achieved nothing but detracting from a state the game only recently got to which was FINALLY alright. If you have never played the game you could give it a try as you would not know what was and the downgrade now its still a okay game but like many developers they seem to be on their own path which is not close to the majority of the customers/clients.Overall I have to not recommend this game.

review: If you want to take your battle royale experience seriously and try hard to the max then this game is for you. For me who is quite competitive I love this over Fortnite Black Ops 4 Blackout and any other BR I've played. The developers love this game and are still pushing hard. Maps are good in size equipment variety is huge and overall the gameplay mechanics have evolved and only gotten smoother in recent times.Only downside is not many people play this over here in Australia so its hard to get a game locally.8/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has literally become more rehash than it has before still the same errors and leaks. More rinse repeat than other battle royales with the updates. This game itself is great a lot of replayability Even if you play without a mic.Many times however you will run into those people that simply have their own agenda and do their own thing however more often than not you do have players working together (I mainly que for squadron). The only true problem of this game is it's horrible horrible optimization and memory leaks. Running a GTX 980 8GB Ram an I7 2600K CPU 3.40GHzand this game STILL LAGS. Playing at the lowest setting 'Network Lag' is still a thing even though my machine and internet are well over the capability of playing this game (Not to mention I use an Ethernet cord).One of the biggest problems with this is the 'Network Lag' problem due to poor optimization (Though its probably optimized that way due to how the games mechanics work) and the fact that buildings DO NOT LOAD most every time for 1 2 minutes or more. This has only gotten me killed twice but the problem still stands that you will get a late start and maybe even die since you cannot enter the buildings until they've loaded.Overall the game is highly replayable fun and challenging though the only true downside is the ability to switch from third person to first person it would be far more challenging in first person.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

The squad based fireplay was fun albeit buggy at times. But the whole experience seemd new and undiluted. Then we started seeing hackers bluehole began to focus on content rather than optimization and the whole experience changed. Hackers are ruining this game. If there was one thing that threatens the bluehole executives and their riches its these parasites. This game is already in decline (look at the reviews) and if this isn't fixed fast the game will be a funny memory we all laugh about by 2020. FIX IT NOW OR FOREVER BE BANKRUPT!!!!

review: Product received for free. Ok this may seem confusing to people. Especially fanboys of the game but I do not recommend PubG.A few hundred hours (even from a free game people should say that its worth the cost) into the game and its getting worse.First it was the optimisation. Then it was the influx of hackers (id say its 10% of what it was and that much has improved)Nmow its the inability to get FPP games because of the horde...and I mean HORDE of asian based players playing TPP because Bluehole hasnt got enough servers based in asia to let them play there.TPP is thrid person perspective... which basically means you have 0 skill and rely on being able to look through walls and around corners .The developers are destroying the game that showed so much promise because their biggest market (China) prefers certain modes and they lack any general care when making development changes to the game.All in all..Conceptually 9/10 but execution lets it downReality 4/10 at best.Sound 6/10Graphics 6/10 (but since every player plays with graphics set to low with high textures to combat server lag)Community (have to include this as I think this is where all the LoL players have found a home since getting out of primary school)Other issues like OCeanic server lag bullet drops hit box shambles pretty much only 1 gun combo that wins hackers that they seem unable to get rid of aboility to team up with other people in game very poor reporting system and completely unwise changes to the blue wall system which will only get worse as they try and keep players from flooding to the free fortnight version (which is also jsut as bad if not worse).IMO get outside and do something else.Will I continue to play it? Probably. Only because I have no life and the attention span of a.Check in Jan 2019. Game has gone to Bluehole are about as smart as smashed crabs. TPP is full of 6 year old kids playing with thier feet. And FPP has no Oceanic server.. GeeGee

review: So finally out of early access and also the FIX PUBG thing is over. And the game still has few bugs. The game looks quite different from what it was before. Looks even more serious. The weapons are better. Most realistic Battle Royale game with massive player base. There are so many crates now and skins it's terrible but well can't say much about it as people will keep buying those... anyway... Ya new snow map. Good stuff not particularly a noob friendly game anymore. Needs more Optimizations. Doors gets bugged sometimes. Most of it is server side issue i guess. When i see it as a game its good but when i see the BR catagory i kinda go nuts ... i mean people are playing this all day and some only play BR games or only 1 BR game. Come on now there are so many games not competitive but games you can just enjoy ... great stories creative stuff just something different. There is no progression in these games. Just your skin inventroy and your stats (if you are good). *am not saying you cannot enjoy competitive games am just saying try other games also* Not hating these games but just requesting people to take a break in a while.

review: Just the worst shooting game ive ever played... the only reason i play it is to make bp and get crates. But even that is hard and stressful casue of the poorly optimized game play... and dont get me started on hackers i mean you have a better chance of winning the lottery than NOT running into one... 3/18/2018 i just got my first "rare" item from a crate and i've been playing the game since last July so 7/01/2017... yea... i've been opening crates every week since then and i just got my first rare item (teal color which is 1 more rarity than common or grey color) yea dont know what to think other than its rigged i mean am i suppose to believe that i have just the worst luck in the world opening these crates and everyone else that i see in spawn running around with $100 masks or $50 coats have better luck or that everyone one who has those items actually bought them for $100? That is just for one piece not to mention everything else they are wearing $10 glasses $5 shoes $20 hat i mean you would think that i should get a rare item with more than 100+ openings or am i wrong? I dont like bashing games but im just saying the experiences i have and my thoughts about them...The game has gone under some changes and updates from my first review but still is the worst gun game ive ever played... i dont know what to say i wanna like it but every game that i play on it it just sucks for example i just played a match before writing this review and i head shot a guy with a lvl 2 helmet with a kar i had an 8x scope and he was standing still trying to snipe another guy... i dont know how i can miss but i dont some how???...8x from 50 meeters his whole body is in the scope... he runs off cause he knows im trying to snipe him now a little later he come back and im ready for him and we both shot each other in the head same time but you can guess that that is not what happend. It should have been a trade but nope...i die and he is untouched. I look back in the "replay" and see that the first time i shot him in the head i really shot him in the arm funny i didn't even hit him in the real game my shot just went right by his head and didn't see any blood. The 2nd time i shot him we both shot at the same time in the replay you couldn't tell which one shot first we both did but in the end i die and he is untouched...i dont know what to say. Another example I have a really mind blowing clip saved i doesn't make any sense. This guys 3 shot kills me with a micro uzi no head shots! 1 shot in the leg and 2 in the chest from the "replay". What!? Like i said this game is just to worst nothing has changed im a very competative person i have been #44 in the US in the leaderboards "could be higher if the game improves like a lot..." so i am NO noob to the game i have played a lot of other gun games out there and by far this is the worst i would even go and say that it isn't a gun game... its a "wanna be" first person or third person shooting game... its a luck game to be honest the game has control over everything not you no matter how skilled you are...4/16/28 Just played pubg on the moblie phone and i've got to say it is what the pc version should of been. Why pubg why... why it the moblie version better in like... everything than the pc. Its better optimized game play and gun play unfortunately is better i mean like when i shoot people scoped in on the moblie version it hits and does damage bullets go where i aim what can i say...The moblie version also has login rewards free bp and items just for logging in! and while on the subject of "free" i believe the moblie version is free to play. All i can say to this is "how can this be pubg?"1/11/2019Still is the worst game ever invented the idea of "Battle Royal" or "King of the hill" now adays is found everywhere. Eer game has their own little version of it. And sad to say their versions are better than this games poor potrail. Nothing has been improved its been a couple of years now and it is still the same crapy game that it is ever since early access. Nothing has been done with the game mechanics optimization d sync even the crate drops they are still rigged for me... big sigh...

review: This game is polished (for the most part) and if you're merely looking for a "battle royale" this a great game for you. I've had conflicting oppinions of this game the gameplay itself is fun but not satisfying enough. Personally I'm not too much of a fan of battle royale and the devs are not exactly what I call great. They kind of killed the mood for me over development. For instance when their servers were over loaded with people hacking and exploting the game. The initial response from the devs was that the issue was already taken care of when it wasn't and they proceeded to tell their customers that they were wrong instead of listening and take care of the issue professionally. Now that's just a bit of a nit pick. The real issue from the devs and the company itself was how they were viewing the exclusivity of "their" genre. They proceeded to push law suits against epic games for copying their game which is entirely t but they did it anyways. The irony is that a couple months later they integrate the same type of battle pass fortnite has now if that's not hypocrisy I don't know what is.

review: Overall great game. Great audio mechanics and gun mechanics (Recoil Sound Bullet drop etc...) But there is some major and minor probloms that should be fixed or balenced. Such as some gun mechanics in SOME weapons. Such as the Kriss Vector and the UMP9 the Kriss Vector has an insane fire rate but does not have a good Fire Rate/Damage Ratio. You can beam someone from around 50 meters with it and still eliminate them with full level three or two armor. The UMP9 has a slower fire rate but much higher damage output which can put you at a disadvantage. But can also help you in the more close encounter maps such as Sanhok or Vekendi Im pretty sure the devs implimented this in the last Patch #24 because when i drop ANY area in Vekendi i always only find ethier a Tommy gun Micro Uzi or a Kriss Vector. which is good for that map but not so much for Erangel or Miramar. But every thing else is very well managed and is very balanced such as snipers and assault rifles. Thank you PUBG devs for creating an amazing game and i have always be on your side since the begining. Love "WinkKiwi"

review: I said it before that if the game changes then I'll change my opinion. The game did change and if you are into BR games it's somewhat safe to buy it there is enought content to keep you intrested for a decent amount of time but damn was it a bumpy ride to get to this point. Just stay away from loot boxes and you'll be fine better way to get items is to get a leveling season pass it's not the best but a better way that to rely on random loot boxes with ridiculus random chance to get anything good. TL DR At this point it's just a cash grab DO NOT BUY. TL DR Looks like i jumped on 1.0 too much I would still not recomend this. They focus more on money then on getting the game to 100% lag is still a major issue and i have this feeling that after two or three optimalization patches they just stopped working. TL DR After the 1.0 lunch i can finally recomend the game there has been a lot of optimalization done so it's actally playable there are some "rubberbanding" lag issues but nothing too serious. TL DR Game runs like and it's quite buggy wait till they adress this preoblem before buy but If your PC can handle it then it can be fun.After 130 hours and after watching and waiting for some siginificant optimalization or bug fixing update i must say don't buy wait and see if they will "finish" this game. I'm not talking about more maps or guns i mean the actuall FINISHED GAME something that more guns and maps won't fix. The biggest offender here is optimalization and performance i can't stretch that enough to describe how bad this game runs. From random frame drops at any time to 1FPS(i'm not kidding) while landing there are dozens of games on Unreal engine that look way better than this and they run like the smothest butter you can imagine but it's not one of those. I know i'm on the low end of PC specs but i've played better looking and bigger games with less issues.But if you have a machine that can handle this pice rought bulder then i can say iit's rally fun.

review: I have a love/hate relationship with this game. And I could write pages about why it's good/bad.But for the sake of everyone's sanity + It's Good even Great WITH FRIENDS messing about even getting some good coordination IS fun.+ Core gameplay is basically all there.+ Map variation is pretty good now.+ Haven't come across a hacker in a while now. Performance is still very temperamental no matter your hardware. Visuals still suck. It feels like very little has been achieved in these departments. The cosmetic system while completely unnecesary for game play is getting more and more heavily monetised by the day. Whilst the core gameplay is mostly there it continues to feel janky AS HELL in places.

review: Honestly I have mixed feelings about this game .. so far. As a new and noob player which only played the game for 3 hours and only solo matchmaking .. it's .. eh. It's a 100% disadvantage when you your own is new to the game. Sure you watched streams and video's about PUBG but well it's different when you play it yourself. At first thought you might find the game fun untill you die over and over again because well you suck at the game. You don't know how it works. You only can play with people who played the game months before you.First issue I had when getting into multiplayer for the first time wtf are these controls. The controls are set default to QWERTY but too bad i have an AZERTY keyboard lmao.I had to play 3 solo sessions before i got my controls right so yeah at start just landing somewhere moving around editing the settings in general and the controls untill u get killed cuz you're not ready to play yet. Well ok there's no option to play offline or so so you just queue up for another solo session and in you go. And repeat the process. Good now the controls are good you go matchmaking again. Yay you got your first kill with some loot you randomly picked up cuz you panicked as you heard shots and footsteps around you. Then you think what weapon is this what the is this recoil boom i get killed cuz the other player. Right okay weapons in this game have recoil like in CSGO but what kind .. how to practice each weapon and see their recoil and how they shoot? Eh you guessed it right matchmaking only and dieing over and over. Ok you got the hang of it about the loot and weapons. haHA there's much loot what fits on my weapon and what does not? Hello? Anyway when you first land you need to get a weapon asap or you wont have a chance there's much chance this will happen cuz someone else landed faster than yo oh wait no I edited those controls so that's fine .. they still land faster somehow. Boom ded to the lobby you go try again. Then the first glitch I encountered is the loading screen I've had the situation where you see the loading screen but you hear you're in the world already you hear the planing flying and after a while you hear you get ejected. BUT THE DAMN LOADING SCREEN IS STILL THERE. HEY GAME I HEAR ITS LOADED JUST LET ME SEE IT. Anyway I don't think this is crucial unless you count that you're in the middle of nowhere when the loading screen FINALLY dissapears. The maps are .. okay ish? It's open world god damn it you need to check EVERY BUILDING AND CORNER or you get killed from behind cuz you are stepping around like an elephant. Also did i told you i got killed by the second guy because i was looting the first? haha you gotta count on that too. There's a lot you need to think about when play the game and as a new player this isn't so easy. So what did we learn? Don't play solo Play with friends in a squad Learn how to play the damn game because it's easy to learn but hard to master just like CSGO i guessI can't even tell if this is a review I just recommend the game cuz at one point u accept your faith. And well there are moments when you don't die immeidately and you actually can kill some people! WOO. Best i had was top 5. Then it really gets fun

review: Fun in theory but it has so many problems that make it a garbage game for newer players. The tremendous wait times in between games (usually around 2 minutes) makes it very annoying to get back into the action especially if you're dropping popular places to try to gain experience. It is incredibly obnoxious waiting 2 minutes for the next game after dying in the first 30 seconds. The next thing is desynchs. I'm constantly getting cheesed out by players shooting and killing me before they're even into view (FPP) and it really adds salt to the wound when I'm waiting 2 minutes in between games. It's like playing Call of Duty except with 2 minute respawn times. Another thing I have a problem with is the sound. While anyone can get used to it after enough exposure I feel like it's not natural in a way that makes sense to newer players. I find it difficult determining where the sounds are coming from (either gunshots or footsteps) and the HRTF sound setting doesn't make a difference (at least for my headphones). All in all the greatest disappointment for me is the wait times. I can deal with all the other issues if I can actually get into games fairly quickly. The sounds might be weird and the desynch might get me killed every once in a while but I would much rather be able to get back into a game after 30 seconds. I know that many people reading this review may think to themselves "You're just bad play and get good " and you're right but the problems I mentioned may be a big uninstall for a lot of newer players. Otherwise the game is alright even though it has a niche playstyle and gunplay. My suggestion would be to reduce the match start countdown from 1 minute to 10 20 seconds. Anyways have a nice day. )

review: PUBG has probably been one of the most successful battle royale games of all time. Sure fortnite is more popular but that's only because it's free. This game sure has quite a few glitches and it can be frustrating at times to die to somehing you have no control over i.e A motorcycle randomly flips when you're driving throwing you off and killing you... But however glitchy it is I still recommend it over fortnite. They actively try to fix all bugs in the game as well as improving gameplay for everyone! One issue I have is server stablity. There is nothing more frustrating than watching your death cam to reveal that you were behind a wall and the shots still landed and killed you. Especially early game when you hot drop to school military pecado or hacienda the lag is unbearable and needs to be addressed ASAP.And for a full release game it's quite a joke. The hackers and bugs are ridiculous and I seriously think this game has gone down the drain. They need to fix everything instead of suing people for similar ideas. Who cares if another battle royale is more popular than yours? Maybe fix your and that won't happen.3/10

review: Product received for free. Edited this review based on that you can no longer change your name with BP. I really WANT this game to be great but they keep doing scummy stuff. Make it so you can buy stuff with BP. You can't do anything with the stupid in game currency so why not just get rid of it and make everything in the store payed for with $$$$$$$$$$. I love the feel of the movement and gunplay in this game It really is a great shooter and really fun to play. You need a pretty beefy computer to get decent performance. Feels a lot better at 100+ FPS. However the business model the company is going for is horrible. You can't get anything for free besides the crappy cosmetics that you can get out of the only 3 or whatever crates that don't have locks on them. (you can't choose which crates you get either!) Loot keys should be 25 75 cents not $2.50. Especially when you have like a 1/150 chance of getting anything that doesn't look horrible. Absolutely outrageous. Only buy a season pass if you play a lot of hours. Only recommended if you don't care about cosmetics at all.

review: This game has had its fun moments. I've played a lot. This game is not as glitchy as people say it is. The problem with this game is the cheaters. 80% of the games I play I get killed by some loser who is either wall hacking or has no recoil(which is a big deal). 80% might even be me being nice. It is easy to spot since you have the death cam and the replays. People follow you through walls. This game used to be fun but its only getting worse. I'm sad to say since I used to like this game but don't get it. Not until they figure out how to control this. They ban people sure but with so many peolple that play there will never be a shortage of people. Not all of them are Chinese as people seem to say either. I'm sure there are a bunch of Westerners who are losers and suck at gaming so they cheat. Look elsewhere. Sadly this game is lost.

review: This game cheaters are still many most of them are perspective self targeting relying on players to report it does not have much effect. Unfortunately as an official there is no effective scheme to prevent cheating which makes the players very puzzled. For such a large company the development group is at a loss to cheaters or cheating software which undoubtedly chills the majority of normal players and then loses confidence in the game.Suggestions for games 1. Strengthen the crackdown on cheating implement the measures of compulsory scanning of computer running software optimize the game environment and take measures to ensure the fairness of the game after the software is suggested to be shut down. 2. Implement a one month ban on hardware and a one month ban on the game once cheating is detected. 3. Develop game playability design many game checkpoints set the intelligent level of robots in the checkpoints and implement single or multi player key problem solving experience for players at different levels. The experience may include street warfare sniper fighting blasting and anti blasting search and elimination etc. In order to encourage more players to find fun in the game freedom to control at their heart and choose according to their abilities.

review: This is a title that's really hard to recommended. The game is but it can have enjoyable moments.If it's for like 10 bucks sometime in the future buy it but over 10 bucks it's not worth it.The shooting feels really bad it's not snappy responsive nor smooth. Being super realistic and slow doesn't work well in video games.RNG of loot can really mess you up if you are not lucky with loot you're in a bad spot.I mean I guess they wanted to go for realism but when there's someone shooting at you proned with a scoped rifle from 300m range you have no chance to spot him back and it makes you feel so bad.Driving physics are just silly.But on the bright side if you learn all the tricks of the game. Winning as a squad through good teamplay feels very satisfying. Do not play this game alone.

review: I've put more hours into this game than any game I have purchased.At one point I followed and read each and every update religiously.Once Bluehole started focusing on skins and trying to become like Fortnite the game instantly went to crap.From poorly optimized updates to games constantly crashing even glitches across the entire map.You name it it has probably happened in the world of PUBG. And now it is continously bad.The XBOX game shouldn't have even been made. And they're about to release their PS4 game ___ For all the hackers I have reported (and even sent in videos with no action being done) all the latency issues I have streamed on Twitch &amp all the last circle glitches....I really can't say the game is worth it. There are too many flaws that outweigh any good this game has to offer.The shocking part of it all!? IT WAS BETTER DURING PRE RELEASE! BEFORE 1.0 !!! Sad...It is now a (developers) sell out game just catering to people who will buy skins and DLCs.There isn't even a server on the West Coast of the U.S.GG

review: Boy oh Boy did i enjoy PUBG when it first came out. Now i can't bring myself to recommend it. First there's the horrible optimization that still is pretty bad depending on what your system is packing and how much graphic fidelity your willing to give up. Second comes the bugs that pop up after every update when one is fixed there's sure to be another. And Third and final point. Hackers theres been many a match where ill watch my kill cam and see ridiculous things like the persons driving right by me and his cursor isn't anywhere near me but his bullets somehow hit every shot that's fired. Or a person who can even see me cause of how far away he is from me and still manages a head shot when i can't even see myself on their screen. Theres to many different ones to list but until BlueHole gets their head out of their hole and finds a way to stop the madness then ill give this a recommendation but until then ill hold my breath and wait till I can enjoy this game again. 6 out of 10

review: So I heard a lot of bad things about this game like hacking glitching poor performace etc. Well how some of these are present like basically every single online game out there it isn't as bad as it seems. So basically I never found any hackers on pubg (yet) but i've haven't had this game for a month so idrk if it will ever happen. For glitching it only happened for me once in a vehicle (which I assume is the most glitchy thing in the game) but I got insta killed so it was kinda annoying. This game does have some lag spikes every know and then but thats probably me trying to run the game at some of the highest graphics with about 16 gigs and a AMD FX processor And for the graphics this game has phenomenon graphics I was excepting worse. The game consist of 2 game modes which is 3rd person and 1st person. With 4 maps (even thought some maps might be empty) This game has a lot of content to experince with all the different guns (even though people just pick the sks every time) So yeah this game is pretty good especially if you have some friends to play with you. I would recommend only if you're somewhat patient when it comes to this stuff cause you will die lots of time. So yeah 7/10 from me could use some improvements. (sorry if I repeat stuff.)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: For those of you looking to play the game and not just review hopping I will say one thing this game is not for the faint of heart. If you're an emotional nutcase then this game is not for you. If you don't want to see microtransactions then this game is not for you. If you don't want to be killed by an incredibly random way after sneaking around for 20 mins this game is not for you. If you complain about every little thing about every game this game is not for you. If you don't find this genre of game to be enjoyable then this game is not for you. If you rage quit at the drop of a dime constantly this game is not for you. More often than not if you play and love Fortnite this game is not for you (this statement isn't true all the time). If you have no sense of tactic or strategy if you mindlessly run and gun if you can't think critically if you aren't patient then this game IS NOT for you. There are a lot of reasons that this game is not for everyone just like every other game out there. I'm not gonna go play Barbie and write a crap review on it because I don't like it and whine like the 12 year old girl who actually plays it does I'm going to put it aside or better yet not buy the damn game in the first place. Many people on here do not like the game because of many of the reasons I've listed. Although the game does have bugs it does suffer from cheaters and it doesn't run optimally on a crap computer and from time to time does have issues especially with the constant content updates. What game doesn't? i'll tell you that I've ran into very minimal bugs in my 500+ hours. I've encountered a lot of potential hackers but the game has gotten better on that front. Case and point this game is difficult there is a huge learning curve when it comes to PUBG tactics and strategy and to say all that sometimes it doesn't even matter what you do or who you are because some person with 3 hours ingame who has never gotten a kill before and is camping one spot shivering in there boots might pop out of a door when you least expect it and end that 10 kill streak you've never been on. I'm tired of seeing people with 100+ hours giving crap reviews about how it's unplayable or how it's not improved and doesn't progress or it's dead. Those claims are false not to mention almost complelty illogical to say. The fact that you've played makes it playable it's clearly improved because otherwise a million people at a time wouldn't play it and theres been so many content updates and new maps that prove progression and like i said before evening times theres over 1 million people who play almost every night. So there are rebutles to all the over exaggerated claims. I'm not saying the game is perfect cause no game is. You'll die when you think you shouldn't of you'll get kills you thought you shouldn't have gotten you'll die in ways you never thought possible you'll dump a stupid amount of time into just looting and then die and give it to someone else. You'll think every person killing you is a hacker because you're soooooo good at games. You'll report more people in this game then any other game just because you hate that person more than you're ex girlfriend you'll watch every deathcam like you've developed a new religion and because deathcam is actually horrible you'll think the game is full of cheaters. There is always something to complain about when you look for it. There is nothing more satifying then getting a kill likewise there is nothing more annoying then providing someone with there first kill or dying as soon as you drop in lol. but it happens. Put your big boy or big girl shorts on and strap yourself in for a roller coaster of a ride because that's what this is. You can't buy wins here you can't instakill everything or plow through the game mindlessly like every other game and you won't be as good as your favorite youtuber. The game is fun and enjoyable. Sometimes it makes me wanna pull my hair out but I like the challenge and everytime the challenge is different and the situations always change. If you're up for a challenge and want to improve your pvp skills then i'd say take the dive into PUBG in my opinion the buy is worth it. Thank for reading and I hope this was helpful.

review: First of all this game is really fun once you put a couple of hours in. Gunplay and overall gameplay is fun and balanced for the most part. Aside from this being a really fun BR/Shooter there are a lot of issues with the game that ruin it. Desync and laggy servers. (Usually maintenance once or twice a week) Lots of bugs The game is badly optimized My pc specs meet the minimum requirements and it runs at about 60 frames at low/medium mix (2gb rx560 amd fx 6300). But there are people with 1080tis/other high end hardware that have low frames at all settings. My game still gets low fps in some areas where i can play other games (Hitman 2 Fallout 4 Just Cause 3 Rainbow Six Siege) at low/medium and sometimes even high and it never dips below 60fps. Probably the worst issue of all the audio mixing. Some sounds like glass breaking are ridiculously loud and will actually cause hearing problems. It puts you at a disadvantage too you either play at a quiet level while not being able to hear noises like cars driving by footsteps etc. Or you can play at an uncomfortable level where you can hear important sounds but every once in a while you'll hear the red zone or glass windows shattering and it will blast your ears. Microtransactions. There are 20$ outfits to buy in the store lots of loot boxes with insane drop rates (usually around less than 1% to get one of the rarest items) and 10$ royale passes. Fortnite can get away with this type of stuff because it's a free game. This game costs 30$ and usually around 20$ on sale it's dumb that they are putting this many microtransactions in a game thats almost full price. Most of the time the devs care more about getting money than fixing bugs/serious issues about the game.Overall i would not recommend this game until these problems get fixed. If you do buy the game and can manage to get around these problems you'll be fine and have an awesome experience.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game itself is great. Or the concept of it anyway. I've never been a fan of fortnite but holy at least Epic Games is not like Bluehole. They cannot help but to up PUBG. They refuse to region lock China despite the fact that 9/10 s are hacking. It takes them 10 ing gigabites to add a single goddamn pixel to the game. They update it every five ing minutes and they always do it during prime time (6pm 11pm). Their servers are complete But despite all of that dumb assery I still loved playing PUBG. It was the best game to play with friends for me. But the final straw was this last ing update. They took away the ability to attach the 8x scope to AR's. As soon as I saw this I uninstalled it. I would return the game to the steam market if I could. I'm ing done with Bluehole. YOU BLUEHOLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I don't get to play this game as much as I would like to but thankfully I have a fairly dedicated squad that's a blast to loot &amp shoot with. The game is excellent for it's shooting mechanics variety and effects. Now the downside optimization is moderate at best although this has improved tremendously in recent patches! There is absolutely 0 progression system implemented as yet only cosmetics from incredibly expensive loot crates. It would be fantastic to see this game implement some form of progression or at least achievements with associated rewards. All this said I'd rate Playerunkown battlegrounds a solid 7/10 simply based on its pace shooting mechanics play feel and variety of current cosmetics. A solid buy that won't dissapoint.Edit I've switched my review of PUBG to reflect a current massive influx of chinese hackers aimbots wallhacks see through wall no recoil speed hacking. The past week has been brutal leading to Third Person Perspective being all but unplayable. Until this is addressed I need to unrecommend this game. 4/10Edit 2 Game has been massively improved in recent months there are however still massive glitches and broken mechanics of all assortments. Purchase for a great amount of fun so long as you do not expect the game to always treat you fairly. 6/10

review: This will be the second time I've reviewed PUBG. The first time I reccommended it. It was a fun game slightly odd and buggy but a great game to play with friends. I've recently gone back and I can't say I reccommend it anymore. I am a very competitive player which means I believe that if I spend the time it takes to ensure I have every advantage going into a fight I should win it. However with PUBG there are always too many variables I can't control. Not being able to control the flow of a fight is frustrating. There's always an angle I didn't foresee something beyond my control. It's difficult to tell how many fights I've won because I had level three armor and the other guy didn't and vice versa. A competitive game a true esport should give the tools to the player and crown the one that uses them best the winner. It should not do what PUBG does by throwing everyone into a pit full of Legos and saying whoever can build the best stick to bludgeon the others with wins.

review: The game has had a lot of work done it is by no means perfect and there are still a lot of cheats in the game (mainly radar and wall hacks) that need to be addressed and things like the spawn rate of items on some maps needs a little tweaking but overall the game has been improved greatly.I still cannot believe that they do not know how to make a decent UI or a queueing system. It is either one map or all of them. Why I have very little interest in joining Sanhok if we are in a quick join queue we just leave that map so what is the point in your system give us an option to select the which maps we want to queue for any number not just a single one or all of them.A lot of my old review still stands so I will leave it attached. Past review (Negative) Deleted my old review most of the problems listed in it are still valid but as of the 23/06/2018 with the new SANHOK patch the game has taken a nose dive even worse than it was before but the main issue AGAIN is cheating.Over the past two weeks I have noticed a huge increase in the number of both aimbot/wall hack players and also bots playing hte game recent examples 1. In a game of duo's there was six bots working together in a town running around looting in pairs trios when one detected an enemy they moved towards that area. 2. Final circle with 4 people in game guy smokes himself and then ADS kills everyone else on the map from the smoke.3. Guy shooting with red dot from School to Appartments at people who are behind walls. When they move he shoots the walls and windows as they move. I believe this is a bot as when he moves forward and reaches the wall he keeps firing into the wall in front of him.Reporting does nothing as PUBG ignores everything.PUBG Corp are only intrested in hiring new artists to make new cosmetics to put in loot boxes that you have to pay to open. They roll out the excuse "the artists do not program" good for them you can make them play test the maps to find problems where there are stupid crash points for vehicles or find other bugs. Or make them redundant and hire a team to fix the damn game.It has been stated and even confirmed in interviews (or alluded to) by PUBG reps that a majority of the cheating is being carried out by Asians why not geo lock the game. Have it that if people wish to play with a friend in a different region they have to be in a group with that buddy. Even if this was only applied to regions with high cheating numbers it would be a good move forward.Cheating is rife and PUBG is slow to fix or add anything. Once there is a decent game out there similar to this I'm outta here.TL DR Tell us what new steps are coming and when to stop cheating. (We already know about the ineffectual BattleEye) What steps and when are fixes coming to stop high latency gamers especially those who use tools to introduce latency. Circle speed and damage a new solution is required. Fix spawn rate of vehicles. Fix spawn rate of weapons and attachments. End of Old Review(Negative)

review: PUBG held my interest for a pretty long time. I had a lot of fun with a squad of friends in the months after it became available in Early Access. However it's become clear that Bluehole or PUBG Corp whoever is running this show cares way more about milking the game till it dies than creating a sustainable long term game that makes them money for years to come while providing a good experience. The game breaks in new and terrible ways each update while they add more and more half overpriced skins. I've heard the new snow map is good and maybe I'll drop in and give it a go but this game just doesn't hold my interest anymore.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is better than ever but i still can't wholeheartedly recommend it.From my experience lately it seems that people who are way better than you wait around every corner. I knew i was bad but PUBG takes that and stomps me under their boot.Now i know that doens't say anything about the game so here's what i have to say on it. The combat system/whatever you wanna call it is great. I really like how the guns feel and with the new parachute rework it has become even better. There's still some things here and there that needs polishing mainly looking at the movement system and placement of some props in the game world where you think you can walk/vault but can't.As a result i keep getting incredibly frustrated at even the slightest most insignificant mistake that i make and when i eventually die i want to throw a very violent tantrum. Even though i consider myself a calm and collected person.

review: Its a love hate relationship between PUBG and myself. When first playing the game it was like nothing I had played before instantly hooking me into the battle royal genre. The early stages of this game (third person only) were truly its best the game was smoother with less fancy fluff one map and a core gameplay style. I have met friends through this game that I still play with to this day. The devs started to become slack on updates and as the game got more popular its flaws started to show. FPP is still not 100% great and feels worse that TPP performance wise. Not to mention the lack of support for the OCE region. At one point it was unplayable because of a server PUBG form which we heard nothing from the devs. I took about a six month break from this game only coming back for the Sanhok and Vikendi maps both which were great additions. I still play now and again with mates as its great to squad up and relive those great memories. Would reccomend.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG mechanics wise is the best competitive battle royale in the market. The thing is the devs really like screwing up their own game and for the last months the game was in a really bad state rubberbanding matchmaking issues lackluster ranked system no progression bad optimization.Now after one year since the original release the game finally seems to be getting the correct developments. The new update that adds the map Vikendi is proof of that and the new battle pass rewards are pretty good. With now four maps and excellent gunplay this is the best time to get the game.You still have need a good computer to run it tho. If you want a stable framerate I recommend a GTX 1050 Ti at least.

review: Unfortunately slightly unplayable for me.I play left handed on the mouse so I use arrow keys. Hold breath and zoom are permanently bound to left shift with no way to rebind them. So I basically can't zoom in or hold my breath.... A big part of the shooting mechanic broken by one simple setting. Also the performance is slightly crap feel some mouse lagg like I have smoothing on or something. It's basically as laggy as a highly popular Arma 3 server that hasn't reset in a week.Will change my review when/if they fix this. But being released in early access means they have no insentive to make this a good game they already got money for it.Edit They did end up fixing this issue. Good game gets boring after a couple hours though.

review: As somone who has been playing since its early versions before climbing was a thing in pubg i can say its fun and the game has improved dramatically over the past year gunplay is great and fluid the sound design in the game is incredibly good the game runs pretty good at high settings on my setup with no noticible frame drops while there is plenty of content now i still find it annoying that most content like cosmetics are locked behind a pay wall and the game does not reward players enough for there accomplishments giving out very little Battlepoints for winning somthing that i believe needs to be addressed. after playing for hundreds of hours over the course of a year and a half at this point i find even using my BP to be pointless since most of the crates in the game contain unispiring loot and some are locked crates which require a bought key which are over priced. occasionally i will buy a new weapon skin if it looks good. but only because they are basically limited edition and are only avalible for a limited time. but most times i just dont bother. other than that its a fun game playing solo but it really shines as a coop game with your freinds finding a cheater in the game has become less of a problem now than when it was in its beta and early days so dont let that deter you other than that its great and i recommend it!my pc specs CoolerMaster H500p CaseCoolermaster MasterAir MA610p CPU CoolerMSI z270 SLI Plus MotherBoardi5 7600k 4.7ghz CPUNvidia GTX 1060 6GB EVGA Single Fan Graphics CardCorsair 600 Watt PSU16 GB Corsair Vengeance Ram 2400Mhz2 m.2 nvme Drives and 2 Two Terabyte barracuda HHD'sASUS VG248QE 24" Full HD 1920x1080 144Hz 1ms HDMI Gaming MonitorAverage FPS in Pubg 80 90

review: The concept of this game is excellent and after a fairly glitchy early release it's finally at a decent level of playability now in 2018. However the amount of cheats/hackers/scum bags using impossible aim mods and getting ridiculously impossible kills is appauling. Its a massive kick in the guts when you gear up and move from cover to cover surviving and looting only to be head shot at 200 meters with an uzi by some player with a Chinese sounding name who was firing from the hip. Or tons of other obvious hack related kills whether the player doesn't have line of site but cleans up your whole team with one magazine or their aiming reticle snaps on to you with t precision. Not to mention when you see a squad run past you so fast you cannot aim or change position fast enough to have a competetive chance at defending their attack. As soon as the dev team sort out the cheaters/hackers i'll change my rating to recommended. Until then save your $30 and a lot of frustration.**edit Nov 2018. The game is running really well now. A few minor hiccups here and there but nothing that really detracts from you experience. The Hackers are still present albeit not as common. The map hack where the cheats can see all people on the map seems to be the one I encounter the most. I'm enjoying this game again and would recommend it just keep reporting the hackers when you find them.

review: So after 11 hours on record I think it's time to share my first opnion of the game.First of all DON'T trust the official system requirements at the current state of the game. I've got a 780Ti and an i5 3570k and have to play it on low settings to have a more or less fluid experience. I don't wanna know how it runs on systems lower than mine.GameplayThe gunplay is extremely fun. It doesn't feel like you are shooting with an Airsoft or Super Soaker. You actually have to control your shots and can't spray down everything that moves over a range of 500 meters. The feeling when you've placed a good shot is extremely satisfying. I love the fact that they are going for blood effects instead of hit markers of which I am not a big fan of.The movement is OK but not exactly what I would call direct. If you're running and wanna strave left to right it can feel a little bit spongy. So it's not that easy to avoid shots like in Arma.The vehicles are fun to drive except of the alternative physics which may take control over you from time to time (happens not that often).Performance/GraphicsAs I said the performance is not the best at the current state but absolutely playable (with my rig). I get about 40 70 FPS depnding on the location and how much action is going on.If your system fits with the minimum system requirements I would wait until they've optmized the game.The graphics are good on high and disgusting on low. Don't have a lot to say about that.SoundThe gun sounds are accurate and they make you feel like you've got something powerful in your hands. It's easy to locate where a shot was coming from as easy it is to locate where steps are coming from. Overall the atmosphere in this game is pretty immersive and you'll your pants when a shot miss you by a few centimeters.ConclusionIf you have decent PC and you've liked DayZ Arma or something smilar to that I can totally recommend you this game.Alone it's fun with a friend or in a squad it's amazing.EDITAfter 500+ Hours on record I am still enjoying this game and I really want to recommend it but there are things I just can't get over. To make it short Blue Hole sues Epic Games for "stealing" their idea of Battle Royale Releasing an unplayable version for XBOX to grab some sweet extra cash Game still suffers from massive FPS and netcode problems even 6 months after the 1.0 release removing weather for performance reasons and don't patch it back in on the main maps for several months now Not implementing a reasonable map selection. You are forced to queue up for Miramar AND Erangel even though the vast majority doesn't like Miramar. The loot is laughable at times. It's a tactical shooter not a survival game in my opinion.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Do you find yourself a jaded gamer? Have you started to think video games are going downhill and getting worse? well they are and pubg is proof of that but there's a bright side.PUB G is the game to make you appreciate all other games it runs so poorly the visuals are so dated the gameplay so boring... When you load up a real game you will be in awe at just how smooth everything is how great the visuals are how much fun you're having with friends. PUBG Is so bad it makes other games better. If you enjoy games where they just suck this is for you. The shooting feels good but you can't really give a shooter points for shooting well. That's like high fiving the chicken because the egg tastes like an egg it's stupid.Ontop of how much this game just sucks so ing much they have made it so that if 3 people in NA queue with a friend in China it puts us all on Chinese servers effectively meaning I can't play games on the internet with a friend on the other side of the world.

review: Personally i dont like it. But i can see the fun that people will have. Tbh the developers treats this game like a free to play game *cough fortnite *cough monetization. They focusses more on sueing everybody that has either a frying pan or battle royale name in their games. I got bored after 4 hours of playing. Yes i know the encounters online is different everytime as you meet different people. I regret buying it cause this game is the living embodiment of why i dont like online games. "But the competition is very intense" yet i hid in the middle of the circle till there was only 5 ppl left. The more people realises that they can hide and just wait till only a very few players are left and kill the last player the more people should know how boring it is."You should go out then and shoot everybody u meet" the higher chance you will die. Basically the game is fly down an airplane get weapon and armor and survive till you are number one. "Git gud" yea I'm not going to pour hundreds or even thousands of hours in a game where it is the same everytime and gets old real quick. Not yet the poor optimisation and performance this game has. This game's aim is to be no.1 not the most kills. But if u like battle royale I aint judging.

review: update 11/25/18 although slow and sometimes in a bewildering way bluehole has finally dialed in the core mechanics and systems to where it should have been back in january at the launch. many bugs have been ironed out the general visual and audio quality has been improved and there is a decent variety in terms of weapons and environments.but most importantly the two 800 lbs gorillas in the room have been mostly mitigated. im speaking about cheating and desync of course. also known as the chinese problem. there was a time a few months ago when a large majority of the population on north american servers were playing from china and a not insignificant amount of them were using various hacks. this was especially true on the third person servers and they were slowly but surely creeping into first person as well.but aggressive anti cheat tactics coupled with soft locking regions has done a very good job of corralling an out of control situation. sure you will still encounter hackers and chinese players but it is much more rare than before when it was literally every match. even desync has been improved by a seemingly random fix to a line of code dealing with player movement prediction. the game is quantitatively better now than it was at relese.but i fear it might be too little too late. it isnt uncommon to see 100 150k players concurrently during peak times in america which is a far cry from the 1+ million earlier this year. the bad communication and bizarre choices coupled with a seemingly slow response by the developer to fix glaring issues has definitely left a lasting impact on the player count. it doesnt help that all the big shooters have shown up to siphon off people who are either bored or fed up with the gameit can also be pretty rough coming in as a bright eyed newbie still learning the ropes only to have some grizzled veteran with 1000+ hours under their belt show up and butcher you. pubg corp has made enough money off the sale of the game itself and have been making plenty off of cosmetic item sales. it would be a smart move to remove the cost of entry and go f2p. otherwise i have doubts the game will last long enough to see its 2 year anniversaryold review follows8 Dthe game in concept is great.the implementation is a ing joke.the chinese playerbase needs to be region locked to chinese servers. theyve flooded north american servers taking advantage of lag and desync.there is also rampant hacking with battle eye saying theyre banning as many as 20 000 players every day. a large majority of those accounts are from chinathen theres the massive security hole in their front end as outlined here https //medium.com/ fsufitch/playerunknowns battlegrounds main menu is vulnerable to hacking d483b00a7036bluehole seems like a developer who hit the jackpot with their game but are either wholly incompetent or just dont care to fix the huge issues their runaway success has brought them.update for 1.0 release the game itself is better. the vaulting mechanic is nice. the replay feature is very cool. it is better optimized. the sound design has been positively tweaked.and the game is still overrun with hackers mostly of the chinese variety. theyve become even more bold seeing how bluehole or whatever they call themselves now are completely incompetent at solving the cheating problem. the game is rife with players sporting chinese or complete nonsense names strings of letters or awful engrish words combined with random numbers. and a large amount of them are hacking.the hacking is so out of control that the pieces of filth hackers have to watch out for each other. paying 500 yuan to get yourself an esp is no guarantee of a win anymore since the sitting in the pc cafe across the street is also running an esp in the same match youre in. so the hackers arent blatantly running around in the open. they have to approach every fight as if it might be on equal footing.but where does that leave us the honest players? ed thats where. i hope you enjoy being killed over and over by impossible shots then having someone shout slurs at you in chinese because youre a stupid american pig playing in your stupid american server how dare you.its a sad state of affairs and the only recourse is to hope that come feburary the chinese government follows through with their threat of shutting down access to the game and forcing the chinese to play on whatever turd tencent forces out of their instead. let them hack against one another and leave the rest of the world free of the chinese pubg flu

review: I'll be honest I don't know where to start with this game. First off it *could* be fun.. but it's really not. Well I mean it's fun to die because that way you can quit the game without raging mid game. PUBG is a walking simulator at heart. You're lucky to find decent guns in the first few minutes (it happens but not always). Most of the time you'll find great weapons and get killed by another player or because you did 20 MPH over a small hill in a truck and it flipped ten times in the air. If you happen to land far away from the circle plan on walking and dying from being outside the circle. Why? Not nearly enough vehicles spawn in the game. Now if you do happen to get a vehicle it is somehow the loudest thing in the entire game so everyone on the map will see you and snipe you with a pistol because the netcode for this game is absolutely horrendous. (Look up PUBG 60Hz Tickrate Update 14 Netcode Analysis on youtube). Not only is the game netcode insanely unstable and inconsistent but good luck at running this game at a stable frame rate. Even on my system with 64GB of ram i7 6800k and a 1080 video card I get the frame drops.The graphics are a completely different story. PUBG's developers bought everything from the Unreal Asset store. I'm not ragging against this at all because it's a great place to start. Now "bluecraphole" is worth millions but they still use assets from the store. Really? The trees look like pure crap bushes do not properly render off in the distance so they look like players. Overall this game can be very fun at times but most of the time it is boring. It's the same grind every round listen to people yell stupid crap while on the plane hope you land fast enough maybe find a gun shoot someone in the face but die because the person is playing with 1500 ping. Let's not even get started on how bad first person mode is. I can't recommend this game. I play it when extremely bored but overall this game deserves a 0/10. It has possible potential but the developers are more interested in suing Epic over Fortnite than fixing their own game. For unreal engine it is not only the ugliest game but the most poorly optimized.I recommend staying away and letting BlueCrapHole fall apart. The devs have no clue what they are doing.

review: Third Update Go play Ring of Elysium if you want a BR right now.Second Update No longer fun and a cashgrab. Still needs optimization.Update Still better than Fortnite.Best battle royale game to date. The developer is very invested in his own game and game mode he created (A tv show had the idea first but he didn't know at the time). Important fixes such as network lag happen within the day. Many people may complain about the speed of development. It's a very small team and they are doing their best to make a great game. Ignore these reviews if you and your friends have competent systems to run this game you'll enjoy it. It just takes 4 to have a great time. Solos are fun but lonesome. Duos are fun but squads are where you get the drama!

review: I have mixed feelings about this game. I started playing on my friend's account (all hail Steam Share) mostly because of my friends already playing decided to give it a try when it was in the Early Access. Then eventually I bought my own copy on sale.After all that time this is what I have to say (don't worry I'll try to keep it TL DR) Pros no covers/forts coming out of nowhere you either run away or look for cover (I don't blame people who like this mechanic I personally don't) realistic ish feeling when shooting (though it does take some time to get used to how ballistics work in this game) really big maps (well planned too) constant feeling of danger lots of weapons and attachments (and the list is still getting longer)Cons OPTIMIZATION (I mean I know my graphic card is below minimum even though barely but the game's performance has been varying from "average" to "terrible" and to "average" again for quite some time also EVERYTHING else is top class in my PC so where does it even come from? not mentioning the fact that I saw some powerful rigs being slowed down) cheaters (while I'm not 100% sure I met one of them I did witness some questionable plays) money grab (premium pass loot boxes etc. really Bluehole? really?) bugs bugs bugs (just on my first day I encountered 6 bugs ranging from minor to major up until today I encountered 2 more and I expect the list to be even longer) rushed releases with new content (Vikendi for example while the map looks good it's literally the most unplayable one due to its terribly poor optimization)Would I recommend this game? Yes but only if you don't like cartoon ish style of Fortnite and similar games you don't mind somewhat realistic ish gameplay you have a computer capable of running this game on stable 60 fps (or at least 30 whatever settings you choose) you don't mind dying with no kills (i.e. sniper kill or some bad luck) you don't mind mild boredom (matches with little to no fights)Even then only consider buying the game on some sale. This is what I did and I'm still not sure whether it was the right thing. Don't even look at it if it's not on sale as paying full price for the game in its current state is definitely not worth it.FINAL VERDICT 7/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've had a love/hate relationship with PUBG for the longest time but I think I can finally safely say that this is the best shooter ever made. Sure it's still quite buggy and sure it has rough patches in both look and feel that aren't present in similar AAA games but the core gameplay is amazing and just better than what you get in other games. And the developers have made great strides towards polishing this game up throughout the last year not to mention how much content they've added.Even after playing shooters for over 2 decades this game made me relearn how to play them I bought bigger mouse pads I lowered my sensitivity I changed how I held the mouse I bought a 144hz monitor I bought my first ever state of the art setup rather than buy whatever was the current "best bang for your buck" all because I wanted to improve in PUBG because it's so challenging and because it really feels amazing to see that you're improving at the game.My biggest wish for the game now is that they expand upon and improve upon the custom game mode maybe even introduce the mod support they teased before launch. Like I said the game's core gameplay is second to none so if we were able to create new game modes around it and do more with it then I feel this game will rival the greats like Half Life and Warcraft 3 in terms of long term impact.Edit Also wanted to that that in my nearly 1000 hours in this game I've encountered cheaters less than 10 times. This is playing EU FPP. I'm saying this because there are so many complaints about cheating in this game and I don't share that opinion at all.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. I dont understand.I saw one of JackFrags' new videos and in that video he was playing PUBG on the new map. It was running great and I know he has some duel rtx 2080ti intel core i9 extreme setup or some crap but HEY IT LOOKS FUN so why not give it a shot?It ran really bad. At the menu screen I would get an avg 120 fps which is nice an all but what really matters is how much fps I get while playing the game. It was so weird In the plane I would get a good 70 100 fps but the closer I got to the ground my frames would just fall. (10 58)Even on the lowest settings I cant get anything higher than 60 fps and no VSYNC is not on. Then after all this bull crap I thought to myself this just isn't a fair game. Its not a fair game because people that have a decked setup like JackFrags get no lag or delay or fps drops and can kill you so easily! they don't know how good they have it. But then what they don't realize is that half the people they're killing have medium to low spec setups which makes it nearly impossible to react fast enough to fight back. Now i'm no PUBG master but I feel as though I would perform A TON BETTER if I didn't get bad fps studder etc. I'm officially uninstalling now Frankly I don't care what new map they add or new sanhok vindeki pass they add OR what new useless attachment they add to the guns. Im done. Goodbye Player Unknowns Battlegrounds.

review: Hi the game is as you certainly already heard a complete record breaking one. I am not surprised at this as it has a unique feel to it and really involves the player. Although there is not much to win in games apart from cosmetics you can also pick during a game it never gets boring. Surpringsly this game doesnt really need a reward system apart from leaderboards to be interesting I could play this game for hours and then come back on the next day to play again. It is especially fuun with friends as you struggle to stealthily move towards the center of the map to find good fighting/camping positions. I would strongly suggest buying this game if you are looking for an enjoyable shooter/survival experience that keeps you interestet.the price is totally okay normally I dont like to spend more than 20 bucks on a game i dont know but I took a risk this time and it was worth it.some cons exist and I would like to list them to keep the review from beeing one sided. Performance as most people point out the game is very hard to run on decent graphics. I have a gtx 970 that can run most games from 2017 at almost peak perfomance (Titanfall 2 battlefield 1 etc.) this is of course partially because this isnt a triple A titel and in early acces but the game is incredibly unstable and crashes 2 out of 10 games sometimes more but luckily only at the start of rounds. The performance issues go so far that I cannot even run my firefox to listen to some music. So maybe you should wait with buying if you have a weak pc or buy and test it and order a refund if it doesnt work. Dev might be unreliable althou really active the dev promised no paid content before release and he published a limited time offer crate with real money cost on keys. This mightbe a sign of unreliability and many people got upset about it. I can only hope that the game stays away from paid content but no one can garantie so be careful about this.thx.Muhbautzedit the developers are the most undeserving s of all time. They don't even complete their game and bring out in game purchases. As if that weren't enough they now release a 10 dollar dlc. Instead of working on their buggy game they just want more money. I say destroy their buiseness and absoluteley dont buy the game. edit2 This year has only reinforced my postition on this game. I would refund this game a hundred times. They tried to copy fortnite this time. There are now premium season passes. They seem to forget that fortnite is actually free in the first place. Now this is a 30 euro game that has microtransactions and in which you need to pay to even get the least of rewards out of a game.

review: Update 2 After 374 hous of gameplay. They took away the option to choose the map. The animation while pulling the parachute is more fluent while the whole other game is more laggy. The performance got worse.I do not recommend this game.Update 1 After 351 hours of playing this game. They gave us back the free choice of which map we want to play. It still has its flaws. For me personally it is more fun than it is frustrating.I recommend this game.Original review TL DR My review is a warning shot towards PUBG just like all the other negative reviews lately. I enjoyed this but think twice before you get this game. You may have fun a long time with this you may have not. I liked this game very much.First of all I've been enjoying this game very much and I won't stop playing this for now.My problem are the little disappointments that came over and over again eventhough I haven't played the early access. I purchased this game five months ago and I've been playing 250 hours so far. Considering that I also play other games PUBG took a lot of my gaming free time. Because I like this game very much generally speaking. But still there are little things which were annoying. At the time I got this game is was out of early access. Back then we didn't have a map choosing option. It was okay for me because both maps were new. Then they gave us that option and lately they took it away from us. At least halfways. I mean we can choose between the large and the small maps but if we want to play the large maps we can't choose which one of them we want to play and it is totally random. Then they give us an option to buy an event pass so we have the chance to complete missions. Nice idea but it doesn't make the game better. As far as I understood we are not even allowed to keep all of the skins we can get with this event pass. Some are some super expensive things which are gone after a certain amount of days. Please correct me if I am wrong.There are more little things I didn't like. But yeah... Like I said I liked this game so far. It was fun and I will continue playing. I hope all the negative reviews will make the developer or the publisher (or whoever is in charge of that) think. The downside of this is... If the negative reviews kill the community because nobody is purchasing the game anymore the game will die. Nobody wants this to happen. So I hope for the best.I do not recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Have fun never finding guns and then being shot in the head by chinese hackers. Unless you actually have hacks your bullets don't hit due to bugs and other glitches. Game crashes after every single match. Maybe fix your game and don't release a mobile version. The desert map is horrible. The game could be amazing but the refusal to fix obvious bugs and prevent cheating is killing it for me.. It randomly kicks me into the Asia servers I noticed. I'm not sure what happened to the sound recently but it randomly just doesnt do footsteps.Also why does every gun start in single fire?!?!? That is the stupidest thing I have ever seenGave this game a while (about a year) and tried it again. Same problems.

review: I own H1Z1 i own the culling... i tried many different BR games but this still remains the best there is right now IMHO! The game has it's flaws like the vehicles physics game optimization that goes heavy even on my high end pc people from other servers zones that come in the europe one and lag... People complain about this and that but they don't know what it's been on H1Z1 (no updates laggy servers nothing new till they realized they were losing players) and that the game is been out for about 5 months and they made more foward leaps than any other early access i own that were out there for years! come on guys don't be just cause you have problems we all have the same issues in the game but we aren't y like you (oh and chinese fellows it's not our fault your socialist goverment censors your internet so get a grip and stay out of our servers)05/06/2018 fix the cheater problems and you're good to go24/12/2018 the games runs really good (some frame drops here on there but on ultra settings) and the content is really good! 4 maps new weapons and you get in game drops if you level up! i'm really happy they got it back together and that there aren't so many cheaters as before
